headline: It's scammer
reviewBody:
It's scammer 

I started the CIPD L&D unfortunately with ICS. For couple months ago there's no adviser, no materials to review, literally empty website! It's just book titles that you need to order online!

Also all advisers are on vacation and never show up, never help you, & never ask you about your progress !

It's literally an empty website with no thing to study! all students are doing copy & Paste for the old students exercises & assessments!

I have opened case (Case # 138072) to refund my money and they reject my request because they know I can't go to UK to sue them but I will.

I'll keep posting this in LinkedIn to make people aware of this scammer empty platform!

UPDATE: The customer service responses are contradicting to what in the ICS community platform. So please read the comments before your subscribe to the service and ends up writing new negative comment here.

headline: I enrolled for the CIPD Level 5 course…
reviewBody:
So everyone can see the response from ICS to me below about how my concerns are being dealt with.  Just to clarify my concerns were first raised in February, the errors in the learning programme and presenting materials are still there. My last email was received on the 24th May 2021 at 21:29. I responded to that e mail both to tutors and student services. Still no response back, still no consideration for their students and clearly the response below shows that the customer service is simply token.

My advice if you are thinking of an online course ? Find a reputable company who understand the importance of teaching and learning. Don`t use ICS. 


I enrolled for the CIPD Level 5 course in February 2021. The sign up was fairly straightforward.
Considering that this is a Human resources qualification, there seems to be very little consideration given to learning needs.  The quality of course content is poor with several spelling and grammatical errors which disrupt the learning process. The Webinars are also of a very poor quality and focused on how to put together an assignment rather than teaching the subject itself.  Upon complaining about this (providing slide details and directing to the page) I received a reply stating that I had not provided enough information for them to look into.  I then found that on the APPLY section which is a self check question and answer on the subject that answers stated as correct were actually wrong, THIS WAS LATER CONFIRMED BY ICS.
Four months on the feedback received has been that they will review and fix the errors but wont say when they expect to do this by. As a student I am being asked to study materials which the provider has confirmed are wrong and wont let me know when they will be right.
Put this into basic terms, go to Costa pay for a coffee and then stand there and see how long you are prepared to wait as the barista gives you a cup and tells you they will get round to putting some coffee in it when they can be bothered to.
The course is 18 months, they offered no real apology or solution but did say I could have an extra two months to finish the course, which considering I had planned to complete in 12months is obviously irrelevant.
I am sure having looked at other ICS responses that there will be a comment of we cant find your details.  If anyone want I am happy to post comments from the student forums with the same feedback regarding course content and access.
This is a course costing 2.5k. If I presented similar materials at work I`d be quite rightly being performance managed under capability.

headline: Bookkeeping Level 2 review
reviewBody:
I have spent the last 5 months studying with ICS Learn on the Bookkeeping Foundation Level 2 Course.  I passed both course units yesterday after around 70 hours of study.  It’s the first online qualification I have received.  I found their videos didn’t add to the other resources available,  I didn’t watch many, likewise the live sessions.  Some of the learning material seemed a bit clunky but they said they are aware and working on improving it.  The tutor I was assigned was very supportive and consistently prompt to respond via both the course communication portal and email.  I sometimes found responses needed some work before I gleaned the clarification I wanted.  It’s just not as easy as having a real live teacher with you.  But I didn’t need to resort to a phone call which was on offer.  And since I passed after putting in less than the recommended hours of work the course must be pretty good.  

I took on the bookkeeping in the small business I work for a month into this course using SAGE.  The course helped me understand some of the lingo and principles but I found the real life bookkeeping easier than the course once I was shown the ropes and into the routine.

headline: My experience with ICS was great!
reviewBody: I was deciding between two providers to ensure the best route of study, the CIPD Advisor I dealt with was so patient and understanding. They were ready to answer any questions I had (there were a lot!) and replied quickly which I appreciated. I would definitely recommend ICS Learn to anyone.

Very friendly and informative when making initial phone call to study through ICS.
Would highly recommend!

headline: Read before looking at the positive reviews
reviewBody:
Let me start with the positives. The course setup process was quick and efficient and i got tremendous support from the tutors in the first two units of the old course and i was able to complete and pass both the units comfortably however CIPD has introduced new courses from March 2021 but we did not get any update on when the new courses will be updated on their system until May. Even till now they have not updated the one specialist and optional unit and i have no choice but to wait without any information on when these courses will become accessible.

Also their has been a tremendous decline in the quality of their Q&A sessions since the new courses have been released which was never a problem before. Basically the tutor just reads the power point word by word and does not even make the slightest effort to explain the questions and what is actually been asked of us. I raised this issue with them and they told me that someone from their management will get back to me within 10 working days. It has been now more then a month and no one has bothered to contact me.

We were told that the feedback to our draft assessment will be provided in five working days and for the first two subjects i was able to get a response in five days however i have submitted a draft assessment for one of the new units eight days ago and have not still not received any response on it. They do not make the effort to communicate with the students and do not care about their experience. I do think most of the positive reviews here are on their sign up experience as they ask us to rate them when they send us the sign up email which in my personal opinion is misleading and a very wrong practice.

headline: Amazing
reviewBody: Amazing service resulting in me being setup on the course within 20 minutes

headline: I would have put 2/5 stars
reviewBody:
I would have put 2/5 stars, but wouldn't allow me, I found the course really good and enjoyed it, I would have completed this a lot sooner if I had not come across issues after issues, 
1. when I started the course we didn't have a support tutor, where I was getting feedback from my main tutor within the time frame since you introduced the support tutor it became very frustrated to get an answer back within the time frame, then having to send off our assessment which would take 10days or even more which in my case on or two Units it was 14days, also the tutor that was assigned to me in Unit 4 would never answer any of my question through pebble pad which again a platform was not friendly users, if I had not set up a WhatsApp group with some students I don't think I would have got any help from Tutor Support/Tutors, also with the online classes we found that even though its suppose to be an hour-long we found that in fact it was a lot shorter the last one I attended last 25mins, we were like WOW that's that the quickest one ever, I never attended any more online classes and went by the slides,  I  came across two Tutors who went out of the way and beone to help and they came back within 3 working days with our assessment, and even answer back on pebble pad, i couldn't thank them enough, which i did personally,  The student forum i more of a complaint then a help others, which i think should be looked at, I can honselty say without support from my family/friends/work colleague i would have not carried on with ICS.

headline: A* service!

A* service!

headline: CIPD Level 5 Diploma - L&D with ICS Learn - great service
reviewBody: From the moment I enquired about the CIPD courses, Ciaran McEachen worked with me to find out which course fitted my current experience best and answered my many and various questions. He displayed a good understanding of what I was looking for and to help allowed me to look at the site through a guest username to get a fuller idea of what I would be committing to. Great service, a good company and he followed up regularly which I really appreciated. Sometimes we need a nudge to make that final decision.

headline: Thank you!
reviewBody: Starting a course was scary for someone like me who hadn’t studied since school, getting your head around learning again can sometimes take time but the tutors were more than happy to help. I lost my brother unexpectedly, whilst I was half way through my course and obviously struggled to get back into learning. ICS Learn were really supportive and understood that I needed more time. Because they gave me that time I was able to get my course finished. I am so grateful! Thank you.

headline: You won’t regret it!
reviewBody:
I thoroughly enjoyed my studies through ICS learn, as an international online student, I found the portal easy to navigate and tutors easy to contact for any help I needed. 
The course was flexible enough that I was able to manage my workload through my emigration to Scotland as well as working a full time job! 
I recommend ICS Learn for anyone who is looking to improve themselves and their confidence!

headline: Westing your time and money

Your tutor will answer in 2 days if you lucky, what king of explanation will give you on email,(just ask your self) I bet until someone will answer you, you will find the answer somewhere else online. Do not waste your money, pay 20% more and go for classroom you will remember me.

headline: Overall very happy with the course…
reviewBody:
Overall very happy with the course having recently passed L5. If you are self-motivated and happy to study online with minimal involvement from other people then this is for you.

I would rate 4.5 if it were possible, the only reason I wouldn't give a full 5 is because occasionally the course materials had typos in them or seemed a few years out of date - this wasn't much of a problem but worth mentioning. 

The tutors/support were always friendly and helpful on the occasions that I did contact them, which wasn't very often.

headline: Absolutely amazing
reviewBody:
Absolutely amazing, tutors and customer service staff have always been very responsive and friendly which made my studying a lot easier!
Thank you very much for everything!

headline: Very pleased
reviewBody: I am quite an independent learner so ICS Learn was perfect for me as i could study and do the assignments in my own time rather than having set deadlines. I thought the webinars were really useful and the amount of content provided for each module was great! One thing i found difficult was a lot of the webinars were scheduled during the day and sometimes none for the evening which was quite hard where i work full time so i could only ever watch the recordings. I also think it was better having a different tutor per module rather than one tutor for everything. I would definitely recommend using ICS learn to anyone that is looking into studying :)

headline: Great advice and help
reviewBody:
Since I was really confused with how to go about with the course, you helped in giving me information about the course which made it less confusing and also I understood the course better. You have always been available for any queries and help that I needed at anytime. Overall my process has been very good and I am happy to finally start my course. 
Thank you so much:D

headline: Excellent service

headline: CIPD level 5 Human Resources
reviewBody: I've now completed 2 qualifications with ICS and both experiences have been very good, the lecturers are helpful and knowledgeable. Some lecturers are better than other in terms of delivering the online classes, I assume this would be the case with all learning providers. I would recommend

headline: Liars!
reviewBody:
So I thought I needed more qualifications for my future career and I was wrong due to current qualifications. So I contact ICS baring in mind I had already paid them £100. I had not started the course and decided to contact them 2 days after the 14 days knowing, ok I have lost my £100 but they have a nerve to charge me another £100 to cancel and threaten me with credit control. It is not on credit I did not have a credit agreement nor did I sign one! 
Bad company do not use!

headline: Amazing Customer Service
reviewBody: I have just enrolled to do a foundation certificate in accounting. The service I have recieved, so far, is impeccable. Anne-Marie has been in regular contact with me and responds back to my emails incredibly fast. I was skeptical about signing up to an online course but she has made me feel confident enough to go for it. Thank you for helping me in starting my career!

headline: Brilliant service from Fraser
reviewBody: Brilliant service from Fraser, nothing was too much trouble. He was very helpful and knowledgeable and answered all my queries fully. Cant thank you enough for helping me enrol

headline: very good service
reviewBody: I decided to contact ICS to do some courses, and i am glad i did choose them. spoke with a chap called Paul who was very polite, friendly and and above all very helpful. great service and recommended to do your studies with these.

headline: Highly recommended
reviewBody: Very helpful staff would like to mention Paul especially definitely made the right choice chosing this training organisation.

The Course Advisor I spoke to initially to both advise and to find out more about the course I wanted to do (Paul O'Rourke) was extremely helpful.  I feel confident that if I receive the same level of helpfulness and professionalism with the course all will go well!

headline: The process was very simple.

headline: Thanks Dominic!
reviewBody: I've struggled to make time since the start of lockdown to do any home learning and ICS have been amazing. Not only have they extended my support period twice free of charge, but the top up fees to further extend it are very reasonable. Dominic, who I spoke to today, was friendly and offered a quick resolution to my problem. Thanks again!

After the enrolment, he also followed up about how I go with everything about the online learning. I am reassured by him that there will be different supports about my learning journey. Thank you very much.

reviewBody: I have been very happy with the way i have been supported by Fraser since my initial enquiry through to enrolment. Every question i had was answered efficiently and although I felt I may have been a pain asking so many questions Fraser's answers assured me i wasn't. Thank you so much!

Since this is my first such learning experience I had loads of questions before enrolling and she has been truly amazing, knowledgeable, and very helpful with my start of the course and explaining how to approach my upcoming new challenges. I fully recommend their services

headline: Good

headline: Ciaran was helpful
reviewBody: Ciaran was helpful, informative and made the process of starting the course a great experience.

headline: Enrollment
reviewBody: Anne Marie McGarry helped me to enroll on AAT Course. She’s very friendly and ready to give very helpful answers to all doubts.

headline: Helpful and easy process by Fraser.
reviewBody:
Fraser was super helpful throughout the whole process. He answered all my questions in a short period of time and was incredibly flexible to answer my calls during my work schedule. 

He addressed all my concerns and made me realise this was the right choice to go ahead with for my career. He also helped me plan the right programme for my current level of experience. After completing the set up Fraser has since reached out to me to ask if I need any further help. Overall really impressed by the professionalism.

headline: Great Customer Service Experience
reviewBody: It was an all round great customer service experience. I received, clear, informative and very helpful instruction throughout the registration process. Very very professional indeed!

headline: helpful
reviewBody: I did express my interes to study HR CIPD with ICS Learn .Michelle got back to me quick ,she answered to my questions and explained me well the next steps.

headline: Not a good training provider
reviewBody: This service is not worth the high price point. Their recorded lessons are hard to hear and have disruptions such as dogs barking and are not engaging at all. You could probably find better on YouTube! I have previously written two complains to ICS about their recorded lessons. Their live stream lessons are at inconvenient times for workers so I was never able to attend. Their resources are no more useful than a text book and they don’t provide any exam technique tips. Once enrolled I was barely contacted by ICS or teachers about my progress. It is not worth the high price point and frankly I expect compensation. The service is not useful and I would recommend using a text book which you can download onto your pc.

headline: My first contact with ICS/CIPD
reviewBody:
My first contact with ICS/CIPD was with Michelle Kerr.
She has always been available for me as CIPD Advisor, to provide all information I needed, on a timely manner. She was very courteous and professional and gave me a very good impression of the organization for which she works for.

headline: enrolment  was never so easy
reviewBody: enrolment  was never so easy, its helps lot people who can not afford to pay full amount 100%. Nicola, the lady who I spoke to enrol to this course  ,she was  brilliant very helpful and very polite. So far I'm very happy.

headline: Registration process is simple
reviewBody: Ciaran answered my questions quickly and got me registered for my course. So far I'm impressed with the setup and support available.

headline: Very good learning provider
reviewBody:
I started studying with ICS after a friend recommended them and i cant thank them enough for being so supportive and accommodating when my health caused me to put my studying in hold; they were very easy to talk to. I found the tutors very friendly and helpful and I highly recommend using the student forum to talk to other students and ask questions, there is definitely information and other students on there to help you. 
Studying with ICS definitely requires a lot of self motivation, but it is that much more rewarding when you do complete your course; I'm feeling very proud of myself and greatful for online learning providers like ICS for helping me achieve my goals.

headline: My advisor was very helpful and…
reviewBody: My advisor was very helpful and informative throughout :)

headline: I am happy with my learning experience…
reviewBody: I am happy with my learning experience with ICS. The Instructors are very knowledgeable and professional. Both Tutor support and customer service are also excellent.

headline: ICS Level 5 Associate Diploma
reviewBody: I dealt with Michelle during my enrolment process. She was very helpful, easy to deal with, and responded promptly to any questions on my end.

headline: Due to COVID illness
reviewBody: Due to COVID illness I, unfortunately, could not keep up with my studies as I would have wanted.  I asked Dominic for advice and a price guide to extending my student support and he very kindly allowed me 3 months extension as a goodwill gesture.  This has completely lifted a weight off my shoulder and I can't wait to get started again. Thank you so much Dominic

headline: ICS Level 5 CIPD - need to be happy to work alone
reviewBody: The structure of the Level 5 CIPD course suited me; I was able to study at my own pace and in my own time.  I was fortunate that I did not need much help from tutors but when I did, response time could be erratic.  Some of the course material information needs to be updated (for example, information relating to Brexit) but in general, the course met my expectations and I'm extremely glad that I did it!

headline: On the whole the support was good.
reviewBody:
Overall, in the initial stages support from ICS Learn tutors was great and they came back with a timely response. I really liked that the tutors who marked my essay were on hand to answer my questions ahead of me submitting each assignment. However, since approx.. September 2020 when the tutor structure changed I personally found the tutor support was very different. The tutor support changed and the tutors were not marking our assignment. Following some brief exchanges with this new tutor support structure I didn't find them particularly helpful in answering my questions. 

My constructive feedback would be to re-visit the new tutor support structure as the old structure pre-September 2020 was fantastic.

headline: Course completion
reviewBody: Clear concise responses to my question on course completion

headline: So easy to sign up
reviewBody: So easy to sign up! Sales team and tutor are nothing but friendly. I would highly recommend using ICS to anyone!

headline: My recent experience with ICS Learn was…
reviewBody:
My recent experience with ICS Learn was very positive. There is a lot of information and guidance available and over the phone support is extremely good. 
Online webinars are great point of information and lecturers are very supportive. Thank you ICS Learn for making it possible for me!

headline: Pragmatic Solutions
reviewBody: Dominic was really helpful and understanding when I requested an extension to my course. There was no quibbling, no judgement, just a pragmatic solution to help everyone. I really appreciate the support given.

headline: Very good standard of learning
reviewBody:
Really easy to navigate and use the site. I only attended the recording of classrooms as this meant I could rewind and go back over any bits of information, and therefore that feature is really useful! 
The assessors, lecturers and ICS staff were all very helpful and replied very quick to any query I had. 
Overall, I’m very impressed with the standard of learning and accessibility I had, especially with it being all online.

headline: Great service smooth and easy enrol…
reviewBody: Great service smooth and easy enrol process

headline: Very supportive staff
reviewBody:
Very supportive staff 
When ever I need any help they are always there at an email or a message distance.
Thank you very Much

headline: Great service, very prompt and friendly.
reviewBody:
Great service, very prompt and friendly.

Every step of the process has been easy and I am now working my way towards my qualification.

headline: Brilliant service
reviewBody: After my initial enquiry I received e-mail correspondence from an actual person rather than automated feedback. I was able to e-mail back and received immediate helpful responses which enabled me to sign up to the course easily and without any fuss. Highly recommend.

headline: AAT related study
reviewBody: I researched accountancy qualifications online and found ICS as a training provider.  I have found their support invaluable and having now enrolled on a programme, am impressed by the course materials and support they provide.  I hope to be able to report success within the year which would then truly add to the accolades that they would be due.

headline: I only had two tutors that were good in…
reviewBody: I only had two tutors that were good in providing feedback the others so far have been pretty awful in their coded responses back and just purely copy and paste. I am sorry to say the tutor feedback is awful and what was worse they change the submission form don't tell students then the tutor tells you in a sarcastic manner I then had to reach out for help to get the new template as this wasn't updated online. Going through all the one star ratings seems like there is a pattern..I wonder when someone will address the students feedback. Perhaps I should voice my concerns to CIPD on the accrediting a centre where the students struggle with the tutors.

headline: Support service
reviewBody: I was attended by Dominic. Excellent and efficient response.

headline: Great experience
reviewBody: Great experience so far. The whole process was easy and straightforward thanks to all the help from Anne Marie and i'm looking forward to getting going with my course.

headline: Great and responsive service
reviewBody: Great and responsive service, answered all my questions up front and was simple to get signed up and started.

headline: I am very happy to have used ICS!
reviewBody: I am very happy to have used ICS to complete my CIPD Level 3 qualification. The Student Community was easy to navigate around, the tutors and student services were very helpful and the turn around on getting feedback on my assignments was very quick! The webinars were very flexible and it wasn't a problem if you couldn't make one; they were run regularly so you could attend at another time. I will definitely look to use ICS again when completing other courses in future - thank you all for helping me to achieve my Level 3!

headline: I can really recommend ICS
reviewBody: I enrolled for CIPD Level 3 with ICS and the study experience has been great. I chose ICS for flexibility as I am working full time and I was able to manage my study time. ICS have been very accommodating and the support from the Team and the tutors has been very good. I will definitely use them again for my CIPD Level 7.

headline: I would like to thank Ciaran for her great work. She was very supportive,  helpful, patient and explained all I needed to know very clearly.
reviewBody: I am just starting my CIPD qualification but so far I me very impressed with the support and material ICS provides.

headline: ICS Learn
reviewBody: I found ICS Learn through a third party when I was looking to further my education. Paul ORourke, the person that contacted me after my enquiry, was very helpful and explained everything that was available to me should I take a course with them. I have now taken the course and I look forward to working towards getting my qualification.

headline: Excellent service
reviewBody: Excellent service,Paul help me all the issues I got for this course.very kind of you!thank you,I’m lucky I have found the right place to study:)

headline: Katy has been super helpful in…
reviewBody: Katy has been super helpful in identifying which is the most appropriate course for me and in guiding me through to enroll and organise payment. Thank you :)

headline: 5 STARS
reviewBody:
I've just completed the Online Course for the CIPD Level 3 Foundation Diploma in Human Resource Practice

Very nice course structure, useful context and extremely supportive tutors! I honestly enjoy my studies with ICSlearn. Easy to use platform and helpful student service.

A special thank you to Dr Stephen Littler!

headline: I recently took the plunge and enrolled…
reviewBody:
I recently took the plunge and enrolled onto the CIPD’s level 7 advanced diploma in Strategic People Management with ICS Learn. 

I initially enquired about this course back in January 2020 after completing level 5 with ICS. At the time I spoke to Ciaran McEachen who was really helpful and provided me with lots of useful information about the course and available payment options.

A few months later I finally decided to enrol, and Ciaran was just as helpful and professional as before! The enrolment process was really quick and easy, and the service received by Ciaran was as fantastic as always. 

A few days after enrolment Ciaran contacted me to make sure I had managed to get logged into my student account without any issues. 

Thank you so much for your help Ciaran, it has been a pleasure dealing with you!  Thanks to you and your other wonderful colleagues, choosing ICS as my learning provider again was an absolute no-brainer, and I am really looking forward to completing level 7 with ICS.

headline: Sign up experience CIPD People Management
reviewBody: I have recently signed up with ICS to study a CIPD  People Management course. The advisor I dealt with was Ciaran and he was very helpful. He answered all the questions I had thoroughly and quickly. I felt comfortable in ultimately choosing ICS to study with. I have started looking through the induction material and everything seems straightforward and relatively easy to follow so far!

headline: CIPD Level 5
reviewBody: After looking to do my CIPD training for many years I have found that ICS have made it a possibility. It was really easy to get information and get myself set up on their programme, Ciaran contacted me a day after I inquired and set me up right away! Looking forward to continuing my learning!

headline: Concise Advise
reviewBody: Concise, helpful advice - was unsure where to go on the next step and Anne Marie clearly laid out my options for going forward in my studies.

headline: Anne Marie made it so simple to enrol…
reviewBody: Anne Marie made it so simple to enrol for my AAT course, she answered all my questions so quickly and made me feel like nothing was too much trouble! Thank you Anne Marie :)

headline: Would recommend
reviewBody:
I would definitely recommend ICS to others.  It gave me the flexibility to study around my working and personal life, which you don't get with traditional forms of study.

I found the teaching staff and the support services really helpful.

My only constructive feedback would be that some of the learning content needs to be updated, I studied HR and employment law changes quickly, so they need to review the content more regularly to ensure that everything is current.

headline: Really disappointing experience
reviewBody:
Really disappointing experience, the tutor role is to send links and that's it. Only asked for help twice and when I raised the concern I was told firstly its a self directed study, then it was my question was too vague (I gave the text book, page and question), then have been told the textbook questions are hard and maybe I should work and a lower level (it was the page suggest in a lecture) and then have been told the tutor struggled to open the link I sent?? Never sent a link just a the information. So excuse after excuse for not offering the service they say to  get you to join which is supposedly  a tutor who you can call. I have complained and after 10 days of waiting I haven't heard anything!

UPDATE- still awaiting a response! Chased last week and again this week. Speak to customer service chat and am told how busy they are. They do not care, this has been so upsetting and I have never felt so belittled before.

headline: I made enquiries which were answered…
reviewBody: I made enquiries which were answered fully and very quickly, Anne Marie was a brilliant help to guide me to the correct course and go through how to enroll.  Very happy with the excellent service and communication.

headline: CIPD Level 5 in HRM
reviewBody:
I have recently completed CIPD Level 5 Diploma in HR. Personally, I really enjoyed the contents of the course. All the information was relevant and up to date. 

The support tutors usually reply in 3-5 days, which I think is a bit long, but I was never left without the answer 

Also, one more thing I was confused about the steps that need to be taken when you finish the course. I have finished all the units and I thought this information is automatically transferred to ICS, but as it turned out, I had to write to students services myself. I think the course page/dashboard is missing this essential information about what to do in the end of the course.

Other than that, I am glad that I chose ICS to complete this course

headline: Michelle Kerr is fantastic
reviewBody: Michelle was fantastic, very patient and approachable. Cleary explained all the necessary steps and wasn't pushy at all.

headline: You do not need them for AAT Level 3
reviewBody: You do not need them for AAT Level 3. All you need to pass you find in the Kaplan books and AAT website, quite upset I spent £500 on this course through them when I didn’t need it but hopefully will let others know they don’t really provide you with much else apart from 2 hour recorded sessions for each 6 modules which you could probably find similar on YouTube

headline: Paul was very helpful and informative…
reviewBody: Paul was very helpful and informative and took time to answer my questions.

headline: I really enjoyed studying through ICS
reviewBody: I really enjoyed studying through ICS. The online area was easy to understand and there was always a quick response from an advisor whenever I had a query. I would definitely recommend studying with ICS.

headline: Great course- level 5 Diploma in Management and Leadership
reviewBody:
Lots of information, well laid out, easy to follow, on-line course.
Very happy with my choice.
Tutor, introduction, quick with lots of information and what to do when you need support.

headline: Easy Sign Up
reviewBody: Easy sign up and everything was explained in full.

headline: Ciaran was very helpful
reviewBody: Ciaran was very helpful, sent me across all the information quickly and answered all my questions regarding the course.

headline: It's too soon to comment on the course…
reviewBody: It's too soon to comment on the course content yet but the service I have received when enquiring and signing up has been excellent. Nicola Dexter has been extremely helpful 👍

headline: Great guidance and excellent…
reviewBody: Great guidance and excellent communication.

headline: After initially contacting ICS several…
reviewBody: After initially contacting ICS several years ago but not feeling really to embark on my studies again just yet, they kept in regular contact and so when the time came, they were my first port of call. Anne-Marie was absolutely fantastic; helpful, informative and not at all pushy or sales-like. I honestly can’t believe how easy the process was - a 15 minute phone conversation and all my questions were answered and I was enrolled on my course. Thank you ICS and Anne-Marie in particular. If you are looking for a straightforward process and caring yet professional service - these are the people for you.

headline: I had mixed experiences with ICS for…
reviewBody:
I had mixed experiences with ICS for CIPD5. If I was to do it again I would probably choose another organisation. As preparation for the assessments in webinars you are told one thing and as feedback from Tutors you are being told something else. 
One example of this is my last assessment. I asked for advise on my CPD and PDP and was told which items I could mention based on what I had done over the past 12 months by the support tutor.
The tutor of the assessment then failed me as it was not what she wanted to hear. This has been so frustrating throughout this process. You invest time in writing these assessments and then you have to invest even more time because different tutors have different opinions on what should be included.
On the other side, some tutors have been very helpful throughout the process and their guidance was very clear.
In general I found writing 9 essays a bit lengthy, I understand this is what the CIPD is asking for, but just as some feedback, there are also other ways to learn and prove the understanding that students might enjoy more:)

headline: Great communication
reviewBody:
Great communication, Paul was so help helpful, took his time to explain any doubt I had, not only on the phone but also online .
Thanks Paul O’Rourke,

headline: Could not ask for more!
reviewBody: I have nearly finished my current course and I could not be happier with ICS Learn. My tutor Shelley has been so responsive and supportive - her feedback is always really thorough and helpful, and also encouraging. I am currently doing the Level 2 AAT and will definitely be signing up to do the Level 3 with ICS as I have had nothing but positive experiences - thank you!

headline: Signing up
reviewBody: The sign up process was extremely easy supported by contact from Ciaran who guided me through and provided all the info I needed.

headline: Nicola was really helpful
reviewBody: Nicola was really helpful, my introductory information was prompt and I felt really supported.

headline: I choose ICS Learn for the flexibility…
reviewBody:
I choose ICS Learn for the flexibility so that I can study at my own pace while working full time. All tutors were supportive and I feel very lucky to have been tutored by such inspiring and knowledgeable professionals.
The website is easy to navigate, the classes were detailed and well structured.

headline: I had the best experience enrolling…
reviewBody: I had the best experience enrolling with ICS Learn, Fraser Cameron helped me with everything and anything, all questions were answered and I much appreciated the quick responses to emails and his check in after. I’m so grateful for such a pleasant enrolment and can’t wait to get started on my educational journey. Thank you

headline: Outstanding.
reviewBody: Outstanding.

headline: Poor
reviewBody:
I started my course a while ago and can honestly say I will never be learning with ICS learn again. The interface is confusing, finding what you need is very hard and god forbid you want to contact a tutor since they changed the interface!!
I have an assessment that needs to be marked but I keep getting emails saying the tutor has left feedback and there is nothing there. 
They have 0 regard for your wellbeing either which in this day and age I find shocking. 
I've already asked for my money back and they said no. I'm really not sure what I've paid for!!!!!!!

headline: I am very pleased with how my…
reviewBody: I am very pleased with how my registration for my course with ICS Learn has been handled. I was contacted by Fraser at ICS Learn very quickly after registering my interest on the website and he has been really helpful in providing me with all the information I need to get enrolled. I can't fault any part of my enrolment, I would definitely recommend ICS Learn to anyone who is considering them as their course provider.

headline: Easiest Enrollment with very personable staff
reviewBody:
I had the easiest enrollment with ICS, Ciaran the Advisor I was speaking to, couldn't have been more helpful. Full of knowledge and a passion to assist where needed. 

It was a quick and easy set up with no end of help. Ciaran even dropped me a message a week later to make sure I wasn't having any issues and if there was anything else I needed. A service you don't see in many places nowadays. 

The student portal is so easy to use and my tutor emailed me near enough straight away. 

I would highly recommend to anyone who would like to study with ICS.

headline: Dedicated Team
reviewBody:
keeping students updated with their current inquiries, fast responses to close students inquiries and directing them to the right procedure. maintaining high quality services require dedicated team, same as ICS learn Team.

Thank you so much Debra

Ciaran asked me a few questions which led to excellent advice on which course would be best for me.   Signing up for the course was quick and easy.  I feel really confident now.

headline: Great service from ICS Learn
reviewBody: Great service from ICS Learn. Was just in time to take advantage of the special March offer on my CIPD course, which of course I was really chuffed about! A particular shout out to Ciaran McEachen who's been so helpful, friendly and understanding throughout. He's made the process totally seamless right from our initial conversation. Thank you :-)

headline: Great customer service, very satisfied

headline: Helpful staff but frustrating Structure
reviewBody:
Helpful staff but frustrating Structure

Having completed a qualification during the pandemic, I can appreciate why it can be harder to clarify and communicate.

The content was directly related to my role and course brief which is great. However some of the text is outdated (Follows old CIPD Profession map without clarification) and also the amount Spelling and Grammatical errors in the text can be quite frustrating, especially as it forms part of the grades in our modular essays. 

The Tutors are all really helpful considering we can't speak to them in person. And they are really quick at responding which is great when you're on a roll!

headline: I contacted ICS with an enquiry regarding accounting courses.
reviewBody: I contacted ICS with an enquiry regarding accounting courses. A very nice lady called Anne Marie answered all my questions and sent me everything I needed to enrol on a course. Enrolment has been easy and help and support is there at the click of a button. I would highly recommend ICS to anyone wanting to undertake further study.

headline: Excellent experience
reviewBody: Anne Marie was so patient and helpful. Extremely knowledable and reassuring. Thankyou so much.

headline: The customer service is outstanding, website is a little confusing.
reviewBody: The customer service is outstanding, always very understanding and helpful. The webinars provided by the lecturers was always informative and clear and my work was always marked within 7 days. One in particular (Keith Fisher, I believe) managed to mark my assignments and give me feedback in 2 hours. I really appreciated it as I would always be on edge waiting for my feedback! Unfortunately I didn't find the website the easiest to get on with. Following my progress tracker was always slow and confusing and the icons they use would be named differently under different pages, so found myself clicking in circles to find the information I needed. Overall, I am pleased I studied with ICS Learn.

headline: Excellent
reviewBody:
It has been an amazing journey, the ICS Learn teams supportive nature and people skills made the journey a lot more bearable in the midst of the pandemic, I will definitely enroll for more courses..
Thank you a lot Team ICS Learn.

headline: Excellent support
reviewBody: I just completed my CIPD level 3, with ICS learn. And the support from tutors and especially the student support team was amazing, I can’t thank them enough for all that they have done to help me complete my course.

headline: Excellent service
reviewBody: I needed my course extended due to not being able to sit exams because of Covid. Dominic was very helpful, done this for me very quickly. Thank you!

headline: AAT COURSE LEVEL 2
reviewBody: Anne Marie was extremely helpful in getting me enrolled on my AAT Course. She replied to all my emails very promptly and provided me with all the info I needed to make a decision. There was no pushy sales calls/emails from her which made me feel at ease when sending over a deposit and setting up a payment plan. Cant thank them enough for making the start of my new course so easy and stress free :)

reviewBody: Nicola at ICS Learn was great to correspond with.  She kept me updated and informed through emails and was lovely to chat with on the phone. Nicola made everything very easy and quick when signing up for my course.  Fantastic help.  I was able to begin my learning right away.

headline: Great quality mathematics teaching
reviewBody: I had a really good experience using Icslearn. I prepared for my GCSE in mathematics. I learned everything from the basics to the more complicated bits. I liked that lessons were recorded so I could pause whenever I wanted and also learn whenever I could. I was in contact with three different tutors and they were all great teachers. They were always willing to help and replied very quickly to my questions. I would like to say a big thank you to Ailie, my tutor. She was extremely helpful and I was lucky to be one of her students. I had a lot of questions before the exam and she always took her time to explain things in detail and usually replied the same day. Also thank you to Kirsten, who was my tutor for a short period of time. Melissa is the in house maths teacher and she is usually the one who teaches the lessons. I found she was very good at explaining. I had no problem following her lessons, although I may suggest that sometimes she could have spoken a bit clearer. I got my desired mark. I can highly recommend this service.

headline: Great Service

Ciaran gave me time to think about the advice he gave me and let me decide when to enrol. Anyone thinking of changing career and studying I’d recommend ICS. Very impressed so far.

headline: Big Commitment Made Easy
reviewBody: I'd been looking at courses for a while and found ICS. I really appreciated they don't just let you buy and enroll. They like to talk to you first to make sure the course is right for you as it's a large monetary commitment. They're a company who you can tell straight away actually care about their customers and even potential customers. Fraser was assigned to me and we had email exchanges where he provided every last bit of information someone might need and then we had a phone call where he answered all my queries confidently. We set up my payment method then and there as I was sold. Once starting the course it was everything that was promised. It's a great course and has a great support structure to ensure you pass.

headline: Thanks
reviewBody: I would like to send my gratest gratitude and thanks to Michelle Kerr .Your greatest efforest are highly appreciated.

headline: Shocking experience overall
reviewBody: Shocking experience overall. Initially when I started I was assigned the incorrect assignments after already completing two of them. Then I had to sit 2 exams and 1 week prior to the exam was informed that we had been given the wrong case/scenario that I had based all of my revision on. I then had issues completing the final assignment and asked for support on several occasions which never came to fruition. Would not recommend.

I chose to go forward with ICS and Colin explained the details and processed the transaction smoothly. headline: I stumbled at the start with my ICS…
reviewBody: I stumbled at the start with my ICS experience due to the format of remote learning. However after some brilliant guidance and support from the tutors I quickly found my feet. Would happily study with ICS for another CIPD qualification in future.

headline: Would recommend
reviewBody: So far I have been really impressed. I have only been a member for a week however, so I am limited about my views on exams but so far so good. Nicola was extremely helpful in answering all of my questions before I signed up and explained all of the next steps. I received my email from my tutor quickly to introduce themselves and all of the materials are really easy to use. Throughout the learning materials they give plenty of examples and mini tests so you can see how much you have understood. The live sessions appear to be frequent enough although I have yet to attend. Based on my experience so far, I would definitely recommend.

headline: Mature student application
reviewBody: At the ripe old age of 53 I decided to take the plunge and study for a GCSE in English Literature. Paul O’Rourke fully explained the enrolment process to me what ICS courses offer in terms of support. Paul was very helpful and answered all my questions making me feel comfortable to continue with my enrolment. I have now started my course and would highly recommend ICS Learn. Easy to follow instructions and website.

headline: CIPD Level 5
reviewBody:
I’ve recently completed my
CIPD level 5 with ICS and initially could not have recommended enough. However, I soon found that I had little to no response from my tutor, who was meant to be dedicated to helping me with learning. I also had to challenge feedback from an assessor who was exceptionally rude and unprofessional, and as it turns out marked an essay as a fail when it was a pass. The length of time for feedback from assessors was inconsistent regularly going over SLAs and blaming this on the pandemic. 
Upon completion I was also informed that my results hadn’t been sent to the CIPD for nearly 6 weeks as I’d “been missed off a report”
Overall, some of the tutors are fantastic and I’d like to call out Keith and Carol who were supportive and encouraging and are probably the only reason I’ve scored this above poor. I will be looking to do my level 7 through a different provider in the future and would urge people to think twice before considering ICS.

headline: *WARNING*
reviewBody:
*WARNING* 
I just wanted to say that the experience of using online learning was different to what I had expected. I was hoping to study while working giving me the advantage of having my work to support me with my study as I wanted to get a qualification in HR.

However, for those who do not understand how this works it can be very frustrating and banging your head against a wall. 

Here are the negative points that no one tells you:
1. You only have 1 tutor you can call and even then it has to fit around the time she has so it's not that convenient. 

2. The tutor's way of teaching does not go into the depth of explaining concepts, so they won't give you a definitive answer, they will say things like "you might need to read that again" and when challenging them to explain in a way I can understand, I had on numerous occasions got the answer "your nearly there but its missing information" which leads me to the next point

3. You only allowed 2 submissions and after that, you can fail the module. But they won't fail you, they just keep getting you to rewrite the same things without any guidance.

4. Because of the previous point, I could not move forward as I wasn't able to start other modules until I finished the first one, in some ways I see this as a very clever scam. 

5. I went to the Facebook forum page and you can see lots of people struggling, but they will never admit they have given up, and I'm considering asking for freedom of information to ask how many have done these "courses" and how many people have actually passed in comparison to how many have done the "course".....

6. If you read the reply from ICS about the stats on how 99% of people have passed: 1. This was not the information I had asked for and it is something I can request personally. 2. If it's 99% pass rate it does not explain why your trust pilot is not 4.9 or a 5?

7. My advice is to go to college and as for a Student loan (just google it) This can be paid back over time until you earn over a certain amount which is very helpful especially for those who cannot afford it, it also helps to check if you are able to get free support depending on your age if you go back to FT education, which is what I have done through the lockdown. Social learning is way much better and you have real help and you can discuss and share ideas and experiences with others.

This was a very isolating experience, even with the help of my manager at work could not understand why they kept on failing me.

Also, people write these reviews when they have just started, and very rarely do they get a chance to give a clear overall experience opinion.

HR Diploma L3  - you can earn this through Gov apprenticeships and you get paid. 

I am still paying off this course after I ran out of time and if you want extra time you have to pay for more time to ICS.

If ICS apologise it's only because the person is employed to apologise. They are not sorry, it is a business. If they are sorry they are actually admitting to blame. I have spoken to numerous people especially Paul Martin who has probably had the same problem as his responses sounded automated and clinical on the phone. 

I hope this review helps someone because all of the 5 star reviews are not representing the true image of ICS as it is right now.

Save yourself, turn around now!

headline: I have really enjoyed my studies with ICS Learn

headline: I had no troubles whatsoever with…
reviewBody: I had no troubles whatsoever with accessing this course, one simple phone call and everything was explained to me clearly, feel like I’ve got a good amount of resources and support if I need it, and any worries I might of had have already been spoken about and sorted ie exam centres or who to talk to if I’m struggling with something, Paul o rourke was the gentleman I spoke to to access the course and he was very kind, he gave me all the information I could need, made sure I had no concerns about my course before applying, he emailed me all the info I needed about my closest exam centre very quickly, preventing me freaking out over worrying where I’d end up sitting my exam, he even emailed me a few days after I started my course just to check in and make sure everything was going well, so great customer service from him, I feel like I’ve joined a great service and I’m very excited and grateful to study, my experience so far has been great so moving forward I’m excited to study and succeed here, thumbs up from me.

I have been studying my foundation AAT course with ICS Learn for the past 10 months and I am very happy with my experience so far. headline: I was happy with the program
reviewBody: I was happy with the program.  The material was interesting and accessible.  At times I had trouble navigating the website in order to find the assessment requirements.  But the webinars were helpful in pointing me in the right direction.

headline: Level 3 diploma in HR Practice - excellent
reviewBody:
I really enjoyed the level 3 diploma in HR practice it had a lot of information in it and was presented in a way that was easy to learn. 

The only thing I would say is some of the course material did have spelling mistakes and was hard to read at times. 

I found the support tutor Natalie very helpful with all assignments that I needed clarifying. Mark, Keith and Leigh were very helpful and clear in their feedback and gave me tips on how to improve in the future which I really appreciated. All three of them were so nice and approachable over the platform even though I have never met them.

Mark was so hopeful he is an amazing tutor. We had a call and spoke about my career going forward and how I will get the course finished which really motivated me and I felt like he cared about his students which is very rare especially online. 

Sometimes I would say the assignments take along time to mark with some tutors maybe because of there high workload I’m not sure. 

Keith was very quick at marking which I loved I got most of my assignments back the same day I submitted them which was great as I could move onto the next subject. 

Overall I loved the course, tutors and the course material and have recommended it to several people since.

Thank you 
Jade

headline: Great journey with some difficulties.
reviewBody:
Honstly, The tutor they are professional but, 
The level of tutors is much more high academic than the student, this can create lack of communication especially when we are live in MEA and the english consider as second langagaue to us. I found some difficulty in some assignements but I learn and I found some assignemnts review is little strict but I pass and it was great journey.

I'm little worried to take the CIPD Level 7th with ICS learn.
Thank you.

headline: Good content, annoying website
reviewBody: I enjoyed my studies with ICS learn (CIPD level 3). The course content was good and as I expected and I was able to pass the course in a good time frame. However, I think the website is very clunky and old fashioned, it is not particularly easy to navigate and took my a while to get to grips with how to use it properly. I found it was the same with pebblepad - quite difficult to use and frustrating. Overall I would recommend using ICS learn as the tutors are really helpful and clear in how to complete assessments and pass them but the website is not user friendly.

headline: ICS Learn…A Force For Good !
reviewBody:
I believe ICS offers the bang for your buck in every way ! Be it their formative and summative assessments, tutor support, timely responses by the student support, price- match guarantee, flexibility of payments, ease of one’s coursework, and student-centricity, the overall ecosystem of ICS Learn stands out. 

ICS Learn keeps raising the bar when it comes to providing a gratifying learner experience, and with the onset of the pandemic it has proved this by being sensitive to one’s personal  and professional challenges. 

Frankly speaking, I started my CIPD journey with them as just another name on the block. Fast forward an association of 2+ years, completion of 11 modules across level 5 and level 7, I can easily say that having studied with a leader, I couldn’t have asked for more !  Being accredited by the Learning and Performance Institute (LPI), that too a full 100 marks proves just that !

headline: Friendly and professional
reviewBody: Friendly and professional, quick and easy process.

reviewBody: Although there is room for some improvement, I did enjoy the overall experience. I would recommend studying with ICS. I fully intend to continue my studies with them.

I hope the rethink this based on negative feedback.

headline: Student service support - BRILLIANT

Paul was so calming and offered me an extension of support for 3 months, free of charge. He really put me at ease and I feel more confident moving forward that I have more time to study. Life gets in the way of these things but the student service support team are there for you, so please do reach out if you find yourself in the same position as me. Thanks again guys!

headline: Explore all of your options...
reviewBody:
I completed my Level 5 CIPD qualification with ICS in 2017. At the time I could not have recommended ICS highly enough! the tutors were very knowledgeable, available to discuss issues quickly and demonstrated support for my learning. 

In 2019 I decided to further my studies and I am currently studying my Level 7 CIPD with ICS. Sadly the experience I had a few years ago was much better and retrospectively I would have chosen a different provider. 

The tutors now show minimal support or care for my learning. The recorded lessons are not always delivered by your tutor and as such, can conflict with the your tutors advice or at times are simply unclear. Receiving a grade for coursework has also increased from 5 days to two weeks. 

I suspect that ICS has seen an increase in students over the last year and, whilst I believe that they have recruited new tutors to accommodate  the increase in work, the support and service that was once offered has suffered considerably. 

Overall my experience has been "fine" and I have recently referred friends and family to them with the above caution, suggesting that they explore all options carefully.

headline: CIPD Level 3 Human Resource Practice
reviewBody:
The course learning content was very clear and helpful with my studies. The recorded webinars for each module were also informative and tutors were knowledgeable and engaging. 

I did however find instructions for each assessment, e.g. where content could be located or how to submit (PebblePad especially) fairly vague and at times the designated submission area could not be found or needed to be updated which resulted in me asking the Student Community for assistance many times. The Student Community was a great help when I encountered these issues as they would get back to me quickly. I also found a “search” bar would have been helpful to easily and quickly locate specific modules etc.

headline: Mock Exams!!!! and grading
reviewBody: I am really disappointed that I would not fit the criteria for a teacher assessment grade from ICSlearn. Not being able to put more work into my studies due to Home Schooling and working full time! I was told to sit the mock exam and pay the £109 asap so I could get a grade. Only finding out that I didn't fit the criteria till after I had paid. I was told I did and then I didn't. Now I have to wait to see if a partner centre will grade me, which will probably mean I will need to make another payment (because I clearly haven't paid enough already!) If I had known that I didn't fit the criteria I would have waited till November, where I would have had more time to work on the Maths GCSE. The communication has been poor. My tutors response was "bad luck wait till November."

headline: Really disappointed with Ics learn
reviewBody:
Really disappointed with Ics learn, I feel like they have not put the students welfare or future on the forefront during this pandemic at all. 
I started my GCSE Maths and English course with them 2 years ago and was suppose to take the exams last year. Due to the pandemic, my exams were cancelled then and again this year. 
The whole reason I chose to study with them was because I have three children and I needed something where I can study in my own time. 
After the announcement was made for the cancellation of all exams for the 2nd year, we were sent emails to advise us to pay and take a set of mock exams to aid with the predicted gradings. We were suppose to sign up for these within a few days of receiving the email with no proper guidelines to who would be eligible for predicted gradings. 
After having to think it through quickly, I decided to forfeit my English GCSE exams and concentrate on my Maths exams only due to the lost time of studying with all the homeschooling I have had to do. 
Roughly a month later, I receive the email to tell me the criteria for the predicted grading and I didn't make it for one of them. 
By this point, the mock exam was due to be taken in 11 days and when I emailed the teacher explaining my situation, that I really needed to pass at least one of these exams to get onto my next course this September (having already lost out on a year), the email I got back was short and basically told me to wait till November to do the exams then. 
To say I was let down is an understatement. I was practically in tears and couldn't think of what else to do. I called up the college I wanted to do the course with the next day and the advisor told me to take the Functional Skills Level 2 course for both English and Maths which could be done in 13 weeks time ( as long as the university I'm applying for will accept them), this means I will have plenty of time to do these before September. 
The relief I felt was immense. I felt like if ICS cared for their students welfare then they could've giving me this advise as well but they never gave me anything. 
I have now been on the phone to them at least 4 or 5 times regarding the refund of my mock exams that they couldn't let me tske but accepted the money for before even knowing the criteria and all I keep getting is they will get back to me ( it has now been 14days).

headline: Great!
reviewBody: Anne Marie was very helpful in getting me started on my AAT course. She gave me all of the necessary information and made signing up a breeze. I have since started the course and have already completed the first unit. Any help that I need is on hand with a tutor and the website is easy to navigate.

headline: I found the help from Tutor's wasn't really until crisis point!
reviewBody:
I found the help from Tutor's really sporadic, lengthy delays in getting responses which just increases anxiety,  and because you can't have a dialogue the responses just lead to more questions. Sometimes you really had to scrabble around for answers which should have been easy.   More information and guidance on word counts is needed, including what should and shouldn't go in the appendices', all practical stuff with little to no guidance meant weeks of delays for me in trying to get it right and waiting from responses from tutors.     I think you pay a lot of money for the course and in all fairness when I did get to speak to a tutor it wasn't helpful and I felt like I was being a nuisance.    There was one tutor who did truly help me, Caroline was great and stepped in to help me when I getting no help from other tutors but by this point I felt I was in crisis, ready to give up as it wasn't worth the impact on my health. 

 Maybe distance learning isn't for everyone but at Level 7 I would have expected more tutor support and guidance.  The ability to speak to someone monthly for 20 minutes would have been really beneficial and make the experience I had much less painful. I wouldn't recommend distance learning to anyone who actually need to have a discussion to learn.  Huge amounts of reading and I feel like I primarily taught myself.  Learning material on ICS for exams is very out of date and covered no recent theories or topic that appeared in the exam....thank god for youtube tutorials!  Would have been helpful to have more than 1 revision session for the exams, as again these are a big deal and the supporting information did not cover any of the current topics.

headline: I left school 15 years ago
reviewBody:
I left school 15 years ago, having got an E in Science and a U in Maths.

Achieved a Grade 9 in my Double Science IGCSE this year having taken the ICS course. Angeline the tutor was always willing to help with any questions I had.

My advice to anybody wanted to go back and study their GCSEs for whatever reason - it's very doable, just takes commitment and organisation with your study time and plenty of revision. 

I took the Maths GCSE course too and am sitting those exams in the next couple of months, confident I can achieve a similar grade. Mellissa's tuition is  brilliant and really explains things in a simple, easy to understand way. Despite being terrified of maths at school I'm now studying engineering maths for and getting on just fine with the more complex stuff involved.

Anne Marie has been very understanding, helpful and quick to reply to emails. I've only just started the course but system is pretty straight forward and easy to navigate.

My niece has taken up 6 GSCSEs with ICS Learn and is navigating her way around the learner platform with increasing confidence (only day 2) and tells me that the course materials are very easy to follow, tutors who have touched base with her have been pleasant and helpful and she is excited to pursue her courses.  She has already devised study schedules for each of her chosen subjects!  We are hopeful this will be a happy and successful experience and one that we can re-visit with other children who are homeschooling in our family.  Once again, many thanks Paul!

headline: Overall a great provider - let down by 1 tutor
reviewBody:
Ics were perfect for me as I have worked a full time job throughout my level 5 and 7 CIPD. I found the material helpful and their website easy to use. 
During my level 5 I needed to extend my course and ICS helped and supported me in doing this. I would be giving them 5 stars but there was one tutor for one of my modules who I feel is a detriment to the company. From this tutor I have received contradicting feedback, told to include things that were already there and he was particularly unhelpful when I asked for guidance. 
The rest of the tutors were fabulous and I have no complaints what so ever about them. The responded within the promised time with support and helpful insights.
Some of the material is a bit dated and could do with a freshen up but it did not cause me any problems. 

I would 100% study with ICS learn again but if that tutors name was allocated to me again I would seriously reconsider.

headline: Gordon Stewart the student advisor was…
reviewBody: Gordon Stewart the student advisor was really helpful, he answered my questions quickly and found the solution to my problem without any bother. I feel very confident now moving over to the new syllabus and am grateful for ICS learns student services.

headline: CIPD Qualification
reviewBody:
I have recently passed my CIPD qualification with ICS however there are a few things that I would like to highlight (that I have also flagged to ICS directly so it is feasible that these may change!) 

This being said, I was able to pass my qualification and I believe at the time ICS were more cost effective than other providers. 

1) Delay in marking - they advertise a 5 working day in SLA but in one instance went over double this. When I escalated to student support they were not able to advise and only closed my case once the assignment had been marked. 

2) Lack of clarity in feedback. Some (not all) tutors would not provide the clearest guidance in online sessions or in marking. At times I felt quite isolated and relied on external advice such as Facebook groups for support to help me pass this qualification, even after joining all available classes and rewatching online classes. 

If you are not self motivated and feel as though you might need extra support, you may find it beneficial to investigate providers who offer more support as well as structured timelines to complete your assessment.

headline: Positive learning
reviewBody: During time learning with ICS I received professional assistance and feedback from my tutors. Although I didn’t use the student support service that often, whenever I did, it was always a positive experience. I would certainly use ICS in the future for additional learning needs.

reviewBody:
The whole experience has been positive from start to finish. I studied HRM Level 5 which included all the resources required from CIPD and membership. Study can be done on phone; tablet or laptop. I fitted my study in around my work schedule easily. The tutors and ICS Learn support were always there if I had any queries.
I recommend the course and ICS Learn.

headline: CIPD LEVEL 3 - OVERALL GOOD EXPERIENCE
reviewBody:
I did the Level 3 Certificate CIPD course with ICS learn. It was a great way of gaining a qualification whilst working fultime.

I wish the support and reply time from tutors would be a bit quicker. 7 days is a long time when you are waiting for a simple question to be answered.

The feedback is often very short which means you have to ask about it again and wait 7 days for a reply. This can cause a delay in getting your units done.

Overall it was a good experience but I think personally I would choose a college for my next qualification rather than distance learning.

headline: ICS Learn are a good choice for online only study
reviewBody: ICS Learn are a good choice if you wish to study online only and at your own pace. The tutors have been responsive to any query I have had, very quick to mark and provide feedback on assessments and student services are quick to respond to any query too.

headline: Excellent email communication regarding…

headline: Will suit some but needs modernising - AAT combined
reviewBody:
Similar to others, combined AAT course. Majority 5 stars have left a review not long after signing up, 1 star reviews come from longer users. I found it below standards of other online courses I've completed (first course i've cancelled too). 

Pros: Study in own time, study guide, tests (temperamental whether they mark answers correctly or not). 
Cons: Lessons are a tutor dictating powerpoint slides with audio full of static background noise. Learning materials have so many contextual & grammatical errors (missing words etc). 

Be aware you are paying for the course and need to sign up/pay for exams & AAT yourself. Can't book exams until registered with AAT, I'd have done this straight away if not for one of the tutors emailing stating they would register the qualification with AAT "within 3 weeks" and to expect a following email of how to sign up... It never came. So I waited to book exams due to their info and when mentioned there was never a sense of an apology. 

Ended up using other resources, cancelled after 3 months and paid the fee, they then emailed welcoming me to the next level of study?? Safe to say their communication and transparency isn't great. Ok if it was free but the mistakes aren't worth the money.

headline: Unsatisfactory course
reviewBody:
This course is a self study course. When I signed up to do GCSE psychology , it all seemed very straight forward. I paid for the course in full with the understanding that I have to organise going to an exam centre.
The reason I have given this course 1star is because of a few issues. 
1- there are issues with the spelling throughout the course. It really needs proof reading. I'm dyslexic and I noticed the issues! This made it a little harder for me to study.  
2- this course offers a tutor. The course also say if I have any questions contact your tutor. Unfortunately the tutor is NOT helpful in any way.  
A few times I asked questions on certain words and how the word would be used in context. The response I received was copied and pasted from the section I was reading. I said I need another example that's why I contacted the you(the tutor). The response I received was "this is a self study course" . Not helpful at all.
• Another issue with the tutor was , when , I asked for something to be cleared up. In the ics course there was a section that did not match the GCSE book that I had , I had ask the tutor about this and I gave her the information but it was never solved.

Basically the tutor is not worth contacting because they do not help in anyway. Why on earth they are called a tutor baffles me as they do not tutor. They only check the test papers you send them. They should be given a different name like 'exam observer or exam advisor' not tutor.

The only help I had was when I submit my test papers.

My best advice is not to sign up to this course . I have a GCSE book that has exactly the same information and is just as helpful and without any spelling errors. I wish I had saved my money and bought a few books, the course in my mind is a waste of money .

*Unfortunately the reply from ics is not good enough. They said ' It's good to know that you've been able to make use of the unlimited Tutorial support for the course and that your Tutor has appropriately responded to all your queries'

I asked the tutor questions when I needed help but she doesn't help in anyway! This in my mind isn't making use of the unlimited Tutorial support because I had NO SUPPORT and stopped asking questions !!
They need to change the title to the tutor' they do support the student. They only mark the very few questions on the test paper at the end of each unit.

This reply from ics is also unsatisfactory.

headline: My Thoughts on ICS.
reviewBody:
Currently, a student of ICS Here is my experience; 

It's currently a pandemic - And, in my experience, a lot of companies have really struggled (As to be expected). But despite this, and the hectic and volatile nature of academia. 

ICS has persistently kept me informed and hit the mark. My tutor is very consistent at responding to queries and is always able to deliver extra resources if the ICS Learning content isn't enough.

There are thorough tests throughout the courses to keep you conscious of the content you are learning. And they even have mini-mocks at the end of each unit. 

I can't be certain of my grade, but I've been studying the Double Award science for about 5 months. And in that time, I've managed to cover all the content and move onto practice papers. I'm confident in ICS Service. I should note they also transferred my course as soon as they could, when it was discovered I needed to complete more than one GCSE in science. 

They also (if I'm not mistaken) use Moodle (or something very similar to it), which for those who don't know is a platform that I can remember ever since Primary school. It's pretty easy to use, and has been developed for so long it means that the ICS Site is easy to navigate and is very user friendly. (It's also optimised for mobile devices, and even one of my old laptops has no problem displaying the pages) 

They also have resources for students, to find exam centres near them and other information. also a student community and a team who you can contact with any other questions you have.

Overall a brilliant service, I can't fault them.

headline: Highly Recommended
reviewBody: I have been studying with ICSLearn for 1 year and have received fabulous customer service and tutor support from the beginning. Due to Covid I have been unable to sit my exams. ICS have extended my course free of charge for 3 months. Excellent service.

headline: I started a Biology course around March…
reviewBody: I started a Biology course around March /April 2020. There was a lot to learn. It was easy to contact your advisor, who replied really quickly. As I needed a IGCSE science grade C (I chose biology). I worked hard, during lockdown (go me) there was a lot to remember but with the two books recommended (the green CGP one was the one that helped me the best, I brought it of Ebay for about £4) moving forward I aimed to apply for Teacher Training in 2021 so needed to pass a science of choice ASAP. I told my ICS Learner advisor that I wanted to take the exam in November 2020 or January 2021, he did advise me to take the exam in the summer months of 2021!! I said I’d like to try before because I needed it all done and dusted before August 2021. It was my choice!! Ok I wasn’t that confident but I was learning from ICS’s online resources and my CGP green book (best purchase ever) I booked my exam contacting a exam centre as an external candidate at a academy 1hr from me!! The exam cost £98 for both papers. So I completed both exams one on 8th & 13th January 2021 (yikes) both exam papers were not as bad as I thought., confident not really but I at to try!! Three months later March 4th 2021 I receive a email congratulationing me on passing Biology (4) C. To say I was pleased was an understatement but I have ICS to thank for the advice, mock paper marks and advice to work on areas I found hard. Moral of the story I worked hard and it paid off, I get my certificate around the end of April 2021. So a big thank you to ICS Learn the best £285 I ever spent.

headline: If I could put 0 stars - I would!
reviewBody:
If I could put 0 stars, I would.
After signing up to ICS learn my financial situation changed meaning I could no longer afford the monthly payments comfortably. I had paid the deposit and one months subscription to the tune of £200 and within that time had only accessed the course once just to check it out. I was then charged 10% of the remaining balance to cancel + a £50 fee for the privileged. Overall, a very bad and costly decision to have signed up and one I very much regret. Very disappointed that the company can unfortunately show no compassion in hard times.
