headline: Review on ICS after completing my CIPD diploma
reviewBody:
Good to know: ICS is about flexibility which is an important thing when it comes to decision about training providers. Not everyone can learn if there are no smaller milestones and deadlines set up in advance. You have to know yourself :)
Contra: The marking system of assignments was changed back in November 2020, and at first it was difficult to get answers from the support tutors. It caused some frustration. Otherwise, previously, I received the necessary support from the tutors.
Pro: When the marking tutors received the assignment, they all marked it really fast and provided a meaningful and highly professional feedback on each of the questions. 
Summary: I was satisfied generally with the service they provided. Customer service was also available and helpful when I needed them.
Development point: Maybe, it would be good to consider to provide some kind of access to each of the resources per unit, not only to two books- if I would have wanted to buy all the books, it would have costed me a fortune & it took long as well to find the articles on the internet.

headline: Learning with ICS
reviewBody: It was nice learning about HR and have a great distance learning experience with ICS. Initially, I thought it would be challenging and tough to complete. I went nicely with great tutors/assessors for their advice and assignment feedback. Some are exceptionally well at assisting on queries and marking the assignment with due diligence and fast, within 40 minutes! It would have been a great course if it had accommodated practical HR models and case studies across the organizations in modules instead of emphasizing theories.  However, lately introduced Tutor support was too slow to respond to the queries, literally unhelpful on the question asked to them. ICS needs to look upon that.

Unfortunately, although I have tried several times to use it, I have never found any benefit or answers. For the rest it is a course that I recommend taking

headline: I spoke to Paul McMaster
reviewBody:
I spoke to Paul McMaster. I explained what my concern was. He was confident with his knowledge of the people and product. He was able to reassure me. I am very happy that I have made the call today. I feel so much better and completely reassured.
I cannot thank Paul enough for his excellent customer service.

headline: Poor tutoring
reviewBody:
Multiple times the service level agreement was broken by the tutors. You should get a grade back in up to 5 working days but I had to chase assignment grades on at least 4 occasions. 

A lot of the course is just waiting to hear back from your tutors. 

Throughout my course I’d say out of the 4 tutors I had, only 1 was very good. The others didn’t seem to care too much. Rather than actually tutor someone they came across as disinterested and unhelpful. 

I was told 5 times one particular assignment couldn’t be graded because I didn’t follow certain rules. 

That’s fine, but at least tutor me properly and tell me what these rules are rather than just a generic message because I obviously wasn’t understanding what was required. This wasted 3 weeks of my time.

I’m glad I’ve done the course but I won’t be using ICS again. The material is fine, the layout is fine and student services are helpful but a majority of the tutors let them down.

Reaching the learning site was clear and tutorial docs help me more, also the new version for the platform was nice and better that the old one.

I am from Saudi Arabia and I found ICS is trying to facilitate any issues face me (before/during/after) finishing the course, my thank words cannot satisfy you, so thank a lot.

headline: Rewarding experience
reviewBody:
I wanted to up-skill in my HR career and ICS Learn repeatedly was recognised as an exceptional provider of CIPD qualifications. I really enjoyed the flexible approach to learning that they offer, which was perfect whilst I worked full-time. The content was engaging and the tutor support was efficient and effective in helping me to achieve my goal. 

I think my only criticism of the experience is in regards to the online classes. Some tutors would speak endlessly about ICS Learn and then only cover the content of the class in the remaining 20 minutes. I felt that time could have been better spent going into detail about the content. Additionally, the recordings of online classrooms were rarely uploaded promptly as outlined by tutors. 

Overall, the experience was excellent and I’d recommend ICS Learn for anyone considering a CIPD qualification.

headline: ICS is nonsense!!!
reviewBody:
ICS is nonsense!!!
Most courses are unaccredited and the courses which are (eg GCSE) you have to book your exam yourself!
There is nothing stopping you doing this in the first place and buying curriculum material from Amazon at a 90% discount compared to ICS pricing!!
The tutors response time for even the most elementary question could be achieved quicker by using Google.
The sales/course  advisors are deadbeats who really should be re-educating themselves instead of preying on many vulnerable people.
They force students to give 5star reviews for price discounts and in the false hope it means they might get better service or results, they don’t.
Do not be another ICS idiot!!!

headline: I fully recommend ICS learn and I found…
reviewBody: I fully recommend ICS learn and I found it good value for money. Overall it offers good value for money and I would not see the point of spending more on a different provider. I did see continuous improvements of the platform and the way the support is offered which is a good sign of trying to keep up to date. All tutors are quick to mark, and the online chat support is very quick and helpful. Fully recommend.

headline: Not the best, explore alternative
reviewBody:
I found the ICS platform quite hard to navigate at the beginning of my course (CIPD L5). There were supporting materials for the units, but once I learned how to find them I felt they could have been listed in a clearer way to make it easier to find the material linked to the question I was answering. 
The live classrooms felt like an absolute waste of time and not sure why you have to attend to pass the unit. 
Keith Watson’s ones felt the most informative, other tutors just read out the slides and acted like reading the learning outcomes aloud was going to help you with your assignment. 
There was little to no advice on structure at the beginning of the course and this is something I felt really held me back, I had no confidence to get started when I didn’t know how to. 
I didn’t actually contact the tutors at all and used a Facebook group and internet searches to assist me, there have been a lot of complaints on the facebook group that you now can’t contact the tutors directly and answering times for queries have increased.

headline: Thank you to Debra Dixon for the quick…
reviewBody: Thank you to Debra Dixon for the quick turnaround. Very friendly and professional.

headline: CIPD Level 5 Doploma in HRM
reviewBody: After years of working in management, I decided to do the CIPD Level 5 Diploma through ICS Learn, as I was interested in moving into a more HR focused role. Whilst the course was very informative, and the tutors supportive with quick response times, I felt the course was heavily theoretical and lacked a link to the real world of HR. Maybe a mandatory mentor through CIPD would be a good idea? Also, if considering the course, bear in mind that once you have successfully completed your coursework you have to contact ICS Learn to get your certificate, it will not be sent to you automatically, as I mistakenly thought. After 4 months of waiting, I decided to submit an enquiry and have been informed my assignments have to be vetted again by the Quality Assurance Team (10 days), submitted to CIPD (4-6 weeks) and then I will have to wait for the CIPD to send me my certificate (8-10 weeks), which is not the best. Overall, a good experience though.

headline: Excellent Teaching and Support
reviewBody:
Due to Covid 19 disrupting the examination process I am still working through the GCSE Maths with ICS Learn unsure of when I will finish. 

I try to sit in on as many of the live sessions as I can, most of which are hosted by the  ICS in-house Maths Teacher Melissa Lieberman.  Melissa is a fantastic tutor and always makes the sessions very interesting but also easy to follow, the three recent sessions I want to say thank you for are Quadratic Equations, Simultaneous Equations and Re-arranging Formula. These are complex topics but Melissa made them easy to follow and I now have a much better understanding of them.  

Also of note is that ICS have arranged for mock exams for Students to sit remotely which also get proctored via webcam, these mock exams are marked by a recognised expert organisation.  This is a fantastic initiative by ICS Learn which will help to give the students confidence in their learning.

All in all, I have been really impressed with ICS Learn and their teachers and would recommend the company to anyone wanting to sit exams or improve their grades.

headline: Extension fee (when i've already paid in full)
reviewBody:
I paid £60+ per month, which did not even include the exams (at £80 a go). By the time the balance of the course was paid off I had not finished the course. I work full time and the idea of this course was that it was to fit around my work. 

So why have I been told that, despite paying in full for the course, I will now have to pay over £200 to continue studying? They sent me a list of prices which went up to a 6 month extension for over £200! They said I had to pay all these extra fees in order to carry on with the course and to regain access to my online account. I hardly used the support of the tutors anyway so I'm very annoyed that after having paid over a grand for this course that I am now being expected to pay extra to complete it!?

I may have taken my time, but again, isn't the idea of this kind of course to do it when you can? Surely now that I have paid the full balance I should be able to return to it whenever I like? I understand having to pay for using the services of the tutors, but I would quite happily continue doing my course, being able to book my exams without the tutors. This I was told was not an option. 

I would look elsewhere I'm afraid. I feel like I'm being conned.

headline: Supportive, friendly and easy to use!
reviewBody: I have received support when requested, throughout my first course and the team are always very friendly and responsive. The prices for the courses are reasonable and the material is clear and easy to follow. The student interface is easy to use and manoeuvre around, making the whole experience a smooth one. If there is any technical updates to be made to the website announcements are made well in advance, so you can plan your studies around this. All announcements are clearly visible on the front dashboard and there is a space for students to discuss concerns with each other, which helps to avoid feeling isolated. The study plan is broken down into manageable chunks, which is ideal if you are working whilst studying these courses. I am personally someone who is comfortable with distance learning, so if you are self motivated and driven this is a great service to use!

headline: AAT Level 3
reviewBody:
I agree with the majority that the onboarding process was very quick, easy and friendly. 

However, I did want to provide a more indepth review of ICS Learn beyond the positive comments of the registration process.

I have read some negative online reviews from students about ICS Learn.  I have to admit to being baffled by it as my own experience has been the opposite.  

I studied with ICS Learn for my AAT Level 2 in Accounting and found their online material very good, so much so I passed with a distinction. 

I love the mini knowledge checks at the end of each section within a module, the online assessments and the tutor marked assessments which helps you understand the areas you need to further work on.  

Perhaps it was because I was a mature student that I didn't need a huge amount of tutor support but when I did reach out to my tutor, the feedback was always supportive, encouraging and positive.  

I did consider going to another online provider for my AAT Level 3.  
However, after research and most notably as I was really impressed with my experience with them, I decided to continue with them for my AAT Level 3.  

Why change providers when you are happy right?

reviewBody: The phone system they use is very poor, I could barely hear what Margaret was saying. When it came to the payment, the secure line wouldn’t work properly so she had to call me back on my mobile.  Aside from that she was very professional and dealt with me quickly and professionally.  I would definitely recommend to someone else.

During my journey so far, two times I relied on help from Ciaran M, and he was the best advisor I have ever come across. Patient, and provided answers to every question I have and more. I would definitely recommend ICS Learning to anyone and Thank you so much Ciaran M for everything you have done so far to help me kick start my learning journey to achieve my dream qualification. Kind regards, Monika

reviewBody:
Fraser offered clear information and guidance for which level course I should do and sent me all the information I needed to make my decision, I liked the fact that there was no pressure at all to sign up which allowed me the time to really think things through.
The signing up process was quick and easy with Fraser explaining every step.
Great start to my first online course.

headline: Convenient Learning, Professional Tutors, Will Always Recommend

I have recently completed my Level 5 CIPD in HR and I had a fantastic learning experience. The convenience and ease of learning suited my work-life balance perfectly. I was recommended this training provider by colleagues and I will continue to do the same. Tutors were experienced, professional and communicated exactly when and how you need them.

My only nitpick is the clunky system to access resources and submit assignments, it really holds this rating back from a five star.

I also found it impressive that I was given the space I needed to make up my mind to purchase they services, I didn’t feel rushed either directly or indirectly.

I feel that once I had completed all assignments there was no instructions what to do. Apparently you have to chase up your own certificate. Also once they confirm you have passed it take 6-8 weeks to get there so if you need it for a job be aware you will have a long wait.

The platform is great.  I learnt from the tutors as soon I learnt how to use the platform. 

My best experience was with the platform and resources on it.
My worst experience was with DVP/02. The communication gap between the tutor and I was so much. I just didn’t understand her expectations and I am sure the feeling was same for her. I appreciate the help of Keith. I could not have completed this course without his encouragement.

James was very attentive and quick to respond to all questions I had regarding the course, he offered lots of detail, a full breakdown of the course and modules, and different finance options. James was really quick to respond to my emails and provided great detail to ensure I had made a well informed decision to study with ICS. Thank you James.

reviewBody:
ICS was clear to navigate, tutors and assistance was available when i needed.

When I was on my last two units, they changed the people we speak to about that unit, i.e. it used to be the tutors but then it changed to help assistants. that meant the turn around time for answers and marking was a lot longer than previous, but still they were helpful when they did get back to me.

I thought that the call and everything was handled very well and look forward to doing my course with ICS Learn as I think that they are great company to start learning my HR course with.

Thank you

Jaskiran Kaur

Sortly after my online enquiry I was contacted by Ciaran who was extremely helpful, we spoke at times and through channels that were conveinient for me. He answered all of my questions and was very patient with me as I took a number of weeks to move from enquiry to enrolment. Ciaran went above and beyond and talked me through every step of the process including follow up to ensure I was settled once enrolled. I have already recommended ICS Learn to others after such a positive experience.

headline: Studying at 46 during a pandemic!
reviewBody:
I am half way through my level 5 in HR management. So far it has been really challenging due to homeschooling alongside full time work during a pandemic. But I have to say i have found ICS to be supportive helpful and very understanding. The tutors are professional and quick to mark work which makes the suspense less intense. 
All in all great but I can’t wait to finish!!!!

headline: Outstanding Service

headline: Keep up the good work...

reviewBody: the CIPD L7 Dip is a hard enough course as it is. the support received from  Paul M Student Service Advisor   was heartfelt in such trying times. offering to extend the course lifted a massive weight off my shoulders. although I still may need help later on down the line - the support offered by ICS has been great during COVID.

headline: Brilliant …
reviewBody: I had 3 children and multiple issues getting time to access my course abd the team were amazing in helping.

headline: Excellent choice
reviewBody: I am so impressed with the efficiency, professionalism and openness of the team at ICS. I didn't feel like I "signed up" for something but more like I was "welcomed" into a group of credible and supportive people that are going to be on hand to support me. Michelle Kerr has been so helpful and made it very personal by calling me to have a one to one chat about "me" and what drove me to want to pursue this qualification. Not a sales call, not a screening call. Just a call to welcome me and thank me for my business. Great job!

headline: I decide to cancel within the 14 day…
reviewBody: I decide to cancel within the 14 day period. 1 month after the confirmation of the refund, still no money. 10-15 working days is long gone. Contacted 3 times, still no progress. Dont reply saying you cant find my details as that would be a massive lie

headline: initial request
reviewBody: phone call was helpful and was able to explain how the online tutoring would be to my advantage only one small problem my email address was not taken correctly and i had to ring back as i had not received the confirmation email.

I am excited to get started and feel super supported by the ICS Learn Team!! Thank you again Maggie :))

headline: CIPD Level 5 HRM course from ICS Learn
reviewBody:
I completed my CIPD Level 5 HRM course with ICSLearn in 2 months. I found the course material up-to-date, easy to understand and practical to apply.  The class videos were very useful and gave excellent guidance on how to complete the assignments.
My assessors were very prompt in marking the assignments and gave pertinent and useful feedback. I was able to update my knowledge and skills in HRM via this course. I highly recommend ICSLearn for doing this course.

headline: Getting started
reviewBody: Just started with my studies. I'm truly glad I signed up for the course, I'm already observing myself learning the knowledge and developing my skills at work.

headline: Tutors and assessors responses
reviewBody:
Professional tutors and assessors. However, in my opinion, there are minor issues with getting the responses from tutor support; the previous practice when assessors used to reply to student questions on particular unit was much more efficient and speedy. This is vital when you are short of time and have a priority to receive a quick answers on the unit studies.
Except for that, the learning experience is very positive.

headline: Enrolment process was top notch
reviewBody: Enrolment process was top notch. Adviser listened to all of my questions and guided me on what CIPD course to go for. Thanks ICS!

headline: Excellent teaching learning environment
reviewBody: Excellent teaching learning environment

headline: Issue which was resolved
reviewBody:
Anne Marie, helped with my issues and questions politely and with all information.

I was not enrolling however, experienced identify theft issues. And Anne Marie closed off any details and kept me updated

Very good customer service received

headline: Helpful & Responsive
reviewBody: All of the staff I have encountered so far have been helpful & responsive. Enrolment and the course introduction has been clear & straightforward. I look forward to studying with ICS more in the new year

headline: Enrolling was easy and Fraser has been…
reviewBody: Enrolling was easy and Fraser has been very helpful throughout the whole process.

headline: Incredible support from Gemma Dornan
reviewBody:
I am a current student in CIPD HR level 3 certificate.
I have had a lot of questions about so many things related to it, I have been put to talk with one of the student service advisors [Gemma Dornan]. Really incredible help from her, I have not seen that emphasis on helping others from a person before.
There is no more than one word in which I can describe my experience (awesome).

headline: Amazing service!
reviewBody: Amazing service!

headline: I found the course I wanted to do and…
reviewBody: I found the course I wanted to do and then looked for the best provider. I found the ICS learn website easy to navigate and was impressed by the course content and set-up. I found the course cheaper with another online provider but they were happy to price match. They offered monthly payments to help spread the cost and the whole process was painless and easy. Highly recommended.

headline: Great service from Dominic
reviewBody: Great service from Dominic. Informative, helpful, kind and friendly. He answered all my questions in a timely manner. Thanks Dominic!

headline: Thank you Dominic!
reviewBody: I really appreciate the promptness by Dominic as he assured me and handled my enquiry efficiently. Thank you Dominic!

headline: A great online learning experience!
reviewBody: ICS Learn has been very supportive to me throughout the duration of my course. I found them very understanding and cooperative whenever I approach them for assistance. Highly recommended!

headline: I found the course very hard to navigate, the menu on the left never took me to where I expected to be, I always struggled to find the videos and never managed to find a timely live session
reviewBody: I found the course very hard to navigate, not user friendly in design at all.  However, the tutors and support I have had has been first class, the videos were extremely helpful to me.  I did not use the blogs even though I did write them.  I did not use the forums either.

headline: ICS Learn is the upmost trusted and course provider to date
reviewBody: ICS Learn is the most trusted and I would say the best institution to take courses with. They are very helpful and the Tutors are always at hand for help when needed. ICS Learn have an easy to follow student platform where the course and learning material are kept for studies. I have found my overall experience with ICS Learn extremely positive and If I am to study further I will most definitely be learning with ICS Learn.  Thank you for all your support and a special thank you to all the Tutors who have supported me in achieving my pass grade for CIPD. I am very grateful :-)

headline: When I registered with ICS Learn
reviewBody: When I registered with ICS Learn. I was approached by Ciaran the CIPD Advisor. She was very helpful and supportive and clear in providing any information I asked for. She was very quick in responding to my emails and very cooperative. The experience as a whole was vey smooth and made me feel so excited to start my CIPD journey. I am considering to take more courses with ICS and recommend it for anyone who like to take online courses .

headline: Amazing Student Support
reviewBody: I loved my experience with the ICS Learn team. I’m so happy with my CIPD L5 Qualification!

headline: Perfect!!!!
reviewBody: Perfect!!!!

headline: Not for neurodivergent people.
reviewBody: I've been trying to get support and reasonable adjustments made by ICS Learn for over a year and they have been really unhelpful.  None of their staff appear to have had any training on how to deal with people with learning differences.  When you phone or email to explain the challenges you're experiencing, and the adjustments you would like making, they are very dismissive and speak down to you as though you're stupid for not being able to manage what they feel are simple things.  As somebody who has achieved degree level qualifications through the Open University I know I am fully capable of distance learning complex subjects but as somebody with a learning difference, there are things that seem simple to neurotypical people that I really struggle with and need additional support for, or allowances making.  It is absolutely shocking that in this day and age, a business that is teaching CIPD qualifications, and supposedly best practices in relation to the Equality Act, disability discrimination, and reasonable adjustments, can treat people so badly.  I feel completely demoralised and let down and am nearly £2000 out of pocket with nothing to show for it and seemingly no recourse and ICS couldn't care less about the distress they have caused me.

headline: CIPD level 5 diploma in HRM completion

headline: I completed the CIPD Level 5 Diploma in…
reviewBody: I completed the CIPD Level 5 Diploma in HRM with ICS Learn. The tutors were helpful and most marked assignments the very next day which was good to keep momentum going. One critique I have is the course content is not very interactive - for example it is mostly just slides with information. There are no animations or quizzes to help with engagement and learning. Overall I had a good experience with ICS Learn.

headline: CIPD qualification was my dream and ICS…
reviewBody:
CIPD qualification was my dream and ICS Learn played a major role in helping me achieve this goal. The portal is very student friendly, relevant and useful study material is accessible and the entire team working for ICS Learn proved to be a great help. Student council services were readily available and reverted with helpful responses. I would recommend everyone to enroll with ICS learn if they want to do remote learning. 
Thanks
Ruheena Kabir

headline: GCSE Maths - positive experience from the first moment!
reviewBody: I've just enrolled in GCSE maths course and after spending some time getting familiar with the the course structure, materials and the website itself, all I can say I am mind-blown! It's straightforward, user-friendly with a huge amount of great quality videos covering all the important topics, and plenty of practice materials too. Your course advisor Tony was really helpful, friendly and gave me clear guidance through the enrollment process.

headline: AVOID AVOID AVOID
reviewBody: AVOID AVOID AVOID, terrible service with an even worse attitude of tutors and people higher up in the company. Multiple times accused of cheating which is truly laughable then when it came to asking for help they are the most useless tutors around, please save yourself money and look for other companies to do courses with. Quick enough to take money off of customers but when they. did not fully give the service which was supposed to be provided there was no refund or gesture of good will. They just used cover as an excuse. Please save your self the disappointment and avoid I can't reiterate this more.

headline: Easy to use
reviewBody: I've just started learning through ICS, and so far, it has been straightforward to enroll, navigate the website and learn through the online classroom and material.

headline: Math GCSE is great, Science IGCSE is a waste of money.
reviewBody: I have been studying IGCSE Science and GCSE Math.  The Math program is very good.  It has strong material and excellent videos.  There are lots of links for further practice and I feel confident that I have all the information I need to study. I would give this a 5* review.  The IGCSE Science program is poor.  The material is not detailed enough for a first time student, there are no videos or other forms of learning.  You might as well just buy the text book which is a lot cheaper and watch the many YouTube videos.  I would give this course a 1*

headline: Good but room for improvement
reviewBody:
The course material is easy to follow and understand as well as being interesting and engaging. Despite ICS saying that the site is easy to navigate at times it was not and I spent a lot of time looking for certain things that should have been easy to find. One of the main things I did not enjoy about the course is the time it takes for tutors to come back to you when you submit a question or require information. You are provided a turn around time however this caused so much delay through my studies that toward the end I was spinning 3 different plates as I was waiting for a response and couldn't move forward until I had a response. ICS did however in the last few months communicate that there was a delay with response's due to the COVID pandemic.
When I did receive a response from the tutors, they would not answer the questions fully or provide the information needed meaning I would have to the re-submit another enquiry to get the information I needed  which caused more delays and put me back another 3-5 days! This happened on more than one occasion and almost on every unit. I found it really unhelpful during my studies. There was only one tutor that was so thorough and helpful with her feedback and information so I was sad to see her leave ICS. I also found that at times the criteria for the assignment's were not always clear and it was vague as to what you needed to do to pass which left you baffled however the online classrooms were helpful!
My experience with ICS has over all been good but there are many areas that I think they need to improve on and at this stage I am unsure as to weather I will continue my studies with them.

headline: Helpful and informing
reviewBody: they were very helpful for giving me information and gave me reassurance on the time it would take. They also explained what the costs would go towards.

headline: Overall great
reviewBody:
Overall great! 
Before I started course I was speaking to Anne-Marie who was really helpful and explained in details how to course works. Website to study is designed very well and I can navigate the course materials easily.

headline: The most horrible horrible service…

The most horrible horrible service provider I have ever received.

I submitted an assignment over a month ago and everytime I ask if it is going to be marked someone different responds to me saying it will be marked in the next few days and it is so upsetting.

headline: I had very good support while studying …
reviewBody: I had very good support while studying  with ICS learn. Even when I had an issue that needed urgent attention, it was resolved immediately. I am looking forward to studying with ICS learn again in the nearest future

headline: Excellent support from the assigned advisor
reviewBody: The guidance I received and the process to get myself enrolled unto the program was made very smooth courtesy the regular communication and support from the advisor assigned to me.

headline: Just finished my course!
reviewBody: I signed up for the CIPD Level 5 course for a diploma in HRM last year in September and have just finished it. My experience with ICS has been nothing but positive and I enjoyed the fact that they allow you to work on your own pace. This proved to be especially useful in dynamic circumstances when I didn`t have so much time to spend on studying and I could then easily catch up and complete my assignments when I had more free time. Having a strict deadline is good but it is sometimes extremely stressful when you have to balance out between full time job, studying and other events that might happen in your life. So, I like the fact that ICS allows us to work on our own pace. The tutors have been all really helpful. There were times when I needed a bit more explanation on certain things and in such cases I would recommend you ask specific and detailed questions. The student services support team were always very helpful too, I cannot fault them at all. There was a time when they even helped me find out information which would usually be better known to the tutors but the advisors made that extra effort to give me the info as quick as possible. I enjoyed the fact that I had free access to two books, however, I think this has changed and the new students would not be able to access those for free. So, a little recommendation to ICS is to bring back the free access to those books as they were really helpful in structuring the assignments and just to get clearer understanding of the topics. Overall, my experience was great and I hope you keep up with the good work :)

headline: I enrolled on the CIPD level 3 course…
reviewBody:
I enrolled on the CIPD level 3 course and the enrolment process was very good and I received my login details. However, after this I felt very much alone and the website was not easy to navigate around and it was too bitty. On my first day I had no access to any of the content , however the student team did resolve this quickly. 

I found it very daunting as I had been out of education for a while and really needed more support. I emailed my support tutor and I had not received a response for 5 days, to which I then cancelled the course. This is because I had only just begun and I wasn’t getting assistance quick enough already. Especially as I was working full time and having limited time to complete the course. Not having the engagement with other students or feeling like you have the help was a struggle for me. 

Maybe this just was not for me but a few things could have been improved. Ciaran in the ICS team always came back quickly and assisted me but I felt once logged in, it was just taking such a long time to get a response from tutors.

headline: Enrollment onto the CIPD Level 7 Advanced Diploma in Human Resource Management
reviewBody: Th process of my application and enrollment onto the CIPD Level 7 Advanced Diploma in Human Resource Management was very easy and nice. Ciaran provided all the necessary information and answered all my questions showing patience and interest. Thank you very much!

headline: Helpful staff, not totally sure about the content yet
reviewBody:
Ciaran was really helpful and gave me all the information that I needed to be able to make an informed decision about whether to do the course. He wasn't pushy or salesy but patient and helpful.

The course itself has been OK so far. I'm not sure about the standard of the materials yet. It's a little frustrating to see quite a lot of typos in the slides. I'm yet to reserve judgement on the overall standard of the content because i've only just started but i'm enjoying getting stuck in overall.

Thanks for all your help Ciaran.

headline: Ciaran has been super helpful in…
reviewBody: Ciaran has been super helpful in signing up to both Level 3 and Level 5 of the HR Diploma.

headline: Mixed experience, but overall positive
reviewBody:
Tutors are very knowledgeable, and I have had relatively good experience when needing to contact them with the majority coming back very promptly. 
A little disappointing final experience with ICS Learn - after receiving my results for my final exam, and now having passed each module of my CIPD qualification, I received no communication from ICS Learn to let me know it was complete. I had to email them to understand what the next steps were which seemed to trigger them to organise for my results to be checked and my certificate arranged. In my opinion, this shouldn't be down to the student to arrange - I think the learning provider should update students on next steps as soon as final results have been released.

headline: Overcharged
reviewBody: Whilst the tutors are helpful, ICS have overcharged me and taken an extra payment from my account. The finance team still have not got back to me regarding this. If anyone chooses ICS and pays in instalments, be wary of this.

headline: Friendly and Helpful staff
reviewBody: Friendly and Helpful staff - Quick easy process,

reviewBody: I was stuck between which provider to go for for my CIPD level 5 and Ciaran made it a pretty easy choice. He was thorough with how the course was run, answered all my questions so quickly and checked up on me when I started. The process so far has been really straight forward!

headline: I find your sessions enjoyable and if i…
reviewBody: I find your sessions enjoyable and if i had them weekly I would be more confident and would make me engage more. You are very good plus you keep me motivated to continue this course

headline: My maths tutor is Melissa Lieberman
reviewBody: My maths tutor is Melissa Lieberman. Ever since I joined ICS Learn, she has been extremely helpful. I started off by doing IGCSE Maths meaning I couldn't access the live sessions. Knowing that, Melissa sent me the links to the recordings so I didn't miss out. I later transferred to GCSE Maths and if ever I didn't understand something, she'd explain it so well and made sure I understood it. She's also been taking the time to help me with something else related to maths and we really appreciate everything she's doing for us. She also answers really quickly which is so helpful. I strongly recommend Melissa to be your tutor!

headline: Pros and cons
reviewBody:
Had my CIPD L3 with them.. The delivery platform seems to be quite dificult at the beginning, so isn't welcoming for students at the beginning of their course; could be much more easier and structured.

Some of the tutors was really helpful, polite and their materials was structured in adequate order. With another I felt like I'm coming in the middle of the lesson and missed something, so have to read everything twice or using additional learning sources, so is pointlessly when you are spending thousand quid and still have to rely on additional sourcing.
However, giving the opportunity to complete an assessment once again if you have failed.

Took a long time to receive my Diploma, but not sure if that's their fault or CIPD.

Excellent customer service - always approachable and sufficient in their response.

headline: Very knowledgeable indivduals able to…
reviewBody: Very knowledgeable indivduals able to answer all my question and a quick & hassle free registration process. Login to student hub easy & course underway in no time at all !!

Everything was clearly explained and the follow up process was all in line with how it was presented at initial discussion.

The process of enrolment was very straightforward and so far all the ‘getting started’ procedures are easy to follow.

I've been with ICS Learn now for a few months studying Math. The online recordings created by Melissa are constructed perfectly - her way of explaining is so easy to understand. It's clear that Melissa puts in a lot of work into the videos and genuinely cares that the information is being transferred to the learner in the best kind of way. Also she has the most calming voice ever haha!
So happy I found ICS Learn

headline: The course advisor was really patient…

headline: Good support
reviewBody: Good support

headline: The website needs a makeover!
reviewBody:
The content of the course I am completing with ICS is interesting and something I am enjoying. Support from tutors is good, as is the online support from the web chat team. 

Something to think about if you are considering ICS Learn…

The ICS website is difficult to navigate, lots of brightly coloured boxes, the website is not easy on the eye. I found the headings and layout of the website difficult to navigate. 

The content used within the assessment briefs is different to the classroom presentation - this created some confusion.

**Thanks for the reply Sheila. I’m okay for help thank you, it’s just not very user-friendly and takes a while to work out.

As mentioned the content of the course is good, the feedback is more on the platform/way you are displaying the content.

headline: The customer service was very good
reviewBody: The customer service was very good. I spoke to Colin over email and booked a phone call at 4pm the next day, and to my surprise, i received the phone call at 4pm on the dot. He directed me through the payment method very well and received my instructions via email right away.

headline: Excellent service

Excellent service - Ciaran McEachen

I contacted ICS via their online chat and immediately connected with Ciaran who was super helpful.  By the time I had got back to my desk from the Meeting Room, I had received an email with an overview of the course, costs and offering further assistance if required.  He then sent me a virtual online login, in order I could experience how the training/study would take place, which really made me decide to undertake the study.

He was extremely helpful, responsive and gave excellent service.  :)

headline: Excellent
reviewBody: Excellent. Very helpful and polite. Replies are fast. Would recommend.

headline: I wrote a review when I joined back in…
reviewBody:
I wrote a review when I joined back in Sept and I feel I jumped the gun with my review. While Ciaran was easy to deal with, the enrollment was seamless and I was 'set up' quickly, the problems started once I got stuck in. 
I've 2 pieces of feedback here and I'll try to keep this brief:
1) the support tutors for the course are non existent. My opinion here is because so many people signed up recently, the tutors now look to have about 60 students each and they cannot cope with the volume of student queries so its taking 1 week+ to get any kind of reply, which dramatically slows down course progress.

2) I've started to get threatening emails from ICS credit control as THEY have not set up my monthly direct debit correctly and my account is 25 days overdue. I've spent the last week sending my DD mandate form to their Credit Control team multiple times and nobody has followed up to confirm they've set it up. They've now threatened to transfer my account to a debt collection agency.

This company is really struggling to cope with demand, their tutors are overwhelmed so take ages to reply and you effectively have to struggle through the course on your own. 

I hope this review helps someone because all of the 5 star reviews are not representing the true image of ICS as it is right now.

headline: Not for me
reviewBody:
I was initially tempted to enrol with ICS Learn because of the competitive price and the high rated reviews on Trustpilot. 
I spoke with Ciaran, and right away I was under the impression that he was a salesman more than an advisor? He was not really listening to my questions and he was almost in a rush to close the sale.
So I did a bit of futher research.. and I'm really glad I did! 
All the 5 stars reviews on Trustpilot are reviews from people that just started the course and they just talk about how easy is to enrol, but if you look well you'll notice that there are plenty of negative reviews regarding the actual tutoring and regarding the fact that you are not at all followed and supported throughout your studies.
Sorry but I will use a different provider.

headline: Spoke to Paul M who was really helpful…
reviewBody: Spoke to Paul M who was really helpful and professional. He explained what the course entails and the entire enrolment process and answered any questions I had to make my learning journey as productive as possible. I'm really pleased with the service. Thank you

headline: Highly efficient

headline: Lack of support
reviewBody: Lack of support. I was doing the AAT Level 2 and the materials provided were poor to say the least. No books included. You are left to your own devices only provided with power points. My tutor would not provide fast responses to my emails of despair leaving me feeling out of my depth, and when I asked to change tutor I was dismissed and told this was not possible. Please do look at other providers for AAT before deciding on ICS because there are many others that really do their best to ensure that you pass.

headline: so far so awesome !
reviewBody: so far so awesome !! :)

headline: Think twice about this, is distance learning good for you?
reviewBody:
When you speak to a tutor the help and advice is good, however you’re very much alone on your study’s. Do not do this if you would like help and advice when you require it, you have to email your tutor and wait for them to arrange a slot to call or an email back on advice. 

I took this up with the team as I didn’t progress in the 8 months I was signed up, it left me confused and frustrated. I believe they class it as ‘distance learning’ and it’s certainly not something that suits Me. I wish They explained this type of learning as it all seems amazing with a portal etc but that is the main part you need, support and someone to help you. I thought there would be at least a student line Between usual work hours for someone to be there to answer queries, as let’s face it there’s an office with plenty of staff administrating the join ups! 

I contested the cancellation fee as if paid enough in the time I was signed up and the response I got was:

“Whilst I understand the desire to have a quick answer to a query, waiting for one or two days for your tutor to respond is not unreasonable.

Therefore, the conclusion arrived at is that there has been no breach of service”

I will say the presentations/quizzes are good & they do have group lessons which were handy but when you have a question, it halts your learning until it’s answered therefore I do not think it’s worth it.

If you don’t like the sound of this type of thing then I’d go more down the route or getting a tutor, spend your money wisely especially during these times!

headline: Enrolling
reviewBody: I have not begun my study with ICS yet but the enrolment process has been fantastic. Anne-Marie, the representative that assisted me, was extremely helpful and super positive! She has made me feel confident that I will be well supported during my studies with ICS.

headline: There isn’t enough one to one I feel…
reviewBody:
There isn’t enough one to one I feel I’m paying for a service which is group led and I’m not getting extra support for my needs as I’m in a large group which is over shadowing my personal learning. I have reached out on several occasions yet only ever receive emails regarding the self help online videos yet if I have a question or answer there doesn't seem to be a direct response from the tutor everything is based around self learning online? I was told I would get one to one learning online and that hasn't been the case at all. 

I’m not benefiting.

headline: Melissa (Maths teacher)

headline: Ciaran was very helpful when I enquired…
reviewBody: Ciaran was very helpful when I enquired about the CIPD qualification. He sent me very detailed informative brochures and offered out help to answer any questions that I had in mind. He made it clear that I could contact him at any point if I did think of something I wanted to know. I found a cheaper online course and he price matched it straight away for me with no hesitation. He was very responsive which was useful as this is a new step for me and was patient with me when I was making my decision to go ahead with the course as I requested to look over everything that night. When I decided I was going ahead with the course he was very clear about the next steps, called me to take payment and explained to me that I would receive all my log in details shortly and my membership for CIPD. I am extremely happy with the service provided by Ciaran he sure did point me in the right direction. Ciaran has recently sent me a following up email to check that I have settled into the course and reminded me that he is there to support me with any further questions. Helpful, friendly, informative ✔️

headline: CIPS Level 4 Diploma - disappointing!
reviewBody:
I enrolled with ICS Learn to study for the CIPS Level 4 Diploma in Procurement and Supply which cost me about £1,200. ICS provided access to the CIPS E-Book and E-learning for all 8-modules (which is worth £300) as well as some powerpoint slides and a practice test. You also have access to a tutor who is very knowledgable and fast to respond. 

Prior to starting modules 1 and 2, I had telephone conversations with my tutor but didn't really gain much from them and and so I didn't bother thereafter. Also, the ICS learning material is not very good and so I pretty much relied on the CIPS E-Book and E-Learning as well as free revison material on YouTube.

However, the key to passing the CIPS Diploma exams is by taking as many practice tests as possible, and in my opinion, the ten questions provided by ICS for each module are not enough. 

ICS need to overhaul the CIPS Diploma course and add some genuine learning material (not just powerpoint slides) and at least 100 practice questions per module. Unless this happens, I suggest CIPS students self-study and put their money towards the CIPS membership and exam fees which are not paid by ICS.

reviewBody: ICS Learn demonstrates that there are no boundaries to learning. I live in the Caribbean and had the best online learning experience with ICS Learn. The support given by the ICS Team is amazing! They are truly student centric! Thank you Nicola Rennie, Gordon Stewart, Lauren Fox, Douglas Brown and the entire Team! Your assistance and dedication is truly unmatched! The Tutor support was great with prompt feedback!  I highly recommend ICS Learn for a fully supported online learning experience.

headline: Worst ever
reviewBody:
Unfortunately, it has been the worst experience ever. Students services rarely assisted me with solutions to my queries; apart from only one tutor, all others took time to reply making my studies highly frustrating.
For the price paid I would expect a much better service provider.
Thank you.

headline: Awful
reviewBody:
I would not recommend ICS Learn to anyone. The only positive thing about them is that my tutor was good but otherwise the whole experience was disappointing from start to finish. 
When I was working through my bookkeeping course I found that the system kept resetting my progress every time I logged out. On enquiring about this the first time I wasn`t given a straight answer, I was just told that everything seemed to be in place for my course and I should use Google Chrome.  I purchased a new laptop believing that my old laptop may have been the issue only for the problem to continue. It wasn`t until I queried this a second time that I was told that the system resets progress automatically to help with revision. Very frustrating that I was not told this the first time around. 
The course that I was studying was with AAT and due to Covid-19 the assessment centres all closed before I was able to sit my two assessments. My support period with ICS Learn was due to end in May but I received notification from AAT that my AAT membership had been extended until the end of October. When the assessment centres re-opened I tried to access my course on ICS Learn to revise only to find it gone. When I contacted ICS Learn and asked why my course was not visible when my time to sit my assessments had been extended I was told that the extension from AAT did not apply to my course access with ICS Learn and was given a list of fees that I would have to pay to extend my support period. I was surprised that ICS Learn did not work hand in hand with AAT given that they are a training provider for AAT courses. It wasn`t until I challenged ICS Learn about why I should have to pay an extension fee when I was unable to sit my assessments through no fault of my own that they agreed to extend my support period free of charge. 
Their system also does not appear to work properly, it marks answers wrong when they are right.
All in all I would look for an alternative training provider!

headline: My Experience with ICS Learn and Level 5 Certificate in Leadership and Management Course
reviewBody:
This course has met and exceeded my expectations. It further enhanced my knowledge in the area of leadership and management. I've learnt so much!!

The team at ICS Learn were very caring and professional individuals. The unwavering  support and encouragement especially that of my tutor Ms. Nicola Bowman, has propelled me towards becoming a better individual.

I would recommend this course to anyone who is already in the management field or who is aspiring to be a manager.

Thank you Team ICS Learn!!

headline: Total dissapointment
reviewBody: Gold diggers. Most of the tutors can not spell properly and they failed me for one small mistake.  This is the way the tuition fee stays in their pockets. Sometimes my feedback from different departments was contradicting so I was not sure what to do. Sooner or later someone will check them properly so they can hang up their license forever. :)

headline: There have been two gremlins.....
reviewBody:
There have been two gremlins.....
First, the password I was given did not work and I wasted time trying at different times over the weekend to access information. The good news is that when I rang to query this with student services I was quickly, and in a very friendly manner, given a new password that has worked. 
Secondly, the information needed for direct debit setup was not collected on registration and so involved extra calls etc. Again, I think that has been sorted.
I'm now looking forward to starting the course and have been impressed by the information from my tutor and the very clear organisation of the course content on your site.

headline: CIPD Level 5 Diploma
reviewBody:
I completed my CIPD Level 5 Diploma through ICS Learn and the experience was a mixed bag. First and foremost, this style of learning is perfect for those who learn at their own pace, possibly alongside full-time employment, and can cope with limited contact time from tutors. Unlike some other providers there is no deadline for each module, you have one deadline (18 or so months) by which point all assignments need to have passed. This allows you to get lots done at busy times and put the qualification aside when things are busier in your home/personal life.
For someone who is really looking to understand HR in depth and get the most out of their learning experience I would not recommend this service; you have one 60-90 minute seminar per module and can then email tutors separately. Although tutors are largely supportive and responsive, I do not think one hour per module is good value for money given the cost of the course. 
My other major concern with the course was the outdated nature of some of the materials; it looked like some modules had not had their content updated for several years (some referred to the upcoming Brexit referendum...) and this is not great in an area like HR, when standard practice and legislation are changing constantly. 
To conclude, ICS Learn are, for this course at least, perfect if you are 'just' looking to get the qualification. If you are looking to really enjoy your HR learning and need regular touch points with tutors I would recommend reaching out to other providers.

The tutors and live lessons is fantastic. Melissa is wonderful. I highly recommend anyone who hates maths to give ICS a go! Please always have this course available.

headline: No Hard-Sell, Just Genuine Caring Approach
reviewBody: I've had a bit of a time deciding what I wanted to do with my career and was looking into a career change. I decided on Accountancy and looked online at AAT's website to see who would be available to teach the course long-distance and had initially had the plan to study with a local institution. That's when I came across ICS Learn. Out of all the providers I had sent an email to, not only were ICS Learn the most responsive but they had the best choice of courses available. The minute I had my course advisor Anne-Marie get in touch, I trusted her from the start and she gave me only the necessary information regarding my choice. There was no hard-sell, just genuine commitment to have me sign up for the right course. She is a big reason behind why it was so easy to choose ICS as my course provider. I've already jumped into the course now that I've signed up and I'm excited for the future and where my career can go. Big thank you to Anne-Marie and ICS for helping me with my decision.

headline: My preferred rating would be a 3.5.
reviewBody:
My preferred rating would be a 3.5.

I found my overall experience to be good and it is likely that I would recommend ICS Learn to a friend/do another course through ICS Learn, but what really lets it down is the portal.

Navigating through the portal was extremely tiresome. Not all information is in one place and I often needed to click around for 15 to 30 minutes just to find all the information I needed. 

For example, some topics are saved under "Getting started with your course" and some topics I would have expected to find under this heading were under "Connect and Communicate", e.g. the the induction webinar. There is a link to the induction webinar under "Getting started with your course", but it takes you to a different page with not the same resources. 

Overall, the portal is a real maze and it was extremely frustrating to find the resources I needed easily.

However, the tutors and student support were excellent.

headline: A-Level Economics
reviewBody:
I have been looking for an online provider of A-level economics for a few months. I found ICS online and their prices seems very completive and the reviews were very impressive.

I decided to take the plunge and enrol. I was contact by phone call explaining how much the costs would be and I was offered an interest free payment plan over 6 month which was very helpful. Once I paid my first instalment. I was sent log in details and given basic information about the course and some study tips. I was also contacted by my next support tutor who again gave study tips and offer help throughout my course.

The online portal is very easy to use. The course is layout in units and each unit is broken down into sections. It refers to the text book which they recommend you purchase to enforce their text on each study. However I believe you could get through the course without the book if you really wanted as they provide good details.

After I complete my course I will look into studying with ICS again just because I enjoy learning.

headline: taking more money off you so beware
reviewBody: I paid for a 2 year course that I finished in 3 months but I still need to pay monthly fees! Not happy about this as the course was ridiculously easy for the money. It was an HR course so no wonder my HR department are useless if its that easy to get qualified. Beware, they have changed to a new payment system and are taking more money off people. It's a glitch apparently but please please check your DD payments in case its happened to you! I got it sorted but they haven't communicated this to anyone else I don't think!

headline: Can you copy to Twitter?
reviewBody:
Can you copy to Twitter?


Husband had to suspend studies in March due to Covid.  But, ICS Learn Have been unsupportive of this NHS ICU worker who suspended PT course as he works on the front line during Covid. Working hours returned to near normal by end of July. He needed to then take a month to take a step back and de stress from what could only be described as having been in what was like a war zone for months.  Now ready to resume studies, ICS Learn has told him he’s only got 5 weeks to complete the course, despite having 14/15 weeks left when he suspended the studies. NO special consideration and they will keep the money. Penalised for saving lives. Shame on ICS Learn

headline: Lost almost £700
reviewBody: I enrolled about a year ago but couldn't do the course due to other commitments. I was under the impression that I could access the course whenever I wanted as I've PAID for it. I also paid for exams that I did not even take. I don't think they were clear enough about the process and I feel like I've been duped out of nearly £700. They would hound me down for payments but not send reminders that my course would expire. This is deceptive and false advertising and will never use their service again.

I said I want some time to read through everything but would contact him if I needed his help. 
I was not hounded by Fraser he gave me as much time as I needed. 
When I registered Fraser was there to help again, happy to give advise and answer my questions. It all seemed to easy and I couldn’t be happier with the service I have been given. Thank you Fraser for making this hard decision so much easier!

headline: AAT Review
reviewBody:
Enrolled in ICS Learn shortly before Covid and although my course was extended they will not consider giving me a refund even though AAT offered me one and I am panicking about being able to get to Birmingham ( nearest exam center amid Covid drama as elderly relative look after my daughter.) 

On another matter I decided to 'Crack' on, and have received little to no help, my tutor at first took 3 days to respond, just recently the response has improved but not the support, all they send it print off work sheets, at one stage they sent me 70 pages to print off!! no use to me at all, also how will I know if the answers are right. 
Computer tests are so sensitive it keeps telling me that the whole question is wrong, and I spend 20 minutes analyzing it to find there isn't an N/A in the correct box!
At my wits end as at one stage tutor told me not to worry if answers were coming back incorrect if I couldn't see why.. I mean what??  
and I really wouldn't  recommend at this stage I'm seriously worried I have totally wasted my money and will end up having to enroll with another provider just for my own sanity.

- To conclude to the reply I have had from this message, I can indeed prove that the material I was sent was for printing and not editable if you would like to supply an email address for me to forward these documents onto, I would also like to add my course tutor has told me that with a net value of 165.833333 r I am supposed to 'Round up' because vat has to be rounded down - I am seriously worried about the peopl;e qualified to 'teach' or maybe it is that your material is not at all fir for purpose. If this continues I would liek a refund.

headline: Surprised at all the good reviews here
reviewBody:
Surprised at all the good reviews here. If you go on the AAT student Facebook group ICS comes out as the worst provider. Don't waste your money. Lots of people regret using this company. Mistakes in course content and other providers actually provide you with course material alongside the online material. I found the course material had so many mistakes and poorly structured I actually ended up ditching it and spending more money on books from other providers. I think the real reviews must be getting deleted. Time will tell

In response to the reply I don’t think my concerns have really been addressed directly, otherwise I would not feel the need to leave the review. I have wasted my money, nothing will convince me otherwise. I stand by my review that there are much better providers.

headline: ICS learn: more than a business.
reviewBody:
From the moment I started working with the ICS team I knew I was in safe hands. Both my Human Biology and Mathematics teachers were there on hand to answer any question. Often providing me with extra questions and material along with links to further reading and research. 

However, it was during the crisis when they truly showed their desire to see their students cross the line, by going that extra yard, ensuring that we all got assessed and graded and in the end, passing the exams required. Online exams in my home and phone calls from tutors made this possible.

A big thanks to my tutors, my Human Biology tutor was unstoppable with support and extra help. My maths tutor provided me with the confidence to re-enter the adult classroom and come top, every time in each mock exam. The exams admissions team worked tirelessly to get me across the line, I am now a trainee teacher.

Thank you, so very much.

headline: UPDATED - Price doesn't reflect quality of course or tutoring…
reviewBody:
Previously had a good experience of completing one unit of the course. Hence why I then chose ICS to complete the full CIPD course with. Initial sign up is excellent, cost of course explained etc. 
However I've been incredibly disappointed with my experience so far. Every interaction with Student Services or tutor seems to involve being quoted SLA constantly (perhaps I need to quote the £2500 fee I paid), the tutor seems to respond within the SLA but the content is so vague it means my reply then takes another 2 days to respond to. Tutor also had the audacity to quote SLA to me when I chased a response to assignment (which was 5 days over SLA). Appreciate it's distance learning, but if I added up how much time is taken with delays, it would probably amount to a month of the course.
Some of the course content doesn't correlate with the assessment criteria, nor does the lesson content between tutors. I really feel like I've been mis sold this course and the tutors don't get pulled up on poor and late responses because they are a selling point to promote the course. I get absolutely no support from Student Services and they always seem very evasive when I ask for a contact at Curriculum Support. 
If I wouldn't lose so much money, I'd sign up for the course elsewhere!

UPDATE - I thought it would make sense to update my previous review with one less star (unfortunately you have to select at least one). The level of support and service has dropped even lower in the last couple of months. It appears that ICS are still charging people full price for courses, while decreasing the availability of tutor support, by assigning each person a "support tutor". That's if you get a response. Appreciate it's not immediate response, but waiting 5+ days for a response on a question relating to a unit isn't helpful or conducive to passing an assignment. I've recently extended my support period, but will certainly be putting in a request for it to be extended further to make up for the delays (not out of my pocket - £3000 down and still not getting what I paid for). The two hour drop in sessions are also completely pointless and sporadic.  The course discusses HR professionalism constantly. It's a shame that the provider didn't practice what they preach! I'm not the only one to think this and am regularly seeing complaints from fellow students on the same issues. Hopefully CIPD will eventually drop them as a provider of their courses, because their representation is terrible!

headline: Spoke to a lady called Anne Marie and…
reviewBody: Spoke to a lady called Anne Marie and she got me all signed up. Lovely lady and so helpful

headline: Experience as a Learner
reviewBody:
I did enjoy my experience while on the ICS Lean programme however there are a few things that made the journey harder for me:
- The portal - this was very difficult to navigate alone without any guidance. I know there is an initial video you watch however it doesn't make sense where things are located. I feel everything for that unit should be in the same place not 3/4
- Tutors - i feel some of my tutors were not as receptive to me asking questions and came across abrupt in their communications. As learners are learning remotely i didn't find this useful at all. 
- Communication - at the end of my journey i had to message a tutor to understand what i had to do (ie call the student services) - i feel some more guidance on what to do at the end of the programme would be beneficial
- Live webinars - i had one live webinar that started at 7pm and didn't finish until 8:20pm! Most of the information given was not relevant to the task and i was more confused then when i joined. This meant i spent longer than i wanted trying to understand the unit and assignment. 
Due to some of these things i was put off completing this course and it is only hat i was furloughed for 4 months that i actually found the motivation to understand and complete it. 
I know some of the above has been negative however i would like to point our 2 of my tutors Wendy Chippendale and Leigh Hinshelwood. Both of these tutors supported and inspired me throughout my journey and i am very grateful for that. These two tutors alongside my own work, gave me the confidence to feel comfortable being an L&D professional. I want to say a personal thank you to them both!
I hope you can do something with this feedback. Please pass this onto the 2 tutors named

headline: Supportive Institution!
reviewBody: Corresponded with Rory who was very understanding and empathetic to my reasons for cancelling the course. He offered me a reasonable fee to cancel which I am very grateful for. My reasons for closing the course was nothing to do with ICS, Ive just been faced with difficult circumstances this year due to the pandemic and I had to prioritise the essentials. They also offered a payment holiday as means to support learners who are struggling. Although initially I wasn't happy, ICS has left a positive lasting impression!

headline: I found Fraser to be very helpful and…
reviewBody: I found Fraser to be very helpful and efficient.  Once I had taken an interest in the course he sent me an email including all the necessary information I required in order to make my decision and made sure I had his contact details if I needed them.  When I emailed Fraser he replied promptly and called me to discuss at the agreed time.  Excellent service.

headline: Avoid - lots of reasons why...
reviewBody:
Avoid. The online resources for the AAT qualifications is awful compared to rivals, the tutors email once and you never hear from them again, there seems to be no drive from them to help you succeed other than when they want your money to sign up. Like most companies they bury all the stuff in terms and conditions, then when you cancel they unfairly penalise you - Like having to pay the full AAT membership fee when cancelling even though you e only used it for a month. Certainly look for better Accountancy learning providers like Accountancy Learning Ltd - I have been with them for a month and my tutor had emailed me atleast 5 times offering help. They have more of a family run business feel where the customer/student is actually important to them, not a mechanism like ICS to take your money and deliver nothing. Overall, Avoid ICS - there are better providers for your money.


Response to ICS on their reply: your insinuation that I am not compatible with online learning is laughable. I work online, do online courses all the time and are now, luckily, with a much better online learning provider. You do not make fees clear - if it was clear I would not be writing this!

headline: Helpful and compassionate
reviewBody: Lauren was so helpful and the most friendly advisor I’ve ever spoken to. She listened and understood my issue, she also resolved it! Very happy. 😊

headline: A Level History
reviewBody:
I decided last year that I wanted to pursue a career as a history teacher and upon starting this journey it became apparent that I needed to complete an A level in History to further support my application as my degree was not directly linked to History. Having researched different online providers I was drawn straight away to ICS Learn specifically due to the score and numerous reviews on Trustpilot.

Having a busy full time job with a young family, ICS's online platform and support network provided me the flexibility that I desperately needed to succeed on the course. Working at my own pace I soon found a rhythm and work pattern that enabled me to complete the materials and submit test papers, mock exams and complete the NEA. During this unprecedented and unpredictable year I can't speak highly enough of the support I received; special mention to my tutor Gordon, curriculum leader Melanie and the exam support team.

With the completion of my A level, I am now able to celebrate achieving a grade B, and moving onto my History PGCE in September!

ICS Learn I thank you all very much!!
