headline: A very happy customer.
reviewBody: I've completed both the Level 3 and Level 5 CIPD diploma in HRM now with ICS Learn and both have gone brilliantly. If i've ever needed any assistance from student services/quality assurance (Lauren and Debra this time) they've always been really helpful and sorted out my issues quickly and thoroughly. The tutor's give great feedback on assignments and if any are Not Yet Passes their feedback really helps to show where you have made mistakes. The regular deals and payment plans are great and make it much easier to get started without having to worry about paying the entire cost up front. I got a new job last year all thanks to studying the Level 5 and can't be happier, so thank you to everyone at ICS Learn!

headline: Anna Maria has been very helpful…
reviewBody: Anna Maria has been very helpful through out the start up process and is always willing to help in anyway... thank you so much for helping me start a career in accounting

headline: The tutor support was great and I…
reviewBody: The tutor support was great and I always received very quick responses and feedback, which was really helpful. I have only marked as 4 stars, instead of 5, as I often found spelling mistakes/grammatical errors in the content and the learner website is really confusing to use. It always took me such a long time to find where things were, so I think the layout could be massively improved to make the user experience better.

headline: Quick and helpful information and advice from CIPD Advisor
reviewBody: I was able to make a decision fairly quickly to take up L & D Level 5 due to the quick and useful replies from Ciaran to address my concerns. After 3 weeks into the course, I'm quite certain that this will value add my career and look forward to learning on the ICSLearn platform.

headline: Fraser was professional  and helpful…
reviewBody: Fraser was professional  and helpful throughout my experience. He offered both email and mobile support to answer queries which was very useful and made the process a lot easier.

headline: Excellent Service and super flexible!
reviewBody:
After seeing so many employers on so many job ads looking for people with AAT qualifications I decided to look into it. I didn't really know much about it to be honest but I did know the route I wanted to go down was bookkeeping so I started there. 

I made an enquiry and was dealt with by a lady named Anne Marie, she was extremely helpful and patient answering all of the questions that I had and taking time to respond in detail. Most importantly she sent me a link to test my knowledge before I decided which level to go for and I am so glad that she did as it resulted in me choosing the right course to study at a level that is suited to me. 

The course is incredibly flexible, you can stop and start any time you like and it works perfectly around my job and other aspects of my life. I have been out of studying for 8 years so I'm glad they also start you off easy with simple numeracy and literacy skills just to help jog your memory and get your brain used to working in that capacity again.

I haven't yet finished the course so have no idea where it will take me career wise but after speaking to people in relation to it in some roles I have found that it is really well sought after and something that you should definitely undertake if you have the time to spare!

Overall, I am happy with how easy it was to set everything up, I was literally studying the next again day, and also how friendly the service was, a huge thanks to Anne Marie for all her support throughout, I would definitely recommend!

headline: So far so good
reviewBody: So far so good, all materials are great and very easy to navigate around. Support there if needed, can’t wait to see how I do

headline: Passed my GCSE Maths on my 3rd attempt with ICS Learn!!!
reviewBody:
This is my 3rd attempt at the Maths exam, and I have finally achieved my grade 4 (C). My online tutor Melissa Lieberman gives excellent tutoring in the webinars, and makes everything easy to understand step-by-step. I would like to say a big thank you to her and ICS Learn for making this possible!!!!

Owen Day.

headline: ICS can't simply wash it's hands of…
reviewBody:
ICS can't simply wash it's hands of this issue. I am tired of following up with CIPD and now not interested in doin so. I have paid tuition fees to ICS therefore ICS must take responsibility to ensure that students get their certificate upon completion of the course. It's your responsibility to communicate with CIPD and resolve the issue. Students shouldn't suffer due to negligence of CIPD. If you don't have authority to directly communicate with CIPD than you have no authority to take tuition fees from the students. I am simply not interested in any of your justification. I am going to spread it all over social media to let students know the reality of ICS. I have already communicated with local authorities to blacklist your operation in the region and considering appropriate legal action.

Raviraj Kumar

headline: Very efficient and I was able to enrol…
reviewBody: Very efficient and I was able to enrol onto the courses and begin straight away, all thanks to Colin Urquhart.

headline: Good first impressions
reviewBody: Still in the early days with the course but so far so good. The website is easy to navigate and a full induction given when you first log on. I love that you able to take little exams and given results straight away so you understand your strengths and weaknesses. The webinars are great too, you are able to listen to past webinars and pause/rewind to take notes. You are also able to join future webinars and provided dates and times they are running. Having a tutor that you can speak to at anytime is a major plus. I have not yet had any queries but I know that they are there when I need help.

headline: Total disappointment ... REVISED TO Satisfied.
reviewBody:
Total disappointment! Called today to register for a course I'd made enquiries about, all signed up and email sent to access my learning material only to find I had been signed up for a different course from what I asked!

Maybe it is the call centre operative who needs to do some learning! A key skill of the job is to listen, she clearly did not!

Not a great start. My advice to anyone else, make sure you are listened to!

REVISED:
Further to my initial two star rating, having spoken with Shelia this morning, I have taken solace in her actions and felt the need to upgrade my rating to four stars. Shelia listened to the issue and took corrective action to help me in a proactive manner. Thank you Shelia for giving me some confidence back. 

So far, the learning material and support has been great.

headline: Lovely and friendly staff
reviewBody: Lovely and friendly staff, made everything very simple and easy!

headline: Be advised to look around before committing your time, money and effort.
reviewBody:
I wouldn't bother, poor support from tutors that are constantly changing or are on 'holiday'. Interactive content that is not that interactive, a clunky makeover of moodle at best, learning materials all over the place and difficult to utilise, not to mention changing every time you log in. Reference material also changes or moves location, if you have not finished a module or assignment don't expect to find your reference material in the same place or for it to be the same material or even there at all! 

All in all, a positive sales team backed by a poor LMS, and poorly motivated tutors who do little to advise or support you through the programme. Be cautious as the requirements will probably change as did mine for the CIPD level 5 Diploma in L&D notwithstanding the reduction in the amount of attempts at submission you were allowed, please be advised to look around before committing your time, money and effort.

headline: Brilliant lessons
reviewBody: Theses online lessons are absolutely fantastic. Melissa has changed my perception of maths from something I need to do, to a passion and dare I say it, a bit of a hobby. I intend on sitting the higher tier GCSE Exam, with the intention of doing A level maths, then hopefully Further Maths. When people in the past have said that mathematics is a beautiful subject, I used to think that that was just a load of philosophical hog-wash. Now I know where they are coming from; it truly is. thanks Melissa.

headline: Excellent lessons!
reviewBody: Really excellent lessons. Very clear and easy to follow. I'm nearly finished and have thoroughly enjoyed the course. And Melissa Liebermann is lovely, thoughtful and professional, and a pleasure to listen to :-)

headline: If I can, anyone determined can!
reviewBody:
Well here I am a year later and I have completed the studies and now have a Diploma in HR Resource Practice.  As a mother of 3 and working full time, this has been challenging and rewarding in equal measure.  I am so looking forward to embarking on the next stage of my career in Training and L&D opportunities, an exciting prospect ahead.
My goal to complete this before a significant birthday has been achieved, I'm proud of myself!

headline: Pros and cons
reviewBody:
The tutors were really good, their feedback was very supportive and helped a lot with my learning. Most of them were really quick at getting back to me and marking assignments (only had an issue with one tutor not following the agreed timescales). The online classrooms were convenient and helpful. 

The actual course material was often out of date or not particularly useful. It often contradicted what the tutors wanted, and therefore I wasted time with some assignments.  More time should be spend updating the course material and making it more relevant for the unit, assignments and learning.

headline: Borderline scam
reviewBody:
The reviews about the enrolment service are there because they ask, or in other words 'beg' for it. I think people who do these reviews forget that those working in the enrolment progresses, are trained to do so, and make you buy the product. 
I have to say I was incredibly optimistic about studying with ICS Learn after speaking to the student advisors, having their reassurance about the content of the course - being ensured it included 'extensive feedback', and 'interactive quizzes' (where?) It absolutely does not, and I will add at this point the advisor knew exactly which course I wished to be enrolled in so you can't say "they may offer interactive quizzes on some courses!" and extensive feedback is nonsense. 
Also, when I first paid my deposit for the course ('deposit' = not what it usually means, it is just the upfront payment, you do not get it back) I was denied access to the services for over 24 hours due to a 'technical error', even though I was promised my login details within an hour. When I did eventually get access, my tutor went on holiday the next day, for I believe it was 10 days - meaning I couldn't interact with her during most of the trial period. I have now been with ICS for (I believe) almost 3 months. For me, at the time, this was not an issue, but now I see it as incredibly unproffessional (not the holiday, but the technical issue, as I was not informed about the lack of my login details, I had to enquire about them myself when I didn't recieve them for 3 hours, it was only then I was informed that they had a techincal issue and I might not get the details for another '24 hours' - apparently this was information they had known the moment I had paid, but yet they did not tell me about. I was also not given any extra trial period despite not being able to use their services properly for first, the 24 hours I waited for my login, and then the 10 days my tutor was away)
I understand the method of contacting your tutors yourself, as I have done on a few occasions. But my tutors replies are so short, as if I am wasting her time by even contacting her, she regularly ignores about half my questions, and doesn't seem interested in the slightest to make any sort of encouragement, conversation or even give advice outside of a very basic response to a single question out of the few I ask. It makes me nervous to contact her, I sometimes even forget I am paying almost £300+ for this service. I have yet to send in a mock exam for marking, as my computer has been broken. But I have one ready to send, and, based on the reviews regarding how they mark their mock exams, and based on my experience with my tutor - I do not have high hopes that this will give me any insight at all into how I am progressing with the course. 
Aside from tutor support being a major issue, and the advisors exaggerating what exactly ICS offer. The actual content of the materials themselves are, in some words, useless. They are full of blatant inaccuracies, such as outdated Laws (and when I brought this up to my tutor, she, at first, dismissed it as she 'couldn't find where I was talking about' with no other concern, so I had to give her a direct reference number, and when she found it, admitted it was wrong and said it was 'already going to be edited in the next editing session', even though the Law had changed 10 years ago.) The materials also are very vague, it cannot be completely understood or even give enough information to even answer the questions which ICS give you themselves, without the accompanying AQA textbook (which, it's worth mentioning I was told to buy the WRONG textbook at first, I had to work out which one to buy myself) I also realised that there is a lot of free websites that provide suspicously similar content, but yet I am paying £300+ to read almost the same thing. The sections are all very short, very brief & there is nothing to it other than reading off a screen. 
I cannot give them the benefit of the doubt here, and say that it might just be 'the way i learn', because I am doing better by myself, using Google, knowledgable people in my real life on the subject & reading the AQA textbook than I am with ICS learn, and I'm getting all that for free!, not £300+. The reason I paid for this service was naively, I thought it would provide more structure to how I should learn the content (it doesn't), my tutor would be able to provide support, advice & encouragement when I did message her (she is instead, blunt & disinterested), and I would be somewhat validated as a student (this is now the only reason I haven't cancelled, as I have paid too much towards the course already, so what a waste) Let this be a warning to anyone considering studying with ICS.

headline: The man, the myth, the legend ICS Ciaran
reviewBody:
I started off in doing market research on various providers and put in my details for ICS Learn. Not but a minute later I was contacted with regards to all my questions for the course.

The man, the myth, the legend himself Ciaran McEachen contacted me.

His professional attitude and apt conversational skills lead me to be intrigued. He built up a solid case for joining ICS as I was previously interested so I did more research and was looking to go with another company. However Ciaran quickly came to the rescue, price matched, and solidified the reasons for me to go with ICS.

I have never been so pleased with the ease of the on boarding process for my future as I have with Ciaran. He has brought a joy to my life that even two ply toilet paper could not achieve.

If you are reading this review thank you for taking the time to read it all the way through and thank you ICS for the wonderful experience I have had so far.

headline: If you want encouragement or them to engage, not for you.
reviewBody:
A lot of these reviews seem to be about enrolment, and I completely agree that the customer service and learner engagement team are good. 
I have failed to complete my HR course, and I put a lot of this down to the delivery model of ICS learn. This may well just not have been the course for me, but if you're like me, it's a word of warning.
There are platforms that you can contact ICS learn about the course you are doing, but they are not proactive in any way other than advising you of when tutors are on annual leave. 
You are left to your own devices, and there is not encouragement or direct contact to engage with you.
I submitted my first assignments and felt that the feedback from the tutor was incredibly negative. The second assignment submitted to the same tutor had feedback that wasn't in relation to my submission, and again, I felt was negative and demotivating. 
I contacted them to have a different tutor assigned. This seemed to be an issue, however, after pushing with my knowledge of how training companies must be set up, they assigned me a different tutor. 
Unfortunately, by this point I was incredibly demotivated and felt no encouragement or support to continue with my course.
As I said, it may well just have been the wrong course format for me, or may be I hoped for too much, but if you want encouragement and for the training provider to instigate engagement, I couldn't recommend ICS learn.

secondly few of the tutors really reply quickly that increase your motivation and allows you to go ahead. they also address your issues and doubts in no time. but it all depends from one tutor to another.

headline: GCSE/A LEVEL BEWARE! LOOK ELSEWHERE!
reviewBody:
I have been a member of ICS Learn since 2017 and have undertaken 2 A Levels and 2 GCSEs with them.

It was nothing but frustrating trouble and a waste of money. Please, look elsewhere. You will regret buying these courses.

The courses are rife with spelling and grammatical mistakes - my emails about mistakes in the courses reached into the double digits. I was told they would be fixed - 2 months later and still nothing. 

The tutor(s) you are given aren't the 1-2-1 tutors you'd expect. Think of it more as being in school/college with 30-50 other students. Tutors often take more than a day to reply, usually missing the point of your question completely, leaving you no more confident than before they answered. By the time your tutor has replied, you've moved on from that question. It's clunky and messaging your tutor feels like a burden and a chore.

The majority of courses consistent of long walls of text with no real objective or clear points. A summary is usually given at the end but still isn't clear.

These are just a few points with what's wrong with their A Level and GCSE courses. The majority of the good reviews come from customers leaving reviews after signing up with the super-smooth process or the in-house maths teacher asking you to rate her maths session, as you can see by my only other 2 reviews.

I would recommend any other distance-learning site more than this one. I regret buying these courses and spending upwards of £1000. Absolutely beware - browse the low-scoring reviews to get a more accurate feel of this 'learning provider'.

I'm well aware that the employees of ICS Learn know who I am after countless emails and complaining - never a good thing!

headline: I'd like to give a good review but in…
reviewBody: I'd like to give a good review but in all honesty the coursework is riddled with errors which is obvious when you know the 'answers' but causes confusion when learning new material. 'Checks/tests' during the learning are often too inflexible and tell you you're wrong when in fact you are correct - which is demoralising (e.g. in the accountancy course you are told that commas in amounts are optional but tests will sometimes 'want' (without saying) £1000 at other times £1,000 and mark wrong if you don't 'guess' right), and sometimes they are plain wrong, such as addition errors which confuse students trying to learn. Having part-completed an accountancy level 2 I would strongly advise registering with AAT and buying a book instead! Personally I did an OU course many years ago and cannot praise their learning materials enough. This course feels like it has never been proof-read and I feel like I parted with money for no good reason. The tutor has been quite useful when asked advice, but if the course material were the standard it should be (for the price) the learning would be so much easier.

headline: ISC Learn - Highly Recommended!
reviewBody:
I can highly recommend ISC Learn!
I did a fair bit of research before signing up and decided to go with ICS Learn.
I signed up for Maths GCSE and am 3 months into my course.
I could not be happier. There is everything you need and more to help you learn. It`s extremely well put together.

I want to thank Colin on the chat for his help with questions.
Maggie who helped me sign up and explain the payment side of things.
And Melissa Lieberman who is one of the best up beat, positive  teachers I have had the pleasure to study with. 
If you are looking for maths GCSE course work you would be hard pushed to find anyone better than Melissa Lieberman to teach you. She clearly has the experience and  passion for what she does.

100% customer satisfaction so far.

headline: I wouldn't recommend these courses.
reviewBody: I have only recently purchased my course for ICS learn (business and psychology A-Level) and I can say that the layout is bad and I am struggling to understand what is being explained. I have powerpoints from the A-Level I was doing before for business so I am using those alongside the course, however, I am relying on the powerpoints significantly more than I am on the ICS learn course. it is explained in a very complicated way and some of the information is not even present, despite still being asked questions on it in the progress checks. I bought this course expecting high quality and that is not what I have received. I am very disappointed by this course and would not recommend it. I would like a full refund for this course as it has not provided me with the information and quality I was expecting.

She put my mind at ease, gave me information on the exams I would need to take and then price matched a quote from someone else. I couldn't be happier. I am on day 4 and starting my second lesson. I love it!

headline: Very disappointed by lack of support
reviewBody: I've started an HR course and so far have had little or no support from the tutor. It is important ICS Learn makes it clear on their website that the support is limited and not 'unlimited' as this is what students are paying for. It is really bad that students like me are left to their own devices to try to work out answers alone. Its also crucial that tutors get back to students ASAP otherwise it affects the completion of assessments.I've had to wait 4 to 7 days for my tutor to respond. It's been a disappointing experience so far which I would not recommend others share.

headline: only interested in your money
reviewBody: Once they got my money, that was it. no help or support. I am having real problems with this course due to website issues, audio issues, navigational issues, overall accessibility. Have complained several time and after an initial assurance that my complaint is being prioritised, I have heard nothing. radio silence. I am having to rely on colleagues and other students to help me and even googling essay sites, yes that's cheating but if ICSlearn won't provide the learning I'm paying for, how else am I meant to get the qualification necessary for my job? ICS don't use plagarism checkers anyway and the tutors have so many essays to mark they dont check either. they get paid either way. I resent paying so much money for complete lack of communication and support. If ICS take action against me, I'll take action of my own. After all, it is false advertising. I'm paying for a service I'm not getting and they are even ignoring my refund requests so again what choice do I have but to resort to other methods?

headline: Good first impressions!
reviewBody: I have only just started my course so I haven’t been able to explore all ICS Learn has to offer. The start of my journey has been great, the course advisor was lovely and kept in touch with me throughout the process. She answered all of my questions and was very confident in the course knowledge. Everything has happened as she said it would; I was able to get into the system within 10 minutes of registering. I’ve also been introduced to my tutor who will be available to support me whenever I need it. The course materials look good from what I’ve seen and the practice tests are great for the end of each unit. I look forward to getting stuck in to my course completely and excited by what opportunities it will bring me.

headline: Poor value for money
reviewBody:
Have recently completed AAT Level 3 course with ICS. I felt the materials provided on the ICS portal were very basic, particularly disappointing were the video seminar recordings which consist of a woman reading through a powerpoint slide show with very little deterioration from the script and indicate the host had little accounting knowledge. If you compare these seminars to the excel one on the AAT site you will realise how engaging seminars can be with the right host. I was also left disappointed by the lack of tutor support, I received two marked test feedbacks during the whole of my course so it felt very much like self-study.

The only positive from the course was the Kaplan books which ICS provided, I was used to them from Level 2 and they provided me with a good understanding of the subject but I was left wandering why ICS were charging so much for what amounts to a self-study course.

I can't comment on ICS Learn as a full learning experience as I am yet to start my course but so far so good.

headline: Colin the helpful and friendly ICS advisor
reviewBody: Colin was friendly, informative and efficient. He knew, and told me what to expect once I was enrolled. Also, he told me how many hours 8–10 hours of study I would need to do to sit my exam next summer. I am really looking forward to starting my course..Colin also wished me the best of luck. Thanks Colin.

headline: Collin is the best course advisor
reviewBody:
So my Course advisor was Collin when i first contacted ICS learn I had no clue what I was getting myself into. But collin assured me that everything would be perfect and I would be able to go at my own pace through the courses. This is day 2 of my Maths and English and I am finding this very easy for my brain to handle as Maths was not my best subject. I have learned so much due to no pressure on deadlines or anyone that is distracting me and feel like I can pass this 100% with my best shot ever. 

Thank you

headline: Thank you to Ciaran McEachen
reviewBody: Thank you to Ciaran McEachen for getting my questions answered, enrolled and starting my studies all within the same weekend!

headline: I have recently began my Level 5 CIPD…
reviewBody: I have recently began my Level 5 CIPD Diploma in Learning and Development with ICS Learn and can't fault the service and support that I have received so far. In particular Ciaran has been amazing with answering any questions that I have in a very timely manner and his customer serve skills have been great. I am looking forward to getting stuck into my course knowing that I have access to great support along the way.

headline: Recommended for CIPD studies
reviewBody:
The sign up process is simple with a very professional and quick turnaround, and any exam questions have been quickly and thoroughly answered by Sandra who has been a superstar at every interaction.

The system is easy to navigate and the opportunity to work at one's own pace is perfect for me, whilst tutors have always responded and arranged calls when requested,

I have done both CIPD L5 and L7 through ICS and would definitely recommend them for those happy to self-drive their learning experience.

headline: Very happy so far!

headline: Left high and dry
reviewBody: Excellent course with tutor feedback and great resources but two months after finishing I have no certificate or any communications from ics who have now admitted their systems have failed and my results were never sent to cipd. I now have to wait 2 months for cipd to confirm my result.  Wanted to start the next part of my journey with ics but too worried about paying more money and starting next part until I get my certificate.

headline: ICS Learn Live Chat function
reviewBody:
ICS Learn Live Chat function

The ICS Learn Live Chat function is a very simple, quick and convenient method of finding answers to any issues that students might be stuck with.  

The Student Services Advisor came across as very polite and knowledgeable.

As a result of the webchat that I participated in, I am now able to get on with accessing the student material much more quickly than if I had waited for an e-mail to reset my password.

headline: Really easy to get started

headline: Excellent Service
reviewBody:
I have just enrolled with ICS Learn to do AAT. I spoke with Katy Mathers who was very helpful and informative, as I had several questions before I wanted to go ahead. She gave me all information upfront about fees, so everything was very transparent from the start. I sent her a further email afterwards and she responded very quickly.

Everything was so quick and simple. I paid over the phone and a few minutes later I had an email with logins details to the site and I could immediately begin. 

Once logged in, there was plenty of information to read about the course and what to expect. The website is easy to use, but again there is information about the different features as well as an introductory video on the course.

Excellent service, really looking forward to my studies, lovely staff as well, would definitely recommend!

headline: Great online course, recommend
reviewBody:
I have enrolled online because it suits better my studying needs :-) and ICS Learn has, so far, met all my criteria (3 weeks in). Firstly I asked loads of questions trying to find out what the best financial option would be for me and all of them were answered, no hidden costs, honest, perfect. The process of enrollment went smoothly, so far I am discovering everything the course (AAT - A&B Level 2) can offer and have done some mock tests and both ICS learning webinars and AAT webinars.
Special mention goes to Anne-Marie who is so professional yet friendly and has been in touch couple of times to make sure I am ok as a student (as you do most stuff yourself, especially orientation on their web, time schedule etc.).
Thanks! :-)

All Advisors have been very helpful. I would highly recommend ICS Learn!

headline: Fantastic service !!
reviewBody:
My consultant Ciaran was absolutely fantastic. He broke everything down for me regarding pricing and help me compared which would be better for me the certificate or the Diploma. 

When I went away to think it over my choices, he didn’t pressure me like some companies and he let me get back in contact when I was ready to move my application forward again. 

When I came to enrol yet again he talked me through everything and the process was simple and easy !! 

Highly recommend ICS !

Also, I found using the online facilities really easy even though I've been out of learning for years now.

ICS learn gave me detailed and comprehensive answers to my questions about differences between the online providers of level 5 HRM. This helped me to make an informed decision about which one was best matched to my learning style.
I chose ICS learn for the flexibility and course content.

headline: Great experience

headline: Smooth, Efficient and Professional
reviewBody: Ciaran McEachen from ICS looked after me from the moment I started looking into courses.  He was polite, patient and professional, indicating different routes and plans I could take.  It has taken many months to arrive where we are now, and in all honesty I probably decided to go with ICS rather than other learning providers because of Ciaran.  He didn't bombard me with messages or offers, I had a few which invariably made me revisit the idea and progress.  The whole process has been smooth and efficient.  The course offered is also delivered by CIPD professionals a huge plus point.  Thank you ICS and Ciaran.

headline: Great service
reviewBody: Ciaran was excellent throughout my joining process. Very speedy replies and quick to sort out any issues I had.

headline: CIPD Level 3
reviewBody:
I am in the last few weeks of my CIPD Level 3 Certification in Human Resource Practice course and although at times it has been difficult balancing work, home and study I will actually miss it! The first 6 months were difficult, I hadn't done any studying for years and I struggled with the first unit. I just couldn't get going, my study plans weren't working and time was flying by. My advice to anyone just starting would be to start with Unit 2 first, it feels a more natural starting point especially if you are not from an HR background.
The second half of the course I was far more confident, and utilised my tutors assistance and advice more which made a big difference. Due to my slow start I feel behind with my timing and my support period is drawing to an end, I called ICS and spoke to Shelia who extended my study period by 2 weeks with no extra charge. This has really put my mind at rest, I can now relax and enjoy my last few weeks whilst I wait for my last 2 assignments to be returned!

headline: Highly recommended
reviewBody: I’ve just enrolled with HR Level 5 course and must say all process was very quick, informative and easy. After making a query online Ciaran contacted me straight away and answered all my questions as I coudn’t decide which Level to go for. He was very patient and supportive and helped me a lot to choose the right course for me. Feeling very excited to start this course with ICS Learn and have a change in my career!

headline: Very friendly
reviewBody: Very friendly. Very knowledgable. Very professional. Very welcoming. Gave me confidence to apply.

headline: I have just enrolled with ICS Learn to…
reviewBody: I have just enrolled with ICS Learn to study my AAT qualification starting from Level 2. Anne-Marie has been so helpful with providing me all the answers to my questions and helping me enrol onto this course. I was advised my log in details and access to my learning hub would be available within 24 hours however this was available as soon as I came off the phone to Anne-Marie meaning I could get started straight away. Looking forward to gaining my qualification through ICS Learn.

headline: They are honestly and genuinely so…
reviewBody: They are honestly and genuinely so supportive and helpful. No query is too little to ask them. It makes the learning experience a million times less stressful. Big hats off to these unsung heroes!

headline: Ciaran McEachen was as always extremely…
reviewBody: Ciaran McEachen was as always extremely helpful and efficient - it is down to Ciaran's efficiency and support that I have decided to do another course with ICS.

headline: I enquired about the aat level 2 course…
reviewBody: I enquired about the aat level 2 course a while back and recently contacted anne marie mcgarry about the course she answered every question I had with confidence and put my mind at ease about achieving my goal. The service is fantastic and have received emails to help me feel more comfortable about the course I would highly recommend this course to anyone who wants to do distant learning from home. I'm a single parent with 2 children under 5 and by the time my youngest goes to school I will be fully qualified and be working thank you ics

headline: Improving Convenience for the User
reviewBody: Providing a hyperlink to the ICS homepage in the introduction email and description of the induction video would have been nice, as to access the site the first time you have to type out the URL. The password arriving in a separate email than the username was also confusing because I thought I had overlooked it; generally, I would expect to receive both at once. The password also came through 12 hours after the username, in the middle of the night.

headline: Really quick and easy process to get…
reviewBody: Really quick and easy process to get you started. Gained all the information needed in order to make a decision about the course. Ciaran was very helpful.

headline: Professional service
reviewBody: Professional service, excellent study resources, wouldn't hesitate to recommend to family or friends

headline: Go for it !
reviewBody: I have just enrolled into my second course in accountancy with ICS learn. I dealt with Anne-Marie who was very very helpful, she was lovely enough to give me some detailed information about the different type of courses to help me decide which path to start on, she was so pleasant and always happy to chat with me, made me feel very at ease when I first decided I wanted a brand new career !  ICS learn was the best decision as I managed to get a job in accountancy after I finished my foundation course ! I would definitely recommend ICS learn to anyone who can't go to uni for various reasons as you do it at your own pace and you have so many resources to help you with your studies!

headline: Ciaran was an amazing help!
reviewBody: Ciaran was an amazing help, he helped me across a number of months whilst I was deciding if this was the right step for me. The course was explained in great detail and I feel very supported

headline: easy
reviewBody: It was so easy to enrol on my course. After a brief discussion on the web chat to make sure I was starting in the right place, and possible ways to go in future, I called the number and after a very short call I was ready to go! Very easy and the student platform is full of information. So far so good.

headline: Very helpfull and polite
reviewBody: Very helpfull and polite, always here to answer any of my queries.

headline: You won't regret enrolling with ICS.
reviewBody: I've just enrolled on a Maths GCSE course through ICS. I have to say the experience has been amazing so far. Margaret, ICS course advisor, couldn't have been any more helpful in my opinion. Margaret answered my questions in full leaving nothing out and I knew everything I needed to know before payment, not pushy sales dribble like you get with some companies and even checked I was happy to go ahead a few times before hand. The transactions was effortless and I'm actually excited to be learning. I even got an email from my tutor introducing herself on a Sunday. The course content is easy to follow and the tutorial and student handbook are second to none they've thought of everything. Really glad I took this step and although I haven't competed it yet, I'm already planning my next one through ICS.

headline: Anne Marie helped me get enrolled on my…

headline: I used ICS Learn to gain an accountancy…
reviewBody:
I used ICS Learn to gain an accountancy qualification a couple of years ago, so when I saw that they offered PRINCE2 training, I knew that they would be a good learning provider, and cost-effective too.

It was very easy to sign up for the PRINCE2 combined Foundation and Practitioner course and I had online access immediately to the learning materials. Practicing exam style questions is key to passing these exams, and ICS Learn provided good quality practice materials and tutor support  I passed both exams first time with 87% in the Foundation and 82% in the Practitioner exams.

I have recommended ICS Learn to my work colleagues for PRINCE2, and I would recommend anyone searching online for a reliable learning provider to consider seriously what ICS Learn have to offer you.

headline: Maths GCSE enrolment

headline: very helpful
reviewBody: very helpful

headline: Choosing ICS Learn
reviewBody: I have found the team at ICS Learn to be very helpful answering all my questions and providing me with the necessary information to make an informed decision about which course choose and the learning provider to go with. At no time did they disparage another provider and only sought to promote what they could offer me. I was specifically looking for a distance learning/online solution which would allow me to study at the pace I would like to. I have found the platform to be user friendly and the learning materials to be available when I need them. Contact from Tutors has always been prompt.

headline: The advisors were most helpful and made…

headline: Nicola Dexter was very formal and…
reviewBody:
Nicola Dexter was very formal and responses were quick and often. She was helpful and very happy to call up and let me know about every detail.

Thanks Nicola, your support was great!

headline: Excellent service
reviewBody: Excellent service. Quick reply.

headline: So far so good
reviewBody:
So far so good, just started so can’t give a full rating of the whole thing but everything has been handled very professionally by Fraser, the advisor I spoke to. 

The resources and teachings given are clear and concise and put down in a easy to read way. 

I would say although it’s possible to do on a mobile phone, try to get hold of a laptop as there are many phone versions that don’t support webex which is the platform they use for live teaching. Otherwise you’re watching recordings on YouTube - which is also great as it is the recorded version of the live, however if you have any questions you won’t be able to get an immediate response, you’ll have to email your tutor. 

But all in all can’t wait to get stuck in.

headline: its just a great resource of learning…
reviewBody: its just a great resource of learning Human resource Management.

headline: Ciaran McEachen
reviewBody: Ciaran has been very helpful during the process of signing up to complete a CIPD level 3. He hasnt put too much pressure on me, has explained everything very clearly, has answered all my questions and been friendly at all times. Thanks Ciaran for all your help. Just hope I can pass this course now!!

headline: Clear and concise information regarding…
reviewBody: Clear and concise information regarding my course, costs and timeframes for completion. Very helpful and quick to respond to queries.

headline: Really good service throughout from… edit
reviewBody:
Really good service throughout from enquiry to purchase and I imagine through till the exam!

EDIT: Have had to change my review from a 5 to a 1 as since purchasing the course i have only logged on 2-3 times to complete the very first lesson but realised i struggle with times tables which are needed to complete this lesson and I imagine the rest of the course. I found this to be a embarrassing thing to not know so reached out to my tutor and gave hints that i would possibly need help with this and also if i could use the course material after the year so that maybe i can book my exam for 2021 instead. However I was told "see how you feel closer to the exam" which didn't help at all as I cant book the exam or even learn the stuff I need to. Due to this I wont be taking the exam in May/June and feel a little stranded. I know that the issue of not really knowing my times table is my fault but feel like a little extra support or help could be warranted

The ICS online platform is formatted for easy navigation and perusal.  I look forward to getting the most out of my studies with ICS Learn and their wonderful team of support.

headline: Very reassuring start to my journey with ICS
reviewBody:
The ICS learning platform is full of useful information but takes some getting used to with finding your way around. Could possibly benefit from the addition of colours/highlighting important steps that need to be taken for a new starter in addition to their initial 'Getting Started' prompt/tutorial as the layout is a bit plain and it can be a little overwhelming to start with. 

Anne Marie was a wonderfully helpful, optimistic and professional course adviser and was extremely patient with me in my time bumbling for the right course. She found answers for all of my silly questions across a month of me researching and procrastinating and responded very quickly to my queries every time. She provided a very reassuring start to my journey with ICS.

Overall Mrs. Anne Marie was of great help and the programs offer by ICS are well structured and with great resources for an online platform.

headline: Nothing short of excellent
reviewBody: My experience with ICS Learn so far has been nothing short of excellent. My course advisor Colin called me on three separate occasions to chat about which courses I was interested in, helped me to make my final decision and answered all of my questions about coursework, exams and any other queries. I have now enrolled on two A Levels, been introduced to my tutors and can't wait to get started with my new education journey.

headline: Next to non support CIPD L5
reviewBody: Next to non support,  tutors are not very involved throughout. When signing up to the course there’s not a lot of detail about cancellations fees and the deposit being non refundable. There’s not a lot of resources offered considering how much one pays for the course. Personally it’s not worth what you pay for it and does not open many doors when it comes to applying for entry level roles.  A lot of people have made it in HR without this qualification, if you are going to pursue this course I would suggest the company you work for to fund it.

headline: Great accessibility
reviewBody: I have studied two courses with ICS Learn, and `both enrolment processes were very simple. There is an efficient communication between student and student services. However, I have found that while tutors reply fast, many answers can be relatively vague. Despite this, I feel that ICS Learn makes courses accessible to you that might otherwise not be and for that I give five stars.

headline: Well worth it
reviewBody:
This course is well laid out, and relevant to the field (HR Management).  The study support provided by tutors and the service centre is second to none, and they are really accommodating. I would recommend this course based on relevance and value for money. 

Although the assignments can seem daunting at first, as long as plenty of reading and the online classes are done beforehand, they are more than manageable.  The tutor feedback is also detailed and helpful for future submissions.

headline: ICS learn
reviewBody: Good materials, dedicated and engaged online tutors and back up support service. The hard work and motivation is up to the student.

headline: Brilliant Course
reviewBody: This is a brilliant course if you need to re-do maths GCSE. I did my GCSE over 25 years ago but didn’t get the grade I need to do my teacher training. I was stressing about how I would re-sit the exam without doing maths for so long but this course is brilliant. Online, comfort of your own home and at your own pace. The webinars and live sessions are very useful which are also recorded so you can watch at your convenience. Melissa Lieberman who is the maths tutor who does the webinars is brilliant, very thorough and explains everything clearly. The teachers are available to answer questions no matter how small. I’m excited to have the opportunity to do my GCSEs after so long. Thank you ICS Learn !

headline: Anne was fantastic!
reviewBody: Anne was fantastic from start to finish, helping me find the right course and setting me up.  Great service, looking forward to getting started!

headline: Clear
reviewBody: Clear, easy and well informed session.

headline: Very effecient and helpful
reviewBody: The starting up process for this course was really easy and Anne Marie advised me through the whole process. I was able to ask many questions in regards to the course and Anne Marie was more than happy to explain everything in depth. So far the ICS Learn information and starting up has been very effecient and I am excited for my studies to begin.

headline: If being in school was tough, this online course is for you.
reviewBody: This is my first year of doing an online course(IGCSE English language)  It was really good, I loved how you could go at your own pace and in your own time.  My tutor was Anna, She was helpful and friendly and encouraging. The support system is really good, at no time did I feel under pressure or not good enough.  There were also online classrooms, they were a massive help when it came to exam prep. You could watch and pause, make notes and just let the information sink in.

headline: I am towards the end of my CIPD Level 5…
reviewBody:
I am towards the end of my CIPD Level 5 Diploma in Human Resources Management and have been most impressed with the course and the support I have received.
I graduated in 2009 so I was quite daunted by the prospect of studying once again and working a full time job.  However, I spent time researching ICS, the programme and speaking to helpful advisors at ICS before making a decision.  I felt reassured that the programme was flexible and I was able to complete it in my own time.  This flexibility recognises the diversity of lives and jobs that all students of ICS lead, which is why the structure is so valuable.
Support Services were always on hand to answer my questions and provide support and the tutors have all been very encouraging.  I've asked a lot of 'silly questions,' or sought clarity on module questions and their wording, and always received helpful advice.
Thank you!

headline: Many thanks
reviewBody:
I decided to retake English Language as when I took my 'O' level back in 1982 I got a D which was disappointing, but I have managed through my working life.  
I looked at many courses and decided on the IGCSE with ICS Learn, the cost did have some bearing on this.  
But I don't regret it, as the course was easy to follow and if you can't make the on line class, they are on the course website and then you can revisit them when you are revising.  You tutor is there if you need them but I had no difficulties working through the course.  You can learn at your own speed.  I found it easy to find a school/college that took external candidates.  I took my exam and later lost all confidence that I would pass, but when results day came I had the biggest shock ever as I got a 7.
Yes I put in a lot of effort but if it wasn't for ICS Learn and the support of my tutor, I wouldn't be writing this review.
Alison

headline: All good so far!
reviewBody: From what I can see so far, the course is well designed and it was very well explained via the website. The staff have been supportive and and all seems well organised. Looking forward to getting started!

headline: The experience gets worse.
reviewBody: Nearly four months now - still waiting for a response - told a curriculum manger would be in touch within ten working days - nearly four weeks ago - this company is not it available when things go wrong and have no official complaints handling/escalation process - extremely frustrating and now impacting on my being able to complete the course at college - be very wary.

headline: GCSE Pass
reviewBody: ICS  gave me everything I needed.Just achieved a grade 8 in English Language after my first failed attempt in school 20 odd years ago.

headline: Fraser was very helpful and made…
reviewBody: Fraser was very helpful and made enrolling super easy.

headline: Having failed my maths GCSE with an E…
reviewBody:
Having failed my maths GCSE with an E when I sat my exams over 12 years ago, having to learn it all again and with the pressure of needing to pass to be able to progress in my career i was worried with how i would manage it all in 6 months.
Thanks to ICS learn and there easy to follow breakdowns on each individual subject I found the whole process so much easier. 
For me the most helpful and best thing about ICS learn is Melissa Lieberman and her amazing live classes. She breaks down the learning process so well and with the classes being live you can ask her a question there and then and she takes her time to explain and answer you, which is so much better than being stuck while your trying to learn. 

A big massive thank you to Melissa I passed my GCSE maths and can now progress in my career.

Amy Harding

headline: I started my course for GCSE Maths…
reviewBody: I started my course for GCSE Maths retake back in September not knowing what to expect with the service from ICS Learn. I have to review the service as excellent and so supportive to me throughout my study. My online live lessons we absolutely brilliant and explained in so much detail and any help you needed was quickly dealt with rapidly by Melissa Lieberman. Melissa was the one who offered so much support in the lessons, which were enjoyable and so effective. I am pleased to say I got the grades I wanted and would recommend ICS Learn to anyone who is wishing to retake a course or start a study.

headline: Excellent support and communication…
reviewBody: Excellent support and communication throughout from all of the ICS learn team. From enrolment to preparation for the exam. Tutor amazing gave me motivation and built my confidence. Giving constructive feedback.

headline: I was quite nervous about signing up to…
reviewBody: I was quite nervous about signing up to a GCSE course but my advisor Maggie answered my questions and was so encouraging and supportive, she made the whole process easy and painless!

headline: Got a grade 9 ! I want to thank Ross and the ICS team
reviewBody:
I want to thank Ross, Alice and the ICS team for their support and a great online platform to study.
In order to be accepted for Science teacher training, I was asked to pass the GCSE English Language as I got my BSc in France.
Just got my results yesterday and got a grade 9, top grade! All thanks to the ICS training, one of the best learning online platform I have used.
The course is well structured, the content is interesting and engaging, it's easy to submit course work(marking is super fast, thanks Alice) and the live sessions with Ross are very useful.
I highly recommend this course.
Laurent Chatelier

headline: Excellent website
reviewBody: Excellent website, they had all the martial/ resources that I needed to learn. Plus you can access the course whenever which is great if your busy and only have very little free time. Thanks to Melissa Lieberman  for being our online teacher and helping me to pass my Maths this year

headline: Thank you ICS Learn for helping me pass…
reviewBody:
Thank you ICS Learn for helping me pass my GCSE mathematics exams.
I started the course in January and organised my time in order to learn everything in the course by the time I sat the exams in May and June. 
All the recorded lessons were with Melissa Lieberman. Melissa explained everything in a way that feels easy to understand and manageable to do.She made maths much less daunting. 
I took the foundation tier papers as I just wanted at least a grade 4 to 
progress into what I want to do next.
I am pleased to say I got my grade 4 and will now be to take the next step into my future employment.
I would not hesitate to recommend ICS Learn and would definitely study any future qualifications I may want to gain with them.

headline: Quick & helpful
reviewBody: Was quick and easy too sign up. Log on and course info was sent through shortly after. The questions I had were answered straight away. Overall I had a good experience getting things sorted.

headline: This course was great
reviewBody: This course was great. I attended live sessions whenever I could, and if I couldn’t I was always able to watch recordings. Digital text books were supplied too and always knew I could contact a tutor whenever I needed help. Melissa was my tutor and she was great. I got my GCSE result today for foundation paper, and I was thrilled to get a 5!

headline: Amazing service and support!
reviewBody:
Since starting my level 7 CIPD they have been absolutely great. Provide extensive information surrounding my questions and have supported me in difficult circumstances. 

Would recommend them to anyone and all.

headline: I would truly recommend ICS learn if…
reviewBody: I would truly recommend ICS learn if you are considering retaking GCSE exams. The tutors are always happy to help and will always answer any questions or queries you have. Everything is explained clearly and it's a great way to go at your own pace. There is no pressure to rush or complete tasks given. It does require extra research from the material provided but it's well worth the money.

headline: Grade 7 in English and Grade 7 in Maths
reviewBody:
I got grade 7 in English and Grade 7 in Maths. I learned both subjects with ics Learn. I only had 7 months to prepare and course contents are very good. Teachers are all great. Webinars on all the topics helped to clear the understandings I have just joined third course today with ICS Learn. 
I highly recommend ICS learn if you are looking to study online.

headline: I got grade 7in maths today
reviewBody: I got grade 7in maths today. Three weeks before the exams I was unprepared and worried. My maths teacher Melissa Lieberman gave me advice on how to prepare. Her webinar videos helped a lot. She is one of the best teachers I have ever studied from.

headline: Have just achieved a grade 5 in Maths…
reviewBody: Have just achieved a grade 5 in Maths GCSE which I once believed would be impossible. Part of the credit for this must go to Melissa the online maths teacher for ICS learn. Her calm and clear explanations of maths problems went along way to help take away my anxiety around maths. She'd never presume you already would know something like all the other teachers I'd had before. Thank you!

headline: GCSE Maths
reviewBody: I would like to say a huge thank you to Melissa My maths tutor.  I have got my GCSE maths results today and I have passed. I would also like to say thank you to ICS learn. The material was excellent, up to date and easy to use. I particularly found the videos very helpful, you can access them anywhere, anytime. I would highly recommend ICS learn to anyone who is planning to do any course.

headline: Really helpful and responsive
reviewBody: Really helpful and responsive they provided me with lots of information prior to signing up to help me decide and offered flexible payment options. Once signed up, i could access the information quickly and easily and get started pretty much as soon as possible. Thank you :)

headline: Fraser Was very helpful and I would …
reviewBody: Fraser Was very helpful and I would  recommend  This course and company to others .best regards Michael Gormley

headline: Only just started on IGCSE science…
reviewBody:
Only just started on IGCSE science double award but so far, so good. Extremely helpful staff, everything very straightforward.
Thank you 😁

headline: Outdated learning material
reviewBody:
Although this was distant learning, it was not felt there was enough support with regards to certain tutors and the course material was outdated.

When revising for the exams, there were many times that the course material would state 'as I write this in the summer of 2012' or 'now, in 2016'. This was frustrating as it was very stressful revising old data. There is no reason why this is not regularly updated. 

In addition, exam support was 3 weeks before the exam, this should be before as it was a very worrying and stressful time to not have support. I am aware that there had previously been revision weekends where people would meet with a tutor, this should be reconsidered as there are not even an presentations online to at least talk through and outline what is expected to be understood on the exam. It is just a case of, this is the topic, learn it.

headline: Service from requiring to enrolling
reviewBody:
The service I have received on signing up with ICS Learn, has been very good. I enquired on subject via their website. And shortly received an email from Fraser. We arranged a time for him to call me, and discuss the course I wanted to do. There was no push to sign upto any courses. 
A date was arranged for Fraser to call me back about signing for the course I wanted to do. 
On the call back Fraser 1st asked how I was, and would I like more information on the courses I would like to do, and was there any questions i had. There was no push to sign up to any course the choice was mine. 
I enrolled to do the GCSE Maths & English, so Fraser took me through the payment process and explained everything to me. I am paying on payment plan, and Frase gave me the options for date for each monthly payment. 
Fraser then explained, all the information I would receive. And if I had any problems then I can contact him direct.
I am pleased with how I was into enrollingnon any course. Also from the 1st call with Fraser, arranging a date for him to call back, that I did not receive any further contact from him until the specified date. This helped me make up my mind to enrol with ICS Learn, as I was not bombarded with any calls or emails.

headline: A great experience so far
reviewBody: A great experience so far, just started and hopefully it carries on throughout the duration of my course

headline: Unlimited support
reviewBody:
Unlimited support. They will not stop supporting you and guide you until you make it to the end. If you really want to learn and add to your information and experience, this is what you are looking for!  

Regards!
MD

headline: I have signed up to two courses today…
reviewBody:
I have signed up to two courses today and spoke with Colin. I can not praise him enough for all he did for me, checking out the course i want to eventually apply for and breaking down the requirements for me. He also stayed on chat and waited patiently whilst i rang the uni to make some queries.
He handled the chat in a  professional manner putting me at ease and answering all my questions (and i asked alot) i am so greatful i was dealt with my Colin and can not sing his praises enough. 
I am looking forward to starting my courses. Thank you so much for your help today.

headline: David Nagy
reviewBody: I am very satisfied.

headline: I would like to thank Stephen and…
reviewBody:
I would like to thank Stephen and Melissa on the Maths A Level. I got my results in today that I had passed my exams, I would definitely say this is in part thanks to the support and guidance provided by Both Stephen and Melissa.

The materials were well put together and flowed naturally from subject to subject! The video tutorials also complemented the written text. I definitely recommend the ICS Learn A level Maths Course if you are thinking about it!

headline: After reading all the reviews here I…
reviewBody:
After reading all the reviews here I decided to start my level 7 diploma in HR with them. Than, 2 days after I paid the first installment, something pop up, I needed to cancel it. ( I was planing to postponed to sometime later, in couple of months)  I send them an email they accept it, since there is 14 days free cancellation..... but I am still waiting for my money to be sent back. Highly unprofessional when it comes to paying you back. When they need you to enroll, they will answer your emails in 5 min. when it's about giving you money back it will take forever.( the question now is, will that happen ) First the issue was my bank account since I am not from UK, ( this was not an issue at all when I paid them )  then it will be in 7-10 working days, then this that.... will keep you updated. as of now, nothing.. 
Update: after your sincerely sorry and whatelse.... , its Monday again. and I still haven't received my refund.

headline: Very helpful and quickly signed up
reviewBody: Very helpful and quickly signed up

headline: Anne-Marie was very helpful
reviewBody: Anne-Marie was very helpful. I’m glad I chose ICS.

headline: GCSE Science
reviewBody:
Excellent service provided by my course advisor Fraser Cameron from the very beginning. My initial enquiry was dealt with immediately and professionally, the course information was explained and follow up emails enabled me to research the course without any pressure.
Enrolment was straight forward and I look forward to studying knowing I will receive excellent support.

headline: Avoid
reviewBody:
Avoid, very poor learning experience.
Re: CIPD Level 5 L&D Diploma

Originally signed up back in 2015 and during that time had all kinds of problems with their site and content. It spoilt my learning experience and in the end I gave up.

Several years later planned to go back and complete remaining units with another provider. Only to be told by ICS that the 2 units I had completed, I had not actually completed and they would only credit me with one unit.

Apparently I had missed several actions in the first unit including a case study and CPD upload. Which is not technically possible as the LMS would simply not let you move on to the next unit until you had done the work.

I can only presume their poor IT messed up or the course has changed since. Despite being offered 2 months to complete the extra work, I really don't want anything to do with this company as I spent a lot of money on a poor experience with little to show for it.

I should say the lecturers were always very helpful, but let down by poor courseware and IT.

headline: Disappointed and concerned
reviewBody: I completed my CIPD Level 3 HR qualification with ICS in March 2019. During the course I found the lectures interesting and the tutors supportive, and overall enjoyed studying with ICS. However, when I passed my course I was advised that it would be referred to the CIPD to go through their internal checks before they would send out my certificate. I was advised this process can take up to 12 weeks. It is now 5 months later and I have not received anything - I’ve chased this with ICS Student Services a few times and been told that my coursework is still with the CIPD and should be confirmed shortly. On my most recent chase (as we are well over 12 weeks at this point) I was told by ICS to pick this up with the CIPD directly. When I contacted the CIPD, they advised they could only get this processed once my coursework had been sent over and provided an email address that it should have been sent to by my course provider. Therefore, it seems that my coursework was not correctly submitted by ICS and had not been re-checked when I had chased them previously for an update. I’ve sent this information across to ICS several days ago and stressed the urgency of my email as official certification is conditional to my most recent job HR job offer and I’ve not received a response. I’ve chased again this morning and asked for urgent resolution as I do not think it’s fair for the course provider to ask me to pick this up with the CIPD to find out what’s going on in light of the circumstance. I was not involved in the process whereby ICS submit my coursework (or in this case not) to CIPD therefore they should liaise between themselves. Hopefully I should get a response and some clarity today, but needless to say this has been very distressing and seems as if ICS haven’t really demonstrated any care to my queries once I’ve paid/completed the course on their side of things.

headline: I felt supported through the process of…
reviewBody: I felt supported through the process of enrolment and the student advisor i spoke to was patient and was able to explain the process of enrolment clearly. I look forward to developing in my learning and gaining knowledge in my studies.

headline: Easy Steps no stress
reviewBody: Really pleased process was easy start to finish Fraser was knowledgeable and could answer the questions I had prior to signing up. Course materials within the hour and tutor email the following day! Really prompt Thankyou.

headline: Enroling an employee couldn't have been…
reviewBody: Enroling an employee couldn't have been easier via our course advisor Maggie. Excellent first experience with ICS Learn and looking forward to seeing our staff develop.

headline: Eva is a diamond!
reviewBody: My positive enrolment experience was all down to a lady called Eva. It’s been 3 weeks of back and forth talks and she was positive and helpful every single sentence. I had a few questions and every one was answered in full detail! I even had worries I may fail, or my voice sounds too informal for this type of career but Eva remained positive and reassuring the whole way through! She also got back to me within 15 minutes. I can not express the amount of information packs that is sent that includes so much information! So much was provided. The enrolment and payment process is extremely easy, and sensitive information is not said over the phone, you do it yourself. I can not wait to get stuck in on getting my career started.

headline: Avoid them, not a positive learning experience
reviewBody:
This is now my second review of ICS, I initially reviewed the enrollment process and the staff at the time. They were amazing. What a shame that the rest of the experience has been so very poor! 

I have enrolled on 3 courses, I have had limited communication with my tutors and no sign of any assignments coming up in the future either. 

I have come across so many errors and broken links within their outdated course content which has made certain aspects truly impossible to complete. 

The courses themselves are put together in a very boring and 2D fashion, you are promised that you will have clips to view, audios to listen to and other great learning tools, when in reality I have read from a screen, then been told to read the same thing in a book and then write a blog about both the things that I read, a blog which will never be read by anyone or checked. 

So if your learning style is to just read pages and pages then ICS could be for you, but if you are looking for something that will support interactive learning then go elsewhere. 

I have tried to raise a complaint, it took someone almost 2 weeks to respond, I then replied and 2 and a half weeks later have still not heard back. 

Avoid ICS, they have really ruined my learning experience and I am now not sure if I can even carry on. I am not learning with them and feel I have just wasted my money!

headline: Very helpful advice over the phone when…
reviewBody: Very helpful advice over the phone when enrolling on a course. Happy with the service and course content.

headline: Straight forward and explained well
reviewBody:
You can do the course as and when you like, at your own pace. There is always help available and the information provided is easy to understand. 

The enrolment process was very easy. The lady I spoke to was extremely helpful and provided all the information I needed. It took less than an hour for the process to be completed.

headline: Not a great experience at all.
reviewBody:
Not a great experience at all.
Having an absolute nightmare with this company, have been trying to resolve a complaint for nearly three months, and am nowhere near resolution.  Courses are not for those who do not have a strong knowledge of the subject, and teaching is done via a web chat talking through a powerpoint presentation - any questions or help you need, takes up to two days to get a response - not a great experience at all.

headline: Best decision you’ll make
reviewBody:
I had left this review until I could give a good insight to the ICS learn processes and the platform used. Currently I’m in the early stages of my HRM level 5 CIPD Diploma. 
I can honestly say ICS are amazing. I cannot fault any aspect of the service they provid. Right from enrolment, Paul Martin was easy to deal with and extremely helpful tailoring everything to my circumstances. I cannot thank him enough. The online learning format is easy to work with and enjoyable to use. Being able to login anywhere is a massive help and the learning tools to build my knowledge have been great too. So far its been an absolute joy and would definitely recommend to all who want to develop themselves.

reviewBody: My initial contact with ICS was Margaret who was so helpful and made me feel at ease as this was a totally new experience for me. Would highly recommend.

headline: Cannot fault

Thank you also to my AAT Foundation Bookkeeping tutor Andrea Moore who was always there if I had any questions. Reply time was great too. headline: Terrible company
reviewBody: Terrible company. Constantly fleeced for more cash for every exam and extended tutorial time, tutors leave marking to the last minute so your tutorial time expires and you have to pay in order to see feedback.

headline: KEEP UP THE GOOD WORK
reviewBody: The service is excellent. I went online to chat and there was Ciaran to the rescue. He was friendly and patient. He answered all my questions and followed up till I enrolled. I hope the learning journey will be as smooth. Keep up the good work!

headline: Avoid this company
reviewBody:
Avoid at all costs if your circumstances change.

My father passed away when I was doing the course so I couldn't complete.  At the time I had asked for an extension to be told I had to pay yet more money after spending £3400 or so on a course.  I called today to see if I could gain access to it as I am I a better place to now complete it and was told I couldn't extend had to pay another £2000 to them.  I find that totally disgusting service.

headline: Really knowledgeable and helpful
reviewBody: Really knowledgeable and helpful, returned my emails, calls and answered all my questions when I made an enquiry and I got logged onto my course really quickly.  Very professional company and a pleasure to deal with so far.

headline: Pleased with the Service!

Shout out to Gordon Stewart!
Showed great understanding of the issue I faced & offered a quick, efficient & pragmatic solution over live chat with prompt execution! Such professional support is absolutely crucial to make overall study experience stressfree.

headline: Great experience with Paul Martin
reviewBody:
Great experience with Paul Martin

Paul has been great at keeping me informed, sending me over information and answering my never ending questions. He's been great at occasionally sending me an email to check in on whether I'm still interested, which I found as a helpful reminder. This wasn't done in a chasing/salesy way at all. So far so good. Now just need to start the course!

headline: I cannot speak highly enough of the…
reviewBody:
I cannot speak highly enough of the staff using the live chat and phone lines.
I have always been treated with the utmost courtesy and respect by them.
I have had difficulties with certain elements of my course due to health issues (which I won't go into here). 
The people who have assisted me could not have been warmer, more patient, or more professional. So a big thank you for that.
I must also thank my course tutor, Mr. Ben Warden. Without Ben's professionalism, skill, care, and readiness to go way above and beyond what is normally required, I would not have passed my course.
So Ben, if you get to read this (and I sincerely hope you do): this is a genuine, heartfelt thank you. 
You Sir, are the man!
Love and respect,
Jeff

headline: Enrolment process
reviewBody: Colin made the enrolment process really easy, and it was quick and easy to get logged on and start finding my way around. Many thanks!

headline: Wonderful experience.
reviewBody: I had a course advisor called Anne Marie assisting me from first point of contact through to my employer contacting her to discuss enrolment and prices. Anne Marie was extremely professional, friendly and informative throughout and has made the process feel a lot smoother than anticipated. I was sent a breakdown of costs, alongside some examples of the modules within the course so I could have a look prior to making a decision. I have received several emails to follow up and inform me of my tutors availability and assure me of the help ICS can provide throughout my journey. My overall experience so far has been very positive, and it is clear the individuals at ICS thrive from helping others reach their potential.

headline: Studying Alone
reviewBody:

I would have preferred some webinars for each module to vary my learning experience. We are also distanced from other learners, even though there are forums available. 

I was also disappointed to learn that we do not have a graduation ceremony, I think if I'd have known this before starting it may have influenced my choice of learning provider.  I have now achieved a level 7 CIPD post grad diploma which I strongly feel warranted a graduation ceremony as it is at Masters level.
