headline: Just ok - This review is about what happens past enrolment
reviewBody:
This review is about what happens past enrolment process – the majority of the reviews here are strangely about enrolment (which is very confusing for those wanting a genuine course review. I did a massive amount of research for CIM course providers and I’ve realised that if you study online, they are all pretty much the same. I was also going to just go through a book, so I thought there wasn’t much point going for a more expensive course.

I would that with ICS you get what you pay for. It was by far the cheapest course on the market, AND there was a discount at the time, so I thought that I might as well go for it.

The important thing to note here is that the materials that you use are the same everywhere – you get access to a module guide through your CIM membership and the books that you’re recommended are the same (almost). The only thing that’s different is the guidance on what to do when and also some additional information that doesn’t appear in the book or the module guide, but can be asked on the exam.

I felt that ICS’s platform was ok, however, the way the course is presented is not very appealing. I forced myself to go through it just because I felt I had to. I understand why ICS did it this way as there are interactive activities there as well, but not enough in my opinion to justify the format. The background is horrible grey and the font in the activities is quite small. The materials are not printable, which is a real shame – I would rather they were (some other courses do that). Some considerable amount of materials is presented through presentations – videos on YouTube. Not sure if that’s how ICS tried to save space? They are extremely inconvenient to watch and some don’t even have a voice-over (in the ones that do, the voice is actually distracting from reading), and you have to stop to read the slide all the time. Now I know why some courses advertise themselves as “presentation free”. I thought it was just me, but other fellow students also complained on the forum about all these points.

Despite all this, I really enjoyed going through the course, but when I reached the last unit, I’ve realised that I had a lot more to read through than I expected based on the previous two units – it was like the unit was the size of the whole previous two. I wish ICS have provided some information on the volume of content in each unit as well as a suggested studying schedule as it caused me a lot of stress before the exam.

Also, it says in the instructions that you shouldn’t attempt the test until you’ve studied the whole module. However, I disagree – when you see the questions for the first time after studying the whole thing, it’s a bit of a shock as you realised that you were learning the wrong things for the past 3 months. I wish ICS have provided their own questions (or from past papers) after each half of the unit – this way you will be prepared for the format, strengthen your knowledge and will feel that final tests are just putting it together.

I also felt that the response was a bit slow – I had to chase my tutor and curriculum coordinator 3 times before I got a reply, as a result, never got a call with my tutor at all. Maybe ICS should have a cut-off point (like a month before the exam) for any communications with your tutor if they feel that they can't guarantee a call a week before the exam. I might have been just unlucky and I understand it was a busy period, however, it would be nice to talk to the tutor when he said he was available. But the people at ICS are lovely and polite – I give them that!

So in conclusion, I do not think this course is good value for money. But having said all that, I don’t think that any CIM course from any provider is good value for money, as some courses are more than double of what I’ve paid to ICS (not even including the extortionate CIM exam fees). If I could, I would have taken a CIM course with a private tutor (and will probably pay the same money), but unfortunately, you have to go through a centre. I’m just happy that it was cheap and I hope that ICS improves the points other learners and I have raised for the future students.

If you are wondering whether to go with ICS, do check if any of this has changed!

headline: NO HELP, ONLY WANT MONEY
reviewBody:
First of all ive started this in Jan and havent had the greatest help from them at all, not once have they asked or checked up on how was i doing with the course, i mean what is a tutor for? To help you in your studies and help you proceed. Im not sure if this is how online courses work or its just ISC.

 Paid 6 Months which is a total of £380 and i havent done a single thing or exam. I cancelled my direct debit and told them im going to cancel the course and told them my issues. They said tutor is there to help you and i didnt contact him. also asked for some additional help like to send me text books but they said they dont do that no more.

Now they telling me to pay a £50 cancellation fee which i was ok to pay but then they said i have to pay this month which is another £63, i wanted to cancel last month which i was told someone will be in contact with me and no one did till this month has started. I was Also told to pay off the aat membership fee which is another £100 or more.

I was also told if i did not pay they will hand it over to a debt collector. It seems they only care about their money and nothing else. 

As long as you pay, they dont care about you. Even if you do the course or not, even if you are financillay unstable. similar situtation have happened if you look at other reviews.

update:
I have already been contacted and have said my concerns but all they seem to worry about is the money that allegedly I owe. I am ok to pay off the cancellation fee of £50 but I dont feel as if I need to pay off another months worth when I clearly stated last month I want to cancel and was still awaiting a call, which then led to this month. also the remaining aat membership fee which is not stated in the Enrolment document I have signed that I need to pay off the remaining fee.

The learning material at ICS Learn are very well structured and guide you through the modules, links for additional literature are useful and suggested literature is exactly what is needed for the learning process.

The web page is easy to navigate and user friendly.

Student Services always reply very promptly and give proper guidance on anything you need or ask.

Mentors, also give immediate replies, and accurate and very useful feedback.

I would recommend this studies for anyone who is willing to expand their knowledge in the HR field, to become more aware of their continuous learning needs and get the habit of having and diligently follow their personal development plans.

Regards,

Ana Jankuloska

headline: CIPD Level 3 Diploma Online Course
reviewBody: From my first enquiry about a Level 3 Diploma CIPD qualification, Ciaran has been absolutely great! He got in touch straight away and scheduled a call for us in which we discussed all the options for the qualification and he answered all my questions. headline: Avoid this provider for your CIPD level 5
reviewBody:
I signed up to study the CIPD level 5 with ICS Learn some time ago.  I looked at the reviews on this site and thought I was making a good decision but now I realise after reading back through them they all talk about how nice the sales team are and not about the actual course itself. You have a limited time to get through this course and the indicated time that ICS say that it takes to complete each section is misleadingly low (by a large margin). You only find this out when you are doing the course where you then are alerted to the time extension at the end for more cost.  The site itself takes a long time to navigate and the actual written literature is insufficient.  ICS learn require you to use Harvard referencing but inadequately reference their sources so that it is almost impossible to find them yourself resulting in a huge amount of time to produce a very limited amount of work.  In actuality it is better to forget their entire literature and simply 'google'.  When speaking to ICS about the stress of failure (my company has paid for this course and if I fail I need to pay back the whole lump sum rather than the amount paid out so far if I was paying monthly), their answer was that it wasn't refundable in any way.  I am a working parent who was attracted to this course on its promise of flexibility to fit around my busy schedule.  Now to complete it I have to pay for additional childcare and may as well have done this course at a local university where I could talk to my tutors as and when I needed. I would also recommend to those who are starting on their HR career to look elsewhere. A lot of the answers require you to relate back to your own practice and you may not have experienced these situations during your career thus far leaving you scrabbling around to think of an answer to worse still pretending.
To conclude, I strongly recommend you try elsewhere.

headline: 5 stars

5 stars: Excellent

Your review

I honestly can't thank ICS team enough for their immense support and well-designed study materials to enhance student learning. I'm a mature student who returned to study GCSE that I didn't do well in back in high school. For many years I've been avoiding it, even when I started the course with ICS I was very apprehensive about it because I lacked confidence. Studying with ICS honestly gave me that confidence and push I needed to achieve my desired grades. I'm left feeling like I can do anything now. I've just completed one course with ICS this year and now signed up to do 2 more!.... If I can do it working fulltime and with 3 kids, anyone can!

headline: Absolutely awful
reviewBody:
Absolutely awful. I phoned to ask about A-Level Law. I was told to look at reviews on Trustpilot which I duly did. Scrolling through the great many of the positive reviews relate to the on-boarding process for ICS, not the actual courses. Those reviews that relate to the course itself are mixed - with some extremely negative reviews.

When I phoned ICS Learn to question this, the gentlemen I was connected to 'Fraser' was extremely defensive and rather than answering my questions about the negative reviews (teachers taking up to two weeks to respond, the site being difficult to navigate, there being spelling mistakes) - he told me that i was nit-picking, deliberately finding negative reviews and that if I should question whether I want to study an A-Level with them at all. I said that trying to ascertain whether the course would be good and if the negative reviews had validity was perfectly normal behaviour for a consumer. What is not normal is a firm dismissing this.

I said I was not nit-picking, that i had read a great many reviews but the positive ones predominantly pertained to the onboarding process.

In all my life, of being a consumer, I have never had my interest in the purchase questioned when I am raising legitimate queries.

I asked to speak to Fraser's manager, Michelle, who said she would not listen to the call at all or if she did it was for Fraser's benefit only. 

This firm seems extremely suspicious and I am dumbfounded that they think it is acceptable to treat anyone this way. Consumers must question before purchasing anything in life.

Proceed with caution with this company.

headline: Great support
reviewBody: Anne, my course advisor, has been really helpful in my enrolment process. Patiently giving me all the information and support I needed. I am looking forward to get started with the training.

headline: Many errors in course material and computer marked tests
reviewBody: I have been studying with ICS Learn for two months now and I must say the amount of errors in the course material is really poor. when completing tests, I am frequently marked as incorrect and then get told it is a formatting problem or teething issues that are being ironed out. as this is a new subject to me, a huge amount of time is being spent re-tracing my understanding of the subject due to incorrect 'computer generated' marking and feedback. My tutor has been helpful but she only deals with the understanding of the subject matter and not technical issues. the complaints procedure and feedback has been poor with no one appearing to actively work through the material to uncover the errors.

headline: Staff very helpful
reviewBody: No problems, my contact Fraser helped me in all the process of starting the course, he was always available even on a bank holiday.

headline: Enrolement Process

headline: Level 3 - not what I thought it was going to be
reviewBody:
I have recently just signed up to complete my CIPD Level 3 course and am finding it extremely stressful. After numerous attempts to try and speak to my tutor I eventually spoke to him for all of 5 minutes and nothing was confirmed. No work can be marked, not even to see if your on the right guidelines.
The site is very hard to navigate your way around, my first assignment was ready to be submitted, I decided to listen to the pre recorded class just 1 more time to realise the final few slides indicate this is a report not an essay! I don’t know if I refer to the online classroom criteria or the assessment criteria. Why not put this at the start of the class so it’s visible and make it clear.
The support just isn’t there and personally I wish I looked into this a bit more and took the classroom route.

headline: Great customer support!
reviewBody: Paul, my CIPD Advisor, has been really helpful in my enrolment process. Patiently giving me all the information I needed and liaising with our Finance Team to sort out of the payment questions. I am looking forward to get started with the training.

headline: I joined ICS Learn as it was…SHOCKING
reviewBody:
I joined ICS Learn as it was recommended by an ex-colleague. I am currently studying HR CIPD Level 5.

I have found the site is so difficult to navigate despite their poor attempts of 'induction videos'. I emailed student services as I found the site problems I was having and the lack of communication from tutors dramatically slowing my learning down and leaving me frustrated and wanting to quit. Student services told me to contact my tutor and my tutor told me to contact student services.

I was only advised 3 months after starting how to book onto an online classroom.

I am constantly stressed when I log on, nothing to do with the actual course, but the site is ridiculous. I am computer illiterate and work on computers for my current position so have no problem there. I have now asked for help from my brother who is a web developer who also told me how he finds the site irritating and not user friendly at all.

I wish I had not paid out the extra money to do an online course and just took day release with work to do a physical classroom taught class. 

Still to this day I struggle and get no help. I have given up trying to find the 'free ebooks' and now just use my friends university library pass to get what I need from there. Paying £2800 and having to pay for books is unrealistic as the suggested reading books are £50 each minimum.

I am a current student who would not recommend this site unfortunately it just leaves me with unnecessary stress and anxiety (which student services are aware of but have still made no efforts to support).

headline: I researched differing online study…
reviewBody:
I researched differing online study sites in order to insure that I was getting the best course, set to my individual needs.
ICS Learn was accessible and had great reviews. Paul at ICS was knowledgeable and not pushy at all, he ascertained the correct path for me to follow considering my prior qualifications.

I am now enrolled and about to embark on a level 5 diploma in HR, has all gone seamlessly thus far!
Many thanks Paul and the team

headline: The whole process was very easy
reviewBody: The whole process was very easy, Anne Marie responded quickly and with the exact answers to the questions I had asked. She followed up a few days after enrolling to ensure all was fine. Overall a very easy experience.

headline: I would never reccommend ICS Learn CIPD Level 5 Diploma in HRM
reviewBody:
I made a mistake by leaving my review a day after enrollment, was naive. 
The website itself isn't easy to navigate, you need guidance as their Introduction video of 8mins can't help.
To listen to recording you push all your senses up to the limits as the sound is really bad. In XXI century for the money they asked they could make better online videos for those who can't listen live webinars.
Also, this is not a course for someone who doesn't have experience in HR but wants to change career. 
All in all, I would never recommend them. 
If you enrol this course please don't review straight after enrollment cause that is what they gonna politely ask you to do and that is how they've built their score.

headline: highly recommend for igcse course
reviewBody:
Fraser is very warm hearted and he keeps getting in touch with me. I got no difficulty in booking the course.
BTW, the course needs self study for most time

headline: With you every step of the way
reviewBody: With you every step of the way, lots of information so you can make an informed decision and nothing was too much trouble. Great service, thanks Colin.

headline: During this course
reviewBody:
During this course, I had the opportunity to learn important things, reinforce HR and business concepts, and more importantly strengthen my judgment.  This learning experience had a profound impact in my professional development not just for the degree in itself, but also as a person, because I challenged myself when I decided to study a high qualification in another language. 
Thanks very much to the tutors for their guidance and support. 

Kind regards, 

Sol

headline: Maths GCSE course
reviewBody: I have always hated maths, I’ve never understood the basic concepts and just the sight of numbers or a simple equation made my brain switch off. I managed to get to nearly 30 avoiding maths, but now I need the GCSE to progress in my studies. To my surprise the video lessons where no where near as horrible as I expected. I was amazed at how quickly I picked up concepts of which were pretty much all new to me or I had forgotten. Being able to choose when I want to study and taking as little or as long time as I need to watch the videos and do the exercises had helped me learn at my own pace rather than being in a classroom swept along with other students and left behind on more complicated topics. I like the way Melissa explains everything without over complicating which I think has been my experience of maths before. It’s also useful watching the recordings and being able to pause to take notes or rewind to repeat something.

headline: Level 2 Personal Training
reviewBody:
I studied the level 2 Personal Training course.

I will begin with saying that the online videos and text were very easy to follow along with and clearly laid out. The staff I spoke to over the phone were extremely helpful.

However, I can only give 2 stars for this course for a number of reasons as listed below:
Firstly, I found them very simplified and in some cases, missed out parts of important information that I know from my previous studies should have been included in the videos/text.
Secondly, upon being assigned a tutor, I found his replies very slow and unnecessarily rude and blunt. He was extremely unclear about what exactly he wanted me to do in the examination videos (e.g.- he did not clarify that he wanted me to spot someone in an exercise that doesn't always require a spotter), meaning I had to refilm the videos 3 times. The videos could have been completed first time round if he would have given me clear instructions.

Additionally, the first time I submitted a video for assessment, he took over 2 weeks to give feedback (which was actually the same for every video), and upon giving me my results, he forgot to attach the feedback sheet so I sent an email asking where it was and I was left for an additional 2 days until he responded saying he 'had jet lag' so forgot to add it!

Next, the videos were extremely difficult to upload onto the online system. They were slow and the whole layout was very scattered and long winded that it was difficult to properly determine if I'd uploaded the correct video into the correct section.

Overall, just not very pleased with this course. I wish I'd gone with someone else or just done a full-time 2 week course instead

headline: Student Services
reviewBody:
Generally student services have been amazing, they allowed me to defer payments when I went through bereavement along with extending my course because of this. I have managed to completed my course now and finish the payments at the same time.  

The only thing I would say would be about the layout of the student community - I feel the navigation could be better and easier and at the end once your progress states 100%, I felt there should have been a pop up box or something to indicate the next steps, possibly on the dashboard page to state you need to contact student services and let them know you have completed your studies as I only found this out by contacting them about my last assignment.

Otherwise everyone including tutors have been immensely helpful and understanding :) I would happily use again and recommend ICS Learn.

headline: Course content great but site problems spoil it
reviewBody: Course content great, it's navigating the site that spoils my experience. I want to print off all the course materials - like other distance learning centres provide - but although it is possible it seems it's not easy and I had to find out how to remove the header and footer from the internet (ICS support explained this could not be done). I tried copying and pasting the material but this wasn't easy and it didn't look good. There must be an easy way to download the material from the platform - and if there isn't one should be made available - staring at a screen to learn isn't always a pleasant experience.

headline: ICS Learn truly understands its…Students. The best approach to global excellence and Innovation. An academe that cares with a heart!
reviewBody:
ICS Learn truly understands its students. Particularly myself where I have taken both my CIPD with my Ph.D. journey at the same time. They have understood my condition and have extended online support for me to continue on my studies.

Teachers are great! They are truly the best and I suggest everyone, for now, to enroll and study at ICS Learn. All the best and more Power ICS Learn.

Regards,

Dr. Fernando Erana Reyes Jr.

Sometimes in the text book the authors jump a few steps assuming you know what they have done and I don't always follow it, but I do understand when Melissa goes through it.

headline: Is spellcheck too expensive?
reviewBody:
The only reason why I am giving them such a bad review is because I'm only about 2 chapters in, and I've already come across 5 different spelling errors.  
To say that I find this problematic would be an understatement.  With as much as I and other students pay for our respective courses, I feel like engaging a team to do a check for spelling mistakes, isn't asking too much. 
Please, please, please, be more professional and review your reading material before publishing it.

headline: Excellent customer service
reviewBody: The CIPD advisor that was allocated to me (Ciaran) was very professional. He responded in a timely manner and was able to answer all of my questions. He was not pushy to make a sale at all and the balance was perfect between keep in touch with me and giving me time to decide if I wanted to go ahead and sign up. Ciaran offered and sent me through mock log in details so I could see what the ICS learn website looked like which made me feel more confident before committing to anything. Even once I decided to sign up and pay for the course Ciaran has still made it clear that he is always available if I have any more questions for him. I was in contact with a number of different CIPD providers and ICS learn was by far the most efficient and most personalized to me which is why I decided to learn with ICS.

headline: Wish I'd signed up sooner!
reviewBody: Great customer service from Margaret Duffy who explained the ICS Learn process in clear and simple terms, highlighting the benefits to me as an individual, answering all my questions honestly and fairly. Signing up was simple and I immediately immersed myself in the study package, which I've found easy to navigate and full of comprehensive study material as well as engaging tutorials, both live and recorded. I'm over the moon as I'd never have survived night classes! The flexibility of the ICS Learn package is what appealed most. I've already recommended it to a friend!

headline: Very professional service and Paul made…
reviewBody: Very professional service and Paul made useful suggestions tailored to my current situation and future aims. Getting enrolled was very prompt and straightforward. Resources look great and I heard from my tutor within 24 hours of registering.

headline: Exemplary service

headline: experience after a few weeks
reviewBody: It’s been a few weeks now and so far ics have been excellent. The course package is very thorough adaptable and streamlined, with text as well as video content if the student is just not understanding the text the video should nail it but the text is clear anyway. Then there’s tutor support as a back up. What’s not to like. There were no issues at all with my son transferring from an American homeschooling system to his English GCSE’s. Customer service great. All very reassuring so far. Well done ics.

headline: Massively dissapointed
reviewBody: I am currently completing the level 5 Diploma in L&D through ICS Learn. This is my 4th degree (I have 2 Bachelor's and 1 MBA), and the 2nd one done fully online. As a specialist in digital learning technologies, I have to say that the quality of this e-learning programme is of extremely poor quality. The tutor support is minimal - in the webinars, the tutor who seems to have a speaking dysfunction talks about how to complete the assessments, there is no teaching or facilitation of any manner. The programme is very basic and based on the student's reading the articles, links to which are provided in abundance, and writing papers at the end of each unit. There is no interactivity or learner engagement, just literally a page-turning exercise from beginning to end. As an e-learning professional, I find it unbelievable that the course on L&D is completely oblivious to the principles of effective computer-based learning. The content is more HR-related and there is nothing about what I really need to learn - how the memory works, adult learning methodologies, Ruth Clark's principles, Bloom's cognitive taxonomy, brain-friendly learning, Gagne's evens of instruction, etc. I'm hugely disappointed, to say the least!

headline: I feel I've had a very positive start…

headline: Review of online chat service
reviewBody:
This is a review of the online chat service with Eva, one of the ICS Learn customer advisors. 

I had a number of questions around the Lv3 and Lv5 courses and having studied with ICS before, I had high expectations. Eva was friendly, polite and extremely knowledgeable, providing detailed answers to in-depth questions around what the courses entailed. She was also extremely patient with me considering I was struggling a bit following a particularity long shift at work. 

Eva was able to answer questions around the number of attempts allowed for assessments, type of referencing and assignment layouts required for the lv5, info on using arguments, if any video submissions and group working was required, if there were any specific E&W qualifications, if some parts of my lv3 in HR could be used towards the lv3 in L&D specific qualification, discounts available for returning students and so on. All very helpful and much appreciated. Thank you Eva for an exceptional service!

headline: My welcome to my course with ICS Learn…
reviewBody: My welcome to my course with ICS Learn has been fantastic. They came recommended by a colleague and from initial contact with Michelle Kerr to initial contact from my tutor I have not been disappointed. It is quick, jargon free advice and I feel confident I am commencing the right level learning for me. Michelle has been fantastic and made sure I was comfortable with everything, the aftercare since I paid my deposit even has been second to none. She was extremely patient and helpful with my 1001 questions. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend them.

headline: Biggest mistake I ever made
reviewBody:
I enrolled with ICS in December 2018 for a level 5 CIPD diploma for HRM. I chose ICS as they are a well known name. However, it has turned out to be the biggest mistake I ever made...
I was told I could pay the minimum deposit amount upfront (this minimum deposit amount was never confirmed in any email correspondence, only the figure £100 was used in a hypothetical repayment example) or I was told I could choose to pay any amount I wanted so I chose to pay £1000 upfront to take a chunk off of the monthly payments. 
Since I enrolled my marriage has irretrievably broken down and I am now in a situation where I am living alone and about to go through a divorce. 
Due to this change in circumstances I am no longer able to complete the course for both personal and financial reasons.
I have not used any of the course materials or support and have not completed any of the coursework. I haven’t even started the course at all.
I contacted ICS student services to explain my situation and was told that because all course materials and support access had been made available to me I would not get any of my £1000 back and in addition I would be charged a cancellation fee of 10% of the remaining balance for the course + £50. 
I understand that there is a cancellation fee if the course is cancelled after the 14 day cooling off period and I have no issue with paying this and would have expected the minimum deposit amount to be deducted from my £1000 and the reminder refunded.
If this had been the case and for example I had paid £100 deposit I would only be losing £365.50 as opposed to £1265.50. My argument is that whether I had paid the minimum deposit at the start or paid the £1000, all of the course materials etc. would still have been made available to me. So what exactly am I paying £1000 for? 
This situation is completely unacceptable and is very distressing to me from both a personal and financial point of view given the difficult situation I am going through at the moment. 
I trusted ICS as a reputable company but they are just out to get people’s money.
I will be advising everyone I know to stay away from them and not take the risk of handing over their money. 
ICS have no empathy for personal circumstances, no regard for their customers and clearly no interest in being recommended to others. 
I am utterly disgusted.

They understand people have hectic lives and are very willing to assist and support where they can. I cannot fault them for their fantastic customer service!

I'll hopefully be able to now qualify for this learning, and when I sign up for the next course I shall certainly be doing it through ICS.

headline: Very helpful
reviewBody:
I spoke to colin when i called to sort my enrolment on their gcse courses. 
He was very polite and helpful and talked me through the process

headline: Excellent online Level 7 CIPD course
reviewBody: Excellent online Level 7 CIPD course.  Great support provided throughout the course, all assignments quickly assessed.  Detailed information and online books to help throughout each module and in completion of assignments.  Would highly recommend ICS Learn to colleagues and friends.  Thanks ICS Learn for helping further my career!

headline: Biggest Regret
reviewBody: Biggest Regret. The support was barely there, I couldn't attend any webinars due to my work. The tutors were alright, but it was difficult to get across what I was stuck on, and there was never a straight forward answer. The course has ended, unfortunately I didn't even get through half of the course, all that could be offered was for me to pay more money - which I don't have!!! It felt, they have their money, the incentive to help isn't really there. But that is just my opinion, a lot of other people have had good experiences, I think as long as you have the time and possibly part time, you will be fine.

headline: Solid foundation for AAT exams
reviewBody: Find the questions harder than AAT test papers and exams therefore after working through the modules and practice papers your in a good place and confident when sitting exams that your likely to pass. Cant really expect more than that from the training provider.

headline: ICS Learn, CIPD Level 5 Certificate
reviewBody:
I was looking for a possibility to pursue the certificate online and my friend advised me to contact ICS. I am abroad so chatting and emailing were more preferable kinds of communication. 
My course adviser Ciaran was extremely helpful and provided me  with the all information I needed. He helped me to choose the right corse since I was a bit confused and made it so easy to enrol and start my lessons.

headline: Helpful and informative
reviewBody:
Helpful and informative
Andrew answered my queries and was helpful in making the decision to register for the course.
The supportive, no-pressure approach gave me greater faith in the product.
Looking forward to continuing my studies.
Thanks Andrew

headline: Anne Marie made the process so simple…
reviewBody: Anne Marie made the process so simple she answered all of questions and helped me along the way. I was up and running in no time. I thourughly recommend ICS learning to everyone. Thank you very much

headline: Maths course
reviewBody:
I found doing an online Maths course great - I could manage my own time, and fit maths practice into my busy life. The course is clearly structured and is easy to work with. It prepares for the exam extremely well. I though that the combination of the online resources and the utube videos was so effective in getting me understand the subject in depth. Melissa Liberman is very patient and clear explaining the material - amazing teacher, and Ailie who is my private tutor was so helpful and efficient when marking my work. Whenever I had any questions or didn't quite understand , she sent me the links with similar tasks and comprehensive explanations.
I just got my result which is a 9 , very happy with it! 
Thank you for helping me achieve my goal
Olga

headline: My first communication with ICS Learn…
reviewBody: My first communication with ICS Learn was with Anne Marie McGarry and it was very refreshing! Very prompt and thorough responses to any questions that I had. I just need to pass the qualification now!

headline: Melissa Lieberman helped me so much…
reviewBody:
Melissa Lieberman helped me so much through my course. If I had a question to ask she would answer it within hours rather than days.
Second time I've used ICS Learn and both times the tutor wasn't as helpful as I'd like but the online lessons have changed for the good now.
Keep up the good work!

headline: Amazing!
reviewBody:
Ciaran is a lovely CIPD Advisor and very helpful. I had no problems at all, Ray, my unit 1 teacher is lovely, I truly enjoyed the class and she reviewed my assessment on the next day. 

The course is very hard maybe because I haven’t studied for 11 years but I feel confident after reading the teachers review.

headline: The enrolment went very well and I…
reviewBody: The enrolment went very well and I found the online portal well designed and easy to navigate. However, I was unable to join a live induction webinar and the only instruction I was given was to try and join 10min before which I did unsuccessfully though. So, a bit disappointed.

headline: Recommend ICS
reviewBody:
Joining ICS online was straight forward. I had support from Ciaran with my initial enquiry and she supplied me with all the relevant info around the course content and payment plan. 
I would recommend ICS to anyone considering the CIPD qualification as the online course suits me in terms of flexibilty and content. I have also found the online support function very useful with advisors being both experienced and quick to respond.

headline: Great company
reviewBody:
Great company
So far I have had a friendly and helpful service from Anne Marie and her colleagues.

Can't wait to start taking my assessments.

headline: Experience
reviewBody:
Overall my experience of completing a course with ICS learn was very good. Once I understand the system and how to use it, I was able to quickly organise my own ways of working and fit around my personal/work life. My tutors were also very helpful whenever I needed a little extra support.
I would say to improve the system, I would have liked to have seen or be able to look up my course end date at any time to ensure I was keeping on track with my studies as I could not find this on the system itself.

headline: quick and easy
reviewBody: Made signing up quick and simple, made the effort to arrange a time to reach out to myself

headline: Prompt & friendly call following online enquiry
reviewBody: I received a prompt phone call following my online enquiry from a very friendly lady Anne Marie

headline: Level 2 AAT
reviewBody:
I have just signed up to my Level 2 AAT and am looking forward to starting! Anne Marie has made the process so easy and stress free. She has been so helpful and always answers any questions quickly and thoroughly. She is always happy, polite and enthusiastic, which is thoroughly contageous! 
Once signed up for my course, my books have arrived in the post with no hassle. The site is easy to work around and I am looking forward to my first webinar. I have had an email from my tutor welcoming me to the course and explaining everything I need to know. Anne Marie has also touched base to see how everything is going and has kindly left the door open for any further questions! I feel in good hands with ICS Learn, even though the course is distance and I have not met any of these wonderful, helpful people! All in all, I can't fault my experience so far!! Hopefully everything else goes this smoothly!

headline: Easy and efficient
reviewBody: This is my 2nd course with ICS Learn. The course was very easy to enroll on and my course advisor, Anne Marie, was so helpful and efficient. The student community is easy to navigate and tutors are always on hand to help. 100% recommend.

headline: Fifth course but not the last
reviewBody: This is the fifth course that between us as a family, we have used ICS for. Maggie who we speak to in order to sign our son up is absolutely fabulous. She is friendly and always gives you her personal attention. Very impressed with ICS for our children’s home education studies. We would highly recommend them xx

headline: Colin was very informative when I first…
reviewBody: Colin was very informative when I first enquired and quick to send me all the info I needed via email too. I also received an email after I enrolled asking if I needed help with anything. I am impressed with the speed and efficiency delivered

headline: Tutor Support Help
reviewBody: I had been stressing about how long my tutor support would last and fearing I wouldn't be able to complete in time, but one chat to the student support team and my fears have gone!  I had much longer than I thought and if I need to I can extend up to another year - at a fee, but its just good to know.  Thank you Paul M and Sheila F.

headline: Just started learning
reviewBody: I have just recently started to study with ICS and I already feel so welcomed by the team and definitely feel I have the support I need to achieve a grade in my course. I did not receive much support in School but with ICS I already have that full support from them. I have been given lots of important information that shows me how to start my studies.

headline: Highly Recommend ICS Learn
reviewBody: I had been thinking about gaining my Level 2 and 3 Qualifications in Fitness Instructing and Personal Training for some but was unsure which path was best for me to take to get there. ICS Learn stood out for me as it was affordable and it enabled you to gain the qualifications from home with a great amount of support from Tutors and various support services. When I finally decided to enrol all I had to do was enquire and their correspondence was great, I was able to find out the information I needed and all of my queries were answered by the Course Advisor Katy. Would highly recommend anyone looking to gain their personal training qualifications to go through ICS Learn as they seem to have plenty of experience and so far have been great.

headline: I decided to have a change in career…
reviewBody: I decided to have a change in career and found ICS to look professional and affordable. On my first call, I got answers to all my questions and the next steps explained, which happened exactly as I was told. She was polite and friendly and made this big decision easier. I spoke to my personal tutor within 24 hours of being enrolled and have and no problems with anything. Would recommend to everyone.

reviewBody: Nice, friendly welcome with lots of advice and patience when answering questions! I felt a lot more comfortable paying for the course in full due to this and will most likely be completing level 3 AAT Accountancy with ICS Learn once the level 2 is done!

headline: Good help
reviewBody:
Well started with ICS learn at stage 3 of my AAT study, I wanted to study from home at my pace and ICS helped me achieved that, I had tutors for each course who were reachable anytime, I sent them mails and responded as soon as the could,even some went an extra mile to send me copies of other text books that were also relevant to my course which they had assess to, for futher study. They have online classes which helps with interactions with areas I was having problems with. They had there own few hitches but nothing major that could distrub your study if you were focus.
I have completed my level 4 got my result today and I was delighted.
Thanks to all my tutor God bless.

headline: I first spoke with Anne-Marie from ICS…
reviewBody: I first spoke with Anne-Marie from ICS learn in August, she was very informative and very helpful in all the questions I asked her and broke down a lot of the jargon which I liked. I was unsure at first when I contacted ICS as I’ve never done long distant learning before. Then I had an operation so all that got put on hold. Then I contacted her in November and yet again she was very informative and helpful on all our emails back and for and I am now pleased to say I’ve finally signed myself up it do my AAT level 2 in accounting. I would defiantly recommend ICS learn, very helpful and very informative on their courses. Thank you so much Anne - Marie 😊

headline: Organization IS NOT REFUNDING the money…
reviewBody:
Organization IS NOT REFUNDING the money I have transferred TO THEIR ANOTHER ACCOUNT by misleading.
This organization has two accounts on the PayPal: 1. ICS & 2. International Correspondence School. The web page is the same for both, difference is in contact emails and phone numbers (however, the same autoreply for both)
I transferred my first month payment to Inernational Correspondece School account by mistake, instead of ICS account. 
The reason why I got confused is that there was no attention alert that they no longer own the 2nd account. 
After that, it has been about a month I am trying to clarify my issue to get refund for paying PENDING INVOICE from 1st - ICS account.

headline: Quick and easy sign up. Quality materials.
reviewBody:
I carried out a lot of research, with a number of companies, into the course and subject matter I wanted to study so had already decided to sign up with ICS.
I was pleasantly surprised how quick and easy it was to enrol and was able to take advantage of spreading the course cost over 6 months.
Initial sign in was also easy and review of the resources showed a comprehensive level of information, quizes and course text.
So far I'm pleased with my experience and choice of company to study with.

headline: HONEST REVIEW, WOULD DEF RECOMMEND STUDYING MATHS GCSE!
reviewBody:
I have decided to wait until completing my course to review as i wanted to be as honest as possible about my experience. I am always wary of reading reviews as you can never know if they're honest, but i can confirm, mine is 100% honest. 

Although apprehensive at first about studying a GCSE online, I soon changed my mind. I don't think i can praise Melissa Lieberman enough! She is the maths teacher for the course and not only her live/recorded lessons clear, well taught and easy to understand, she will always reply to any questions or queries via email and will go out of her way to send extra materials. I honestly believe she is one of the best. 

The course itself is well spread out, however the only negative thing i will say is that i do believe the dashboard/homepage for the website could be better (ie. less confusing).

I am now enrolling onto an English IGCSE course and can only hope I receive the same calibre of teaching, resources and live seminars that ive had from the maths course!

headline: Stressful customer service that has no consistency and wastes time...
reviewBody:
Very poor system that they have in place and very slow to deal with problems. No urgency, and if a problem occurs they don’t really care that your stuck for time and takes longer than necessary. 

The material is ok. Not the greatest. Some of the tutors use poor recording equipment when recording seminars. Have to really concentrate on what they are saying. The videos themselves can be slow loading, (note my broadband download speed is 33mbps)  I spent most of the time searching on YouTube or google for better explanations. Especially when it came to the anatomy. 

Now for the exam process. You have to call up and book your exam. Paying for it over the phone. This to me is a very old system that can be streamlined. This is limiting you to a certain time period when you can call up. And also if you’re overseas. Unable to pay for your exam. You then have to wait for a “code” to be sent to your email. 
   This entire system as I’ve experinced is floored with human error (got sent code to wrong exam).  I then was sent a code that did not work. And had to wait for next day to inform student service just to be told to wait even longer...

If you don’t mind being messed around a little, and have your time wasted multiple times. Then go for it. But this isn’t a “learning Centre” I’d recommend to my worst enemy.

headline: I really really struggled doing this on…
reviewBody:
I really really struggled doing this on my own. The beginning I found it really hard to motivate myself and this qualification has taken me much much longer than it needed to. 

Some of the tutors, Julie and Keith especially are honestly fantastic. I was lucky enough to be on an older version of the course and meet them both in a class workshop. They are honestly so great, so kind, so funny and really inspiring people. Going on the workshop really helped me but I know that isn't an option on the new courses but I would definitely recommend calling your tutor and getting to know them. They really know their stuff and you can learn so much from them. Julie honestly is an asset to this company - she really is truly fantastic and been the best teacher/tutor I've ever had. Keith is a top lad. 

The customer service team are sooo unbelievably lovely and so helpful. I've felt so stressed this whole time but every time I've ever spoken to them, they've been completely nonjudgmental, so helpful, so nice and also have had a bit of a laugh with some of them which has massively helped me calm down and feel like I can actually do this.

Level 3 is pretty easy and if you're nervous and haven't written an essay in a long time - would definitely 100% recommend do not go higher than level 3! 

I think if ICS can think of ways to bring the community together this would be extremely beneficial. I met people on my workshops and we now have an CIPD group chat and we all have helped each other to finish.

Really met some really wonderful, lovely, great people on this course. I'm so thankful and grateful to ICS. It's been a wonderful experience and would definitely recommend to others.

headline: learning with ICS Learn for GCSE Maths
reviewBody:
I was taking maths for the first time in about 14 years, so this was a challenge for me, but one i was willing to take head on. I must say the structure and pace, that ICS Learn run this course is excellent. There was plenty of content, recorded videos and online lectures, to really get you equiped for the exams. 

The Maths tutuor Melissa in delivering the live lectures and recorded videos was amazing, i'd definitely give her 5 stars. 

She fully explained things properly and always was on hand to answer queries etc.

headline: These guys are amazing
reviewBody:
These guys are amazing! And I really mean it. 
First, their customer service is exceptional, they assist you in every single step if needed. 
Secondly, the course is well structured and easy to understand even for those who are not native english speaker. 
In my case, it happened that working full time and having family committments, I neglected the course for so long that it was about to expire. Even after the extensions, I only had 30 days to do 80% of the course) or I could have lost everything.
But with the help of my tutor, who gave me feedbacks almost immediately after the submission of my assessments, and an extra help from Lauren (student service advisor) who gave me a free extension for a month, I am now ready to get qualified!! I had to work hard, true, but it's happening...
I can't believe it! 
Thank you ICS!

headline: Disappointed
reviewBody:
To be honest I did not really enjoy my experience with ICS. I found the course site quite hard to navigate, I didn't find that there was much guidance on how best to approach the course either. I had a really bad experience with one tutor who I found rude and condescending and was asking for conflicting information to what was required by CIPD resulting in me receiving 2 X NYP for a piece of work in which I had correctly answered the question the first time around. I was finally switched to another tutor after querying this and an investigation finding that he was asking for different information to what was conveyed in the online classroom. 

I also found that on many of the assignments, the question that they asked was very different to the information that they actually required for you to pass the module. This wastes a lot of time and meant having to call the tutors to ask what they actually needed you to answer. On speaking to the tutors they were also aware that the questions were misleading and not very clear. 

I found a lot of the course material to be outdated and little consistency across modules/tutors on the support that they provided on passing the assignments.

Overall I am unlikely to use ICS again as I found this whole process very stressful and more time consuming than it should have been.

reviewBody: I have been looking into completing the CIPD diplomas for sometime now and had spoken to someone else prior to contacting ICS, after speaking to Ciaran it was obvious that I would be completing these courses with ICS. Ciaran was thorough and actually asked me questions about my existing job, which allowed me to miss out level 3 due to this course being about what I am currently doing within my current role. This was not the experience I received with the other company who were more than happy for me to sign up at level 3. Thank you Ciaran for the guidance you have given me.

headline: ICS Learn
reviewBody:
The course content was fine. It is what it is. All the information needed was involved and it was interesting in the most part.
The tutors were kind and helpful and were very good with their feedback. 
Only had one problem with one tutor- Paula- who was plain rude and obnoxious. Sadly she was my first tutor, and it set the wrong first impression for the whole course. Treated me like I was stupid. 
Stephen and David were ace great feedback very good interaction and helpful advice. 
It is a little expensive, but I won’t know the true value of this until later in my life.

headline: I have been studying for my CIPD Level…
reviewBody:
I have been studying for my CIPD Level 3 HR Diploma since December 2017. 
ICS Learn has been great, whenever I've needed help they've been there. 
I originally found the system quite difficult to navigate through, but once I'd sat down and forced myself to read through some manuals, I managed to get to grips with it. All the support documents are there! 
If you aren't self-motivated, then you might struggle as you don't get reminders or pushed by someone to complete the tasks. The responsibility is on you to get it done! 
My time is up in March 2019, so fingers crossed I get everything done :)

headline: Avoid
reviewBody:

There are four other people using ICS in my team who seem to be having a much better experience that I am - so I can understand some of the good review BUT for me Iv had nothing but problems (which is a shame as I actually referred them and many other over the years).

All Iv got so far is extra costs that aren’t clear, complaints that have very long wait times, lack of feedback, technical issues and no actual help what so ever!

Avoid and pick someone who can provide a good service regardless of if your one of ‘the lucky ones’

headline: Brilliant Service
reviewBody:
Brilliant Service

I spoke with Anne-Marie numerous times over the last week and the service she provided couldn't have been better! She explained every process step by step, included some tips of her own with regard to the studies and generally made the sign up process very smooth. All emails were responded to promptly and answered in depth. There was no "sales-pitch" or pushiness that I experienced with other providers, just the facts. My only negative of the process has nothing to do with the service; the opening times of the office are a little unrealistic for people who work full time. 8:30-4:30 was a struggle for me personally, but we made it in the end. I haven't yet started my studies but looking forward to the next year of my foundation course!

headline: I was sceptical of leaving feedback…
reviewBody:
I was sceptical of leaving feedback when I enrolled on the GCSE English and Math course but after receiving my results recently I would definitely recommend ICSLearn to anyone out there and do another course with them in future, if needed. 

I had no academic qualification and it was not until the age 22 that I started learning a language properly - English. However, in the college I was learning, after finishing ESOL Level 2 course, I was told that my English level does not meet the criteria to get GCSE qualification. 

I decided to learn by my self through ICS Learn for English and Math GCSEs. Their courses gives good firm grasp of the subject they are teaching and it is designed in such a way that even someone completely new will be able to understand. And now I am very happy to say that I got A in English and B in Math. 

Thank you ICS Learn.

headline: Feedback on ICS Learn - Support
reviewBody:
So from my initial dealing with ICS Learn, I have found them extremely supportive and highly informative.

Returning back to studying can be extremely daunting but they make the journey very easy, talking you through the process and providing so much online support you would think you were in the class - which is great.

However, I have to say the student support online is second to none - they have always responded quickly to my requests, they navigate you in the right direction and they keep you on track.

If you are seeking a body to study professional qualifications with, I would recommend them wholeheartedly.

headline: I had been thinking about completing my…

headline: For anyone who has been out of education for many years ICS is what you need. Excellent!!
reviewBody:
Can't wait to begin my CIPS training!! For anyone who has not studied for many years (over 20 for me) and want to, but don't have the confidence to get back out there, please speak to ICS and just go for it!! You'll never regret it, you will kick yourself for not doing it.
I decided to self-finance my CIPS training, I decided this was the best option for me, a little scary but so glad I am doing this. I have received excellent customer service so far and this is just in the initial joining stage, this is a great sign of things to come!!
All happens so quickly and easily. I was looking on-line one evening, saw the ICS Learn brand; which was familiar to me, downloaded some information and put in request for a call back. The very next morning I received a call from Nicola, who talked me through the process and explained more about the ICS Lean brand, their background along with their impressive success rate. Nicola was very knowledgeable, answered all my questions, filled me with confidence; I felt that I was making the right decision to self-finance the course, and do this with the support of ICS.
After talking to Nicola, within minutes I received an email from her listing out the course, financials and the service ICS offered. I was sold!!
The process of enrolment is quick and easy, within minutes I received my welcome email, my enrolment details, student number (eek I'm a student again), I also received a welcome email from my tutor giving me some early study tips.
Honestly I am so pleased I have done this and I couldn't recommend ICS Learn highly enough, I wish there were more than 5 stars available.

Please consider this route for home study, especially anyone of a "certain age" who may think going back to education isn't something they have the confidence to do. You have nothing to lose and everything to gain.

Thank you Nicola for all your help with getting me on-board with my course.


Jo

reviewBody: From my first email to Student Services Lauren took my issue and dealt with it promptly, efficiently and professionally. Lauren was informative and welcoming. Nothing was any trouble to Lauren and I felt totally at ease and trusted her in the way she handled my issue. Thank you Lauren, you’re a star 😀

headline: Great help for students like me!
reviewBody:
The ICS Learn was recommended to me by someone. Having visited their website, I requested the course detail and joining procedure through online chat. Fraser responded to all of my queries promptly and clearly with all the requisite information. I joined GCSE Maths and IGCSE English, Science last year. 
Being a mother of 3 kids, it was an achievement that I have got AA in Science, '6' in Maths and 'C' in English. The grades could have improved further, if I would have spend some more rigorous time with the ICS Learn team. I found Webinar method of teaching Maths very helpful and would like to request that this method should also be implemented for teaching other subjects such as English, Science, etc.
Lastly, I am very happy with all of my tutors. They were all very prompt and really helpful with all of my queries. A big thanks to all of them.

headline: what a great service team, so helpful

headline: Is this the future of L&D?
reviewBody:
I have quit on my goal of becoming L&D practitioner after taking the Intermediate Certificate in L&D with ICS Learn. I have canceled my CIPD membership and started a new career. If this is the present of L&D, I don't want to be part of it. In my opinion, L&D should be taught and experienced differently, on a more modern, dynamically and engaging manner.

My experience: It was a very old school one-way training, with no interaction. There is a forum where you can post your work, but nobody gives you feedback. There is just a long list of papers. there is no encouragement to give feedback. There is one webinar you must attend to be able to submit your assignment for each section.
The references suggested to complete the assignments are outdated. I didn't experience a real learning or development, I felt like you just do the stuff to get the certificate.
The portal is not intuitive and complicated to use. Is difficult to find what you look for.
Summary of my experience: I felt it was boring and non-engaging. Definitely not for millennials.
Also, I didn't feel nobody cares if I finished or not the course.

Positives: some of the teachers were really good and supportive. They offer to pay in installments, which was the main reason I chose ICS Learn over other providers.

headline: If you are thinking of doing a GCSE  or A Level dont use ics learn
reviewBody:
If you are thinking of doing a GCSE or A Level I recommend you buy your subject course book and revision guide online you can find all the different exam boards and choose your qualification, I paid for a ridiculous course with ics amounting in the hundreds for no tutor support, awful outdated website and useless online booklets that have to be downloaded at hundreds of pages.  The course booklets were longwinded to give the impression of value for money they most definitely are not, they are time consuming and unnecessary , I found the same information in the GCSE  and A Level subjects book I bought in only a small chapter. You can find past exam papers for all boards all subjects online for free as well as the marking criteria to check your progress. I got a grade A in my subject by using past papers online and saving my time and using only a course book for my subject and revision guide bought for only £10. If there is a local college or a tutor near you use the money on them If you want guidance in your studies.

If you really want to try ics learn use the 14 day guarantee not sure if you will be charged to cancel please check some people on here have said there is an additional £50 cancellation fee which is unfair and not good customer care as they would be charging You money to leave them! You could download all the booklets see if they are of use to you as that is all you are paying for with them. Please do check the cancellation fee before giving your card details.

Ultimately I don't recommend ics learn at all you can do this without them in my experience for GCSE and A level basically anything that has no coursework, please read the other 1 and 2 star ratings on here from people having taken subjects with Coursework to see their experiences.

Ics learn must make millions every year this online learning is very lucrative for them, unfortunately  their service does not reflect what they say they will offer. The five star reviews are truly baffling for this company it may be the first time many people have enrolled on an online course and are pleased with the initial warm welcome from the SALE  ics have made so of course the company will be very friendly. I expect this review will soon be buried under the five stars from new customers asked to give reviews straight after they have enrolled to keep the ratings unfairly high or students offered £30 vouchers to review the company..... potential students please proceed with caution.

Consider the consumer ombudsmen if the service is not what it says it will provide.

headline: Hidden fees, no interest in whether students pass exams, fake reviews.
reviewBody:
1. These reviews are about the sales call, not the courses.  They're deliberately gaming review sites by sending the links and asking for reviews after the initial sales call - so all you're reading are reviews of how friendly sales staff are on the phone.  Of course they're friendly: they're trying to take your money. 

2. HIDDEN FEES.  I've been comparing a few institutions and they specify whether there is an additional cost for marking coursework, and what that fee is.  ICS don't publish the cost for coursework so I had to call them to ask and found out that there is a charge, and it's much  HIGHER than anywhere else charges (for the same qual and same examining board) by a hefty amount.   Interesting that they not only charge a lot more than anyone else, but they also don't tell you how much they're charging unless you know to ask. 

3. I asked for the pass rates for my course and was told this was 'confidential to each student'. I wrote back and explained that an institution's pass rates are not individual private data - I'm asking what percentage of students pass their exams in a particular subject.   They told me they don't monitor this information and pointed me instead at these fake reviews of the college which are actually just reviews of initial sales calls.  
A college that isn't interested in how many students pass their exams?  Students aren't doing GCSEs, A' Levels, CIPDs etc for funsies - surely the pass rate is the *only* performance metric of interest to me, but also to them, how are they monitoring their own performance? Oh, yes, they're only interested in how friendly their sales people are.  Seems like they're not interested in whether students actually pass exams or not. I'll be using Oxford Open College instead - same qualification but less focus on the sales and more focus on answering questions honestly.

headline: I thoroughly enjoyed my time spent…
reviewBody:
I thoroughly enjoyed my time spent learning with ICS Learn.

I enrolled in the CIPD Level 5 Certificate in HR Management in April of last year and submitted my portfolio of work for assessment at the beginning of July this year.

Not only were ICS Learn the best value option in terms of cost, the course content and resources were extensive too.

If I ever had a question for either my tutor / or ICS Learn Advisor, I was assisted in a very timely manner.

I am so glad that I took the leap to complete my CIPD and with this, I have been able to move into my dream HR Advisor role which I don't believe I would have been able to do if it I hadn't used the course to expand my HR knowledge and display my commitment to my career progression.

The student support is more responsive but they cannot really do much at all.

The price is much too expensive for the quality of service. If I knew what I know now I would have invested better. Definitely don’t recommend it!

headline: Absolutely shocking.

After a catalogue of errors by ICS, 6 months later, my results have supposedly only just been sent to to be verified so looking at 8+ months in total from the date I finished. They lie all the way along to cover up their incompetency and don't care! Shocking service and there is no way I'd use them for my Level 7 qualification, or recommend them to anyone.

headline: My experience with ICS Learn is frustrating
reviewBody:
My experience with ICS Learn is absolutely frustrating and if there was less than a star rating, I would give it. In September, 2017, I joined level 5 CIPD diploma for HRM, that decision was based on the good feedback I read about the centre which turned to be a lie and the worst mistake I ever did. The one who handled my registration, Michelle Kerr, was friendly and I thought that would be a good start to pursue my career in HR. However, when I started using the course website, I was totally lost and confused. it was unclear with poor structure and insufficient information to help me make a start. At the first few months, I experienced double payments so, they were withdrawing the course fees twice a month instead of once a month which negatively impacted other payments. I was so stressed every month because of this mistake and had to send so many mails asking to fix it. When I started studying the course, I was trying to communicate with other students, who I found more supportive than tutors or website. Anyways, contacted my tutor to ask for his advice to make an easy start of my course. He advised to start writing my formative and if I passed it, I can attend whether online or recorded classroom then I can write my summative for unit 1. He said if you passed your formative, you most probably will pass your summative. I wrote my formative for unit 1, and submitted it and received my feedback after 30 minutes that I passed it!!
It felt so good and was motivated to do my summative. After attending a recorded class, I understood the structure required and was so confident on what I should do. it took me 10 days of hard work, reading and writing to follow the required structure and finish my summative. I submitted my summative assignment and waited for a whole week with no feedback. I contacted my tutor, Stephen Litter to check if I would hear back soon. I was surprised few hours later after my messaging him with his feedback that I didn't pass because I didn't provide the right structure!!!
The feedback was totally irrelevant and it seemed like he was rushing or didn't have time to read through. The tutor suggested a totally different structure away from the one discussed in the classroom. For example, he said that the SWOT analysis should be in the appendices however in the classroom they said it should be in your assignment body. It was apparent that the tutor didn't take time to have a look at my assignment. For example, he said you references should be in alphabetical order and it was, he said your CPD and PDP should be as appendix although I put it as appendix. The feedback was Vague and non sense, it didn't even provide clear guidance. I achieved distinction in my pharmaceutical sciences degree, and distinction in my MBA degree from BCU and now I'm in my PhD preparation. I never failed a module and I'm confident enough of my academic capabilities and my work quality. 
You can imagine my frustration to see such an unprofessional feedback that ruined my day and my future plans. I REGRET taking the decision of joining the centre and the course and it was such a waste of time and money. Even when I called to complain and ask about the process of quitting the course, it seemed like they only care about paying the cancellation fees and 10% of the remainder. Is this the way you tackle your customers' complaints? Should this represent a respected body such as CIPD? Is this the kind of service you provide? Is this the quality of education you offer? 
Im totally disappointed and frustrated in the way you deliver your service or handling complaints. I paid the money to quit the course just to get rid of this improper, unprofessional, poorly structured, demotivating and disappointing course and centre. 
I will make sure I spread the word among all my family, friends, organizations and every respectful website to help people avoid the frustration I'm experiencing now. I will be more than glad to help people distinguish between good service and poor service.

headline: The course was very good

The content of the course was very interesting. Sometimes however, the modules were lengthy and it got quite difficult to retain the information being learnt. I wonder if the sessions could be more interactive with an interactive quiz at the end of each module to complete to confirm learning.
With the summative assignment, it was not very noticeable that you needed to read a case summary to complete the assignment. I actually completed the assignment before realising that a case summary was available so had to restart which was frustrating, but I recognise this was my fault. Could it be more obvious that the case summary needs to be read i.e. putting a line in, in the summative assignment and link to read the case summary?
Thanks for your support and I would recommend to use you

headline: Having just completed my CIPD Level 5
reviewBody:
Having just completed my CIPD Level 5 I have mixed feelings about the quality of the course from ICS. Before starting the review, I should advise that the course was substantially cheaper than it's competitors and as the certificate is issued by the CIPD there is no difference in the value of the certification.

Point 1: I had issues with the setting up of a direct debit at the start of the course. This resulted in a payment being taken twice in one month - not really acceptable.

Point 2: I have received support from student services in the last month or so. Louise has been particularly helpful. The service in this respect was very good.

Point 3: Some of the modules were very well written (Employment Law and Reward Management come to mind). Others were not so well written, and made the learning experience really frustrating

Point 4: The online classrooms are infrequent and at very awkward times. Recordings of previous classrooms are supplied - which I had no choice but to use as an alternative in most modules. ICS really, really, really need to invest in quality microphones for their tutors. Some of the classrooms were really difficult to make out what the tutors were saying.

So all-in-all I would say that the comparative value compared to competitors is very good, but there is lots of room for improvement.

headline: What really annoys me is...
reviewBody:
ICS learn is a great platform, the only that really annoys me is that they don't clip a video to each module. To understand it better you have to go through different pages to find the YouTube link, put in a password and then watch the video. 

With every cloud has a silver lining, I have found a YouTube channel called Maths Antics which explains everything very simply which suited me perfectly. 

Also to add, when you click on a link to a video, you have to download a ridiculous media player which seems it was programmed in the 80's. 

I recommend sticking to YouTube as its quick, convenient and easy to navigate.

headline: Amazing Support
reviewBody: My experience has been amazing- after lots of years away from education i was apprehensive about writing essays etc again. The flexibility of the course is amazing, I’ve managed to do this alongside a full time job- two role changes and Buying a house in 12 months! The support is incredible, the tutors are always on hand if you need to talk something through and never make you feel stupid. the online resources are all you could need, including the online classrooms which are great, and enable you to ask questions and also observe others questions. I wouldn’t hesitate in doing another course through ICS. I didn’t feel isolated during the course, I was apprehensive about distance learning but the beauty of it is if you aren’t in the mood to learn on that day/evening- you can do it when you are!

headline: Make sure to cancel your Direct Debit…
reviewBody: Make sure to cancel your Direct Debit at source.  Request a full invoice history for payments made and double check.  Many times I have been quoted prices, exemptions etc and they change.  I have overpaid for my AAT membership this way and incurred bank charges after contract cancellation due to poor internal communication.  An example - I was offered 2 months extra time to finish as I told them I was leaving (as in they won't get my money anymore).  However, months before with copies of all my certificates from Doctor I had to beg for an extension and pay a fee to Doctor for certs and only got 3 months.  6 months is the maximum.  PTSD and I couldn't get a 6 month extension with proof to help me finish my studies.  Say I am cancelling and what is my last fee - oh you can have 2 free months.  There are better options at a lower cost if you are studying AAT or Accountancy.

headline: GCSE Maths with ICS learn
reviewBody: I work with ICS Learn on a maths (GCSE) course. This on-line course is based on live lessons (and recordings) by a maths teacher. This really gives the sense of being in a real lesson, which means studying from home is a bit less abstract. Melissa Lieberman explains mathematical concepts very clearly and logically, approaching problems step by step and often relating abstract concepts to day to day issues. Her friendly approach means that I feel I can indeed ring or email her, or my own tutor, when I have further questions. All in all, a very good course.

The webinars working alongside each assignment were somewhat useful but I did find some of them verging on tedious.  As an L&D professional, I found myself querying how these tutors were not "walking the talk".

reviewBody:

I could not imagine me poring over eBook for the entire course after I had left high school so many years back. Try include video lectures to make it more interactive and make it easier for us that are returning to school after a while.

headline: I recently enrolled in the Level 2 Gym…
reviewBody:

Philip was extremely helpful and he made the process of signing up very easy. After I had requested a brochure, he immediately got in touch to offer a chat about the course and answer any questions I had. I had already made up my mind about enrolling so Philip arranged a time later the same afternoon to run through the process and sort out payment. He was very friendly knowledgeable about the course. It was also nice that he followed up with me by email to let me know the next steps straight after our call. 

Very happy with everything so far and I'm looking forward to getting started on the course.

headline: Excellent customer service
reviewBody:
I fell behind with my studies and also my monthly instalments by months.
I contacted student services to see about reinstating my course and see if there were any options to help me get back on track with payments.
Brian Lawson, the student service advisor who replied to me couldn't have been any more helpful.  He spoke with understanding and compassion towards me and my situation and arranged for me to carry on with my studies where I had left off.  He also set up a new monthly direct debit to continue my payments so I would not have to pay the full outstanding amount up front, which wasn't a viable option for me.
I'm now looking forward to getting back on track again and know that the support is there should I need it.
