headline: money grabbers- don’t care about supporting education
reviewBody: After agreeing to 22 payments for a CIPD in HRM at 0% interest, I reached approx 15 months in and discovered that despite paying for the course for 22 months, I would only have 15 months to complete it. Working full time meant I had not made as much progress as I thought I had still plenty of time to complete the course. The only option to extend was an addition £60 per month to enable me to complete the course which is about 50% of the monthly course fee! The same time I also discovered I was pregnant and discussed my options about reducing payments and extending the payment term as I did not wish to give up the course despite now starting a family. ICS did not support the change in circumstances at all and refused to extend the payment term, extend the period of access to the course, nor reduce monthly payments. As a result of this I had no choice but to withdraw from the course as I cannot make monthly payments on maternity pay, I cannot complete the course in the short few weeks left (any work etc wouldn’t get marked), and to top it off I was then asked to pay a cancellation fee. £2k of course fees spent on nothing - all work I had done to date is lost and even if I had completed it I wouldn’t get the qualification until the end of the 22 month payment period, despite only having 15 months access to course content.

It's has taken over 2 months for my completed work to be handed over to CIPD but I'm not even sure if it has yet.

Pros:
Can study at your own pace

Cons: 
Waiting time to get Assignments marked is horrendous and can impact study period support,
The waiting time between finishing the course and getting the qualification is actually a joke. A lot of money has been paid yet us students are waiting.
PebblePad app thats used for Video assignments has major flaws

headline: ICS Learn
reviewBody:
UPDATE: (10/04/2018)
I've been in touch with student services to discuss my issues and all has been tied up. My assignment was resubmitted and marked the following day, and support has been given in terms of time management. I have now gladly changed my rating from 2 stars to 3, as I still think that there is a way to go with the website and resources. Sharon Smith (Head of Student Services) has been wonderful in helping me get back on track with my course.

The initial sign up was fantastic, very quick and easy and the chap on the phone knew what he was talking about. Since then, it's been down hill. I asked for support (i.e. helpful guides/time management assistance) as I've been struggling with finding time since a restructure at work (now a higher workload, plus coursework), but the response was really unhelpful, simply telling me the price list for extending the course deadline. I've also been waiting 8 months to have an assignment marked, and customer services are (again) very unhelpful, telling me it isn't there, when it definitely is. Tutors are quick to respond to questions, but I don't feel confident enough in ICS to continue my studies once I've finished this course. I will be looking for an alternative provider for the next level. I completely agree with other reviews stating that ICS only care about their income. The student community has changed a few times recently and none of them in a helpful way. I've been on the course since April 2017 and it still makes no sense to me. It's very poorly laid out and the resources may as well not be there. I do not recommend ICS Learn

headline: Great communication and service
reviewBody: I was uncertain whether to continue my CIPD studies with a previous provider or give ICS Learn a try so contacted a member of the team via the chat function on the website to discuss. This was quick, convenient and allowed me to gain instant answers to my questions whilst browsing the website. Paul Martin could not have been more helpful or more informative in answering my questions. Following our chat Paul then provided me with follow up information via email, allowing me to make an informed choice in my own time. There was no hard sell (as with other providers I have been in contact with) which I found reassuring. I am looking forward to getting started on the course content and feel less daunted at the prospect, knowing that the ICS Learn setup allows for far greater flexibility than I experienced with my previous provider. I would highly recommend getting in touch with them to discuss their CIPD courses.

headline: No Pressure
reviewBody:
I obtained an ICS Computer Information Systems Diploma way back in 1994 and it served me well with 22 years in a Middle Eastern Bank where my tax free salary was higher than some UK CEOs. The certificate was worth its weight in gold.

Now I am looking at a recognized Accountancy qualification to supplement my IT and Retail Banking experience, so ICS Learn seemed the obvious choice to me.

I found the current team at ICS Learn much more communicative than the early days, but not pushy. They allowed me time to make my mind up and consider my options. There were no pestering phone calls. Really friendly and cannot be more accommodating when giving advice or offering solutions.

headline: Very helpful and friendly
reviewBody: Very helpful and friendly, i would recommend ICS to friends and family as they are patient and do not push you into anything. they support you into making the right choice for you. headline: Very Impressed

When I was ready to get started, Dafina was a friendly voice at the end of the phone, ready and willing to answer my questions and the registration process took 5 minutes.

Having never studied online before, in the beginning I was debating a lot over which provider would support me best.  I have to say it was the interaction and support that I had from Dafina and her colleagues that made me certain I've chosen well and I cant wait to get started!

headline: Absolutely Brilliant tutorials
reviewBody:
Melissa Lieberman is great! 

She has introduced the maths topics in an easily understandable way, explaining things clearly, providing a great introduction to each topic area as we have gone though lessons. 

I'm working on Unit 3 at the moment and it has occurred to me that I wouldn't consider doing another GCSE or A-Level online course without the aid of video tutorials as Melissa's lessons have really improved the learning experience for me. I say that, as I have recently completed both Geography and History IGCSE and the difference between those and the maths has been considerable. 

I was hoping to do A-Level Maths with ICS Learn in the future but I wont consider doing it until they deliver the content in a similar way as Melissa does. 

More of the same please! 

Thank you Melissa.

headline: Buy a textbook and save £400
reviewBody:
I used this for A-level maths. It cost me nearly £500 for the information that i could have found in a £30 textbook. The only reason I went for this instead was for the fact that I would have a tutor that would answer my questions. Generally it would take my tutor a week to two weeks (or even at one point two months!) to answer my query, and oddly enough by that point I had usually continued on to a different question.

I would suggest if you are doing a course without coursework that you get a textbook and use youtube for further explanation. The fastest response I've had was 5 days, it's a complete waste of money.

The student dashboard looks about 15 years old and is the most un-user friendly web application I've ever had the displeasure of using. Thank god they have a (costly) cancellation option. If you're reading these reviews for distance learning, do yourself a favour and don't bother.

headline: I've unfortunately lost faith with this…
reviewBody:
I've unfortunately lost faith with this company. I'm hesitant to complain as, from all the other reviewers, mine doesn't appear to be the usual experience students receive.

Twice I had organised with my advisor a telephone call to enrol and both times I've waited for the call with no joy. I'm hardly surprised the second call didn't materialise as my advisor emailed me in error, thinking he'd emailed his colleague. He proceeded to ask him if he could "call this one", regarding me and my scheduled enrolment call. Hence, the colleague never got the instruction to call me. I also didn't really appreciate being referred to as "this one". I hadn't complained over the first missed appointment, as I know problems arise, but now two missed appointments and I'm disheartened.

Sadly, after these further oversights I don't have the confidence with ICS to trust them as course providers. If they show this little management at this stage in the enrolment process, I'm left wondering how much support I would have got once I had started my studies.

Perhaps I had a lucky escape before I had parted with any money. I've given 3 stars as I had been given some useful information and literature regarding the course and I cannot comment on the actual course structure and teaching.

headline: Easy to use, excited to start.
reviewBody:
I've recently enrolled on the GCSE maths and IGCSE science course. Colin, the advisor I spoke to, was more than helpful. I initially spoke to him via live chat, where I explained I couldn't take a phone call at that moment, but he took my details and said he would call me at a time convenient to me, and in taking my details, would make the process quicker. He called when agreed, and his tone was very polite, very happy to help, and answered all my questions in detail and to my complete satisfaction. I had confirmation emails instantly, and my tutors emailed me less than 24 hours later to introduce themselves. The whole process was stress free, clear and easy to navigate. I look forward to completing my GCSE'S and to begin my journey into teaching. 
Thank you.

headline: AAT level 2 with ICS
reviewBody:
I Joined AAT level 2 with ICS last September and often wonder why I bothered! The tutors have 3-5 WORKING days to response to emails which basically means a week. This doesn't help when you have an exam that week and need a quick turnaround. 
After a pretty bad start, with a tutor that was no help, I contacted one of the higher up Management (Catherine) and fair play, after a lengthy phone call or two, I was given a new tutor, and she listened to me rant and to be fair that was a bonus after what I had experienced. My new tutor is ok and is a lot faster at responding to emails and makes more sense when she does reply, however I think I have just lost faith in the company after the initial start and have also enquired about cancelling my tuition, (as I rarely use the website as I get more information and clearer pictures from Youtube and fellow students on Facebook) but of course they want to charge me for that. 
I am counting down the minutes til I finish level 2 (10 weeks) so that I can go over to another supplier for level 3, who guarantees email responses in 24 hours. I cannot wait!

headline: Love ICS Learn
reviewBody:
I have tried a different platform before starting with ICS Learn and the difference is astonishing. I am receiving generous support from both Melissa and my tutor Stephen. It's fantastic to have two points of contact. The online platform is great (another big improvement from the heavy stacks of paper I received from my previous learning provider). The lessons have good explanations and ease into topics at a pace which suits me. I also watch Melissa's recorded webinars and enjoy them very much. Melissa has a warm and relatable teaching style which makes the course enjoyable and the material easy to understand.

Some minor points for improvement; I would suggest upgrading the interface, just making it a little more user-friendly, with clear icons for the different features. I know that other providers require test papers to be sent by post, so I appreciate the option to upload them online. However, the process of uploading each file took a little too long.

 Thank you.

headline: CIPD Level 3 Diploma - Great fun and very informative
reviewBody:
I selected ICS Learn after reading positve reviews and having just completed my CIPD Level 3 Diploma in HR practice I can also say that I have been thoroughly impressed.  Despite being distance/internet learning you still develop a great relationship with your tutors through webinars, assignments and contact options, they are passionate and very knowledgeable about their subject, and you get to liaise with other students too through forums and social media.  The course has opened my eyes to the size and value of the HR profession - but I think the units covered are beneficial to anyone who wants to progress in their career particularly in management roles.

Ultimately I've learned a lot and it's been great fun - thank you!

headline: Straight forward and simple.
reviewBody: I enrolled just a few days ago so I can't fully comment on the course just yet but I want to say that Colin was very friendly and patient in helping me to enroll over the phone. There was no questions asked (except to ask if the loud meow he'd heard was an animal in the background!) and no upselling to other courses. Straight forward and simple. Thanks again.

reviewBody: I very much appreciated the support & advice from Student Service Advisors having been ill for some months and subsequent concerns about whether or not to continue studying, but was able to make a practical decision to continue with their help.

headline: I would highly recommend ICS Learn as a …
reviewBody:
I would highly recommend ICS Learn as a study centre for CIPD qualifications.

 I have passed the CIPD Level 5 Diploma with ICS Learn and the support from my tutors has been amazing.  

All tutors work in the HR industry so their advice is up to date with current thinking and methods.  After each assignment their feedback is fair and constructive which can be applied to other assignments.  

The materials on-line are up-to-date and easy to understand and apply to the coursework.  

The workshops are a great way to meet other students and HR professionals - excellent networking opportunity. The shared learning can be transferred to support the essays.

are extremely helpful and provide a real life school set-up feel, but better paced and easier to understand.

headline: A Very Good Experience with a Couple of Very Small Issues.
reviewBody:
When comparing the providers that offer CIPD - ICS had a special deal on the CIPD course, as I was paying for this myself this was a big decision in helping me decide, the sign up process was easy and hassle free and then the work could begin, 
I had access to the old student community but I believe it has been significantly updated, it was easy to navigate and it was easy to access all the coursework and textbooks, there are one or two small issues that I have to mention, 1st - the classes run once a week or once a fortnight or once a month, this can be inconvenient if you haven't looked before starting a unit, on hindsight I would definitely recommend looking at the next 3 units ahead to see when the classes are so you can plan your schedule accordingly. 
Also one other issue I found was there was a few technical problems with the online classrooms, where they are cancelled at very short notice, this did happen to me a few times and while understandable can be frustrating, the actual classrooms themselves are extremely helpful and very much worth attending, but sometimes the times are very inconvenient so you need to be aware of this as well, for example the class on the fortnightly schedule will be at 12.30, which isn't practical for everyone or one is at 10am and one at 11am so I had to take half a day off work for them.
One final thing worth mentioning which I don't believe is mentioned on the course prospectus is that some of the later unit's require you to enlist volunteers and record video sessions, I did struggle to enlist volunteers so I'd make sure that you are able to do this, but as a last resort you can do a webex session (which I luckily didn't have to do)
 All of the lecturers are really nice and very helpful and offer plenty of encouragement and good feedback so no complaints there and ICS allow payment by direct debit monthly which is also very helpful.

All in all it was a very good experience and I do recommend ICS but there are just a few small things that prevent me from giving 5 stars. If I could 4.5 out of 5 I would.

headline: Professional, fast, friendly and reliable
reviewBody:
I have enquired my course IGCSE English with Maggie in a couple of emails. She was reliable, professional, friendly and so helpful. One of the reasons I had chosen ICSLearn was also because how they made everything so easy for you. I felt like they really did wanna help me from the first email we’ve spoken. Everything went smoothly which I’m really satisfied with the service and staff. 

The price range is also reasonable. I can’t complain anything about this. 

I’ve talked and enquired with a lot of other online providers, I can confirm that ICSLearn is a great online learning provider. 

The payment set-up plan was easy, non-complicated. I have just started my course last month. So far, so good. I like that you can print out the course in papers. Student community isn’t so active between and amongst students - but that’s just quite common in online study. My tutor Anna is a great teacher. I received her reply within 3-4 days, which is fast. Learning materials are updated and great to follow. What I like the most is that there’s a self-check and assignments to do after each topic. And plus I can access my course from my smartphone as well. A huge asset as I don’t always feel like sitting in front of my PC all the time :) I enjoy my course. 

Too bad they don’t offer IAL in science subjects for Edexcel board. Otherwise, I’d have definitely enrolled for more courses with them too!

Recommend to anyone who’s looking to do their IGCSE or any other courses with them. Staff is so helpful, they don’t let you feel ‘alone’. 

THANK YOU MAGGIE.

I’ll update again after my Summer exams how it goes.

reviewBody:

I have spoken to a variety of providers whilst researching options to study my CIPD qualification and ICS were by far the best, nothing was too much trouble and it was even better that there was a variety of platforms to contact them on, e.g. online webchat, phone, email, etc. Dafina in particularly was incredibly helpful and provided a great amount of information and support throught the process. headline: CIPD
reviewBody:
I'm currently studying my CIPD Level 7 with ICS. It's good that you can work at your own pace and it's largely self-directed, but the downside is that no-one checks in with you as to how you're progressing, and how much time you have left to complete the course.

You can start your course at any time you'd like, which is great for flexibility, but I've previously studied with other providers who assign you to a group which creates a sense of community. ICS do have student rooms, but they're rarely used and so it can feel a bit isolating at times.

A lot of the content in the ICS study guides is outdated (some case studies over 13 years old and that's not helpful for using as evidence in exams in 2018, and there's not a lot of new approaches and thinking eg I'd love to see some content on evidence-based practice and the decline of viewing correlation as equalling causation). Some of the study guides read as though they were written a number of years ago, and are just re-churned out each year, which is disappointing given the price of the course.

Both student services and tutors are very helpful and responsive, and assignment feedback is given in a timely manner.

headline: they are fantastic
reviewBody:
they are fantastic, and they are the only company who has live webinars, I have A level math course here and I love it, our tutor Ms Melissa Lieberman is professional and she made it easy to learn math.
I am so picky and I searched a lot to find a good company, I don't care about price I only care about quality and I have to say this company is far better than those who charges 650+.
if another company with higher price could deliver a better quality course for sure I would pick that one, but there is no other company with better quality than these company, they are perfect.

Also my tutor Iain Howie who grade my assignments , he check assignments carefully and gives helpful feedbacks , its not like just roughly look at them.

I strongly suggest ICSLearn specially Mathematics course.

headline: BEWARE OF THIS COMPANY
reviewBody:
BEWARE OF THIS COMPANY. THEY WILL ROB YOU BLIND. I HAVE LOST OUT £115 FOR ABSOLUTELY NOTHING!!!

I am very very unhappy with this company. I recently decided to go back into studying. I signed up for my Maths GCSE. Unfortunately I realised 21 days after signing up that it was going to be too diffcult for me to study while working full time and looking after my daughter as I am a single parent. 
I had already paid a £65 deposit. I called the company and asked them if I could cancel and hopefully try again with them next year to complete the course. 
I explained my situation to the lady and asked if I could possibly get some refund of my deposit. To my dismay she said "No, you will actually be charged an EXTRA £50 CANCELLATION FEE!!!" 

I explained to her that I had not accessed any materials or taken any of the tutors time. She was not sympathetic at all to my situation and really did not care that I had told her I was hoping to come back to the same company next year. Even when i told her that I would never think of coming back to the company to do my course she said "ok thats fine" like she really didnt care.

PLEASE PEOPLE BE CAREFUL OF THIS COMPANY THEY REALLY DO NOT CARE OF YOUR SITUATION THEY WILL TAKE AS MUCH MONEY AS THEY CAN FROM YOU.

Very helpful, gave me all information on how to start and what's going to happen next, also ensured I'm not left with any questions.

headline: Smooth start

The customer service and support has been amazing so far, and I expect it will continue on like this throughout the duration of my studies with ICS. I spoke to a really friendly and helpful lad called Philip on the web chat at first, and then soon after on the phone. I knew what I wanted so there wasn't much to ask from my side, and it helped that Philip covered everything so well in the first place! :)

I've got my recommend read I ordered from Amazon, this morning in the post (eager!), my pens and notepads, and I've just been assigned my tutor - let's do this! :)

headline: Online lesson with Melissa from ICS Learn
reviewBody:
I had an online lesson with Melissa Lieberman.  It was my first online lesson, so I was quite nervous.  Melissa welcomed me and encouraged us all to join in as little or as much as we wished.  I found the content, well planned and easy to understand.  The delivery was very professional and Melissa is easy to listen too and approachable. All in all I had a great interactive experience and would recommend it to anyone.
Many thanks
Simon Croucher

headline: 2nd year studying with ICS.
reviewBody:
I used ICS Learn for the CIM Marketing course, I completed Level 3 and now I am starting Level 4, which is a good sign of their service. 

Their website is well designed and easy to use, however once you enrol as a student, the student site is not as pretty or as well functioning. There are sometimes bits missing/spelling mistakes. Despite that it is still practical and ideal for its use in studying. 

Their customer service is brilliant, whenever I have had to contact them they have been really helpful. Patient and helpful staff.

The price for the course is great value and you can overlook the cosmetics of the student site with their pricing. I even received 10% off as a returning student. The monthly interest free payment help too.

Flexibility of starting the course when you wish is also a great advantage with ICS. Would definitely recommend.

headline: Good but could do better
reviewBody: If I could have given a rating somewhere between average and great I would have, as that would be a more accurate representation of my enrolment.  I didn't experience any 'friction' but I do feel that responses to student's individual queries are very scripted and statutory.  I enquired about exam costs and got two very different variations in prices from two different people which wasn't at all helpful.  I also asked about local exam centres for private candidate and was given just one link to the Edexcel website.  I am sure that these questions are regularly asked and a little more research on ICS's part to provide more specific information could really help save students time and make the enrolment process smoother.  In relation to the information I've gained since enrolling and via the online learning resources - so far I have been impressed,

headline: Great help and advice!
reviewBody: In looking at whether to choose ICS Learn as my course provider, and also the type of course I wanted to do, I had lots of questions. Anne Marie was absolutely brilliant in answering these for me. She was swift in coming back to me, but not pushy or 'salesy', and made the time for me around my schedule to help. She understood my situation and was able to give great advice on the course and how to undertake it. Thank you so much for helping make the decision to further study and for the practical advice that you've given. A brilliant service, which might have otherwise deterred me from doing anything about the course.

headline: Quick and easy to enrol online
reviewBody: Quick and easy to enrol online - would use again.  Obviously I have only just started the course so cannot comment on that.

headline: Great customer service
reviewBody: The customer service I have received throughout the process of signing up to a course has been fantastic - I was provided with a wealth of information and the offer of phone calls at a time that suited me, and there's no hard sell or pestering for a decision. Would not hesitate to use ICS Learn again.

headline: The enrolment procedure was very easy …
reviewBody: The enrolment procedure was very easy and clear to understand also if was by phone. The person who I talk with, Philip, was professional and answering to all my questions.

headline: A Great System
reviewBody:
ICS Learn provided an opportunity to study a subject I otherwise wouldn't have been able to - in a fast and accessible way. The Course Advisor, Colin, was able to give me reliable and extremely helpful advice to decide whether it was the right choice to make, and I'm confident that it was, through the form of ICS.
Overall, it is a great system which provides what could be the next step to your future, and doesn't make a fuss of doing so.

headline: Enrolment process
reviewBody:
Enrolment process was very quick and simple. I was given all of the details from Philip, a course advisor and he was able to answer all my questions. 
The enrolment call itself only took 5 minutes as I had been given all of the information I needed prior to it.
Definitely feels me with confidence for the rest of the course!

headline: Andrew was great
reviewBody:
Andrew was great and really advised me well. He was friendly and professional.
Thank you very much

headline: 100% recommended
reviewBody: Great Introduction to the course! They covered everything I needed to know and they have been very supportive towards achieving the qualifications I am aiming for. I had an online webinar with Melissa where she gave valuable information and went further to make sure everyone knew what they had to do and how to book our tests. Both teachers Jennifer and Melissa have been a great help. answering all questions and giving advice on how to move forward after the course. I would highly recommend ICS learn as you get more for your money here and you notice that they genuinely want to help you succeed and not just take payment.

headline: Very polite and very helpful

headline: The course was very convenient however …
reviewBody:
The course was very convenient however the community was frequently not working due to updates, some of the marking was a bit delayed and the employer relations section classroom was no help so I watched it once then did my own work completely asking the tutor for assistance more than I should have .
Most of the other classrooms were excellent and very helpful especially those with Julie. 
Pebbllepad was terrible to use and far too time consuming 
I would use ICS  again

headline: The service workers are the best! No doubt. This is very essential.

Fraser Cameron he didn't abandoned me even if I was not be able to answer or contact back for how many days because I was out of the country in America. He was still keeping in touch with me by sending some emails about ICS learn and how will it benefits me etc... A text for confirming whether I have received the emails or not. Good thing I was then available and I came back to my home. Afterwards, I quickly informed by emailing back to Sir. Fraser that I'll be very delighted to join in. The response was so quick as well.

headline: Positive Initial Experience

Information provided was clear and helpful. Overall the impression ICS Learn has given me is positive and convincing.

I would recomened anyone who is considering their options to get in touch with her, she is more than happy to help!

From my experience so far, I am extremely confident that I have made the right decision choosing ICS Learn, and I am excited to get started with the course! Thank you again, Anne Marie!

headline: Excellent, really enjoyable course
reviewBody:
It was a bit daunting learning on-line at first as I was concerned over the level of support I'd receive.  However I needn't have worried.  The tutors are great, very friendly and give very useful feedback.  The online classrooms are really useful.  The live ones are best if you can join in as it gives the opportunity to ask questions as you go, but sometimes it's not always possible to catch one so having the recordings is handy.
The course content was really good, I really enjoyed the study, and it covered all the aspects I'd hoped for which will certainly help me with my future career.  I would most definitely recommend ICS and CIPD.

headline: ICS Learn CIPD
reviewBody:
I found the enrollment with ICS Learn onto the CIPD Level 5 Diploma course to be most informative and straight forward. The CIPD Advisor Michelle Kerr was most helpful and patient with me as I over the course of several weeks, went through a list of questions about the course and the cost.

I'd recommend ICS Learn with no hesitation and much of this is thanks to Michelle.

headline: Very polite
reviewBody:
Very polite. 
Very motivated. 
Very keen.

It took a few emails and a couple of phone calls to get going in the beginning. 
There are a few mistakes and inconsistencies with the content (grammar, spelling, structure, and clearness).

Still, it's refreshing to know that they are human :) I think I would recommend ICS Learning... so far at least.

headline: psychology course
reviewBody: Great service, very friendly staff and its all very easy to use.

headline: Excellent teaching and thoroughly enjoyable Maths lessons
reviewBody: I am part way through GCSE Maths and really enjoying learning with ICS Learn. I think Melissa Lieberman is a fantastic teacher, she explains everything so well and - although I'm watching a recording - still makes me feel part of the group. She takes time to make sure that everyone fully understands the lesson and has a way of making you feel reassured if you are uncertain. Learning online fits in so well with working part time and being a mum. I'm so pleased I decided to take the plunge and retake Maths after years of regretting a poor Maths O'level result.

headline: ICS Learn GCSE Maths online lessons with Melissa Lieberman
reviewBody:
I would certainly recommend ICS Learn- GCSE Maths online lessons to anyone, who for whatever their reasons want to undertake their GCSE maths via  e-learning. I did CSE's at school, and always had a fear of numbers. However, I have done several courses since my late thirties including, NVQ L3 and 4 in childcare, GCSE English and Science, Foundation Degree in Childhood Studies and a BA (Hons) Top up. 
Both of my degrees were also online through my local university using Moodle. 
The reason I chose this route for this maths course is because it fits in with my family and work commitments. I also believe that as we get older we learn because we want to and therefore, it is great to find other options for those of us with busy lives! There was no pressure to contribute to the lesson if you did not feel confident to do so, but the tutor Melissa Lieberman made me feel at ease, she is also at the other end of an email or the telephone to offer her students support, which when you decide to finally face your fear of maths at the age of 48, is very important.

headline: Really good service from Ciaran

headline: Just started a course with ICS Learn …

headline: Great help from a lovely lady named …

headline: Good Content but Poor Guidance
reviewBody:
Firstly, I believe the course content was good and easy to follow. The system was also fairly easy to use, although sometimes it was difficult to know what you needed to do.

I was incredibly disappointed with the instructions/guidance given and I had to query things with my tutor and student services at almost every step of the way. A couple of examples:
1. When I came to upload my assignments, the guidance advised me to remember to upload test papers and my ILM cover sheet. My main issues were that a) I had no test papers and b) I wasn't given a cover sheet. When I spoke to student support, they advised that processes have changed and the instructions hadn't been updated. Apparently, this was the first time someone has highlighted this issue to ICS, although I notice things still haven't changed. Obviously submitting work can be very stressful and this added frustration didn't help.

2. There isn't really any guidance to explain how you're actually meant to upload your assignments and I don't really think it's straight forward.

Overall a great experience and I am really excited to start my new course.  Can't thank Ciaran enough for all his time and help.

headline: My success story with ICS learn
reviewBody:
Where do I start?....

This is going to be a long review, however it will really show you the amazing work ICS do especially Melissa Lieberman and my tutor Stpehen. 

When i was 16 (2 years ago) i failed my GCSE Maths with a grade G, When i revealed my results to my teacher, she told me that it would be a waste of time to re-sit my exam and it would be IMPOSSIBLE to pass. I was teased for having bad grades in my exams, I have never liked maths, to be fair I HATED IT WITH A PASSION.


One day I decided that i wanted to re-sit my exams, The comment my teacher made was my motivation to prove to her that it is possible for me to pass.

I came across ICS Learn online where i decided to join them (end of 2016), WOW! The best decision i have EVER made. The online lessons by the AMAZING Melissa Lieberman helped me soooo much, i would look forward to Tuesdays and Thursdays (for the online lessons) , the lessons made you feel as though you were part of a classroom with other fellow students trying to achieve their own dreams. Melissa (the best teacher on this planet) would make the lessons sooo easy to understand and if i never understood anything i would email her (where she replies so fast) and helps me to understand anything that confused me.

The assignments and online tasks as well as the help of my amazing tutors Melissa and Stephen helped me sooooo much.

Melissa was my motivator she NEVER made me feel as though i was stupid or thick she really raised my confidence in maths and fed us soooooooooo many tips and tricks to help us with our studies. I cannot explain how GREAT the resources are at ICS Learn and the proof of how amazing they are were in my grades...

Fast forward to today: 24/08/2017, I went to pick up my results this morning and I passed (foundation maths) with a 5!!!! (old grade B), I would never have thought i would love maths as much as i do now, i would never have thought that i would pass my GCSE maths. All thanks to the amazing Melissa and Stephen as well as the people working at ICS, they reallly made my dream come true and i am sooo happy that i decided to join ICS Learn because without them i would never have fell in love with maths as much as i love it now.


If you are umming and ahhing on weather you should join ICS, I would say DO IT!!! You really will not regret it. 

Thank you soooo much to alll the workers at ICS ESPECIALLY Melissa and Stephen!!!!! You really made my dream a reality.

headline: Beware of the "payment plan"
reviewBody:
Payment options advise a payment plan with a small deposit, Full amount taken as soon as you put in your card details.

Edit: After a phone call on Monday they quickly resolved the issue, it took 7 days but the payment was returned with a promise of a clearer payment setup to reflect that you have to actually phone them direct to pay via installments.

headline: ICS learn-Fantastic, friendly, affordable
reviewBody:
Margaret, the lady I spoke to was brilliant. I initially spoke to her through the online system they have for communicating on the website. 
When I explained what I wanted to do, she explained how easy everything worked, and how the courses are now all online so can be up and  running pretty quickly. When I said I wanted to go ahead straight away with my maths GCSE but not the other courses just yet, there was no pressure to sell other courses to me  which I liked.
She said if I was happy to go ahead she could ring me in 10 minutes to take my details and enrol me as I wanted to pay in instalments,and she rang when she said she would!
It's fantastic that ICS learn don't penalise people who aren't in work either as most distance learning providers will only allow you to pay in instalments if you are in work. I'm disabled therefore on a low income so it is brilliant that I can still afford to study with a provider like ics as colleges are no longer an option for many disabled people as you have to be able to be seeking work to get reduced rates for courses or take out very expensive government loans if your over a certain age. ICS makes studying affordable again so thank you!! 
Margaret was lovely on the phone, gave me all the information i asked for, and said I can contact her if I need to know anything else. 
I'm really excited to get started on the course and I can't recommend ICS learn highly enough to anyone who wants to further their education, whatever their age. I'm 42 and giving it a go still! 
Also if I want to add further courses i can get a discount off them which is an added bonus as I know I will want to do that at some stage!

headline: Disappointed and confused
reviewBody:
At the point of signing up I had excellent support and guidance and was easy to enrol. The course advisor was very professional, friendly and patient and answered any queries I had.

After signing up and enrolling I felt very let down. Some of the information on the course brochure was incorrect and misleading information. I was given 2 sets of course structure, one was the study plan and the other was on the student community site, both of which didnt match, giving different plans and left me confused as to which module to start off with. I raised these 2 points with the team and they have confirmed it was an error made on their behalf.

headline: Margaret was a fantastic help while I …
reviewBody:
Margaret was a fantastic help while I was umm-ing and arr-ing about enrolling in the course.  She gave me excellent advice and didn't push me into signing up and very helpfully gave me guidance on the payment options that were available.  

My initial contact with Margaret was on the phone, however, later I utilised ICS's online instant message advice system where she continued to answer my questions in a very knowledgable, yet accessible manner.

headline: Excellent website
reviewBody: Excellent website, easy to use with all the info required. Very helpful on telephone with nice manner. Received confirmation emails in no time. Brilliant!

headline: Learning for the mature student!
reviewBody: I started the level 5 course but lost my way when I had a very close bereavement, ICS were very understanding and flexible.  I got back into my studies and have to thank all the tutors I had dealings with, Eileen, Kathy, Keith and Jon.  I had trouble understanding some of the jargon and the questions but when I contacted the tutors, they never made me feel stupid for asking.  They simplified things for me and took all the stress out of writing the assignments.  Their support was great and I couldn't recommend ICS enough, especially for the older student who hasn't studied for years.  I'm 56 by the way!

headline: Dafina Krasteva has been fantastic …
reviewBody: Dafina Krasteva has been fantastic through my journey with ICS so far. I felt worried about needing additional time to complete my course but Dafina put my mind at ease and has helped me throughout. I can't thank her enough!

headline: Quick and efficient service.

headline: Course Adviser A Star!!

headline: Very high standard of customer care, in-particular Dafina Krasteva
reviewBody:
I made a call to ICS learn when originally inquiring about CIPD through online learning.  I was a touch uncertain around many items on the course times, content, structure, costs, flexibility etc...  This was straight away washed away when I was passed through to Dafina Krasteva who was so knowledgeable in every area that I had uncertainty over.

Every question I had was answered clearly for me with additional detail and information along the way.  At the end of our first call I literally had every piece of knowledge available for me to make the decision on studying online or not.

If I am being totally honest Dafina was the determining factor behind me deciding to go with ICS learn.  I had many options available for this study route (college, uni, other home study, etc...) but it gave me huge confidence in ICS learn by the knowledge and supportive manner in which I was dealt with from the first call.  The company has high standards of customer care and this is clear in every contact I have made to ICS learn.

This for me was the significant decision made, comfortably knowing that any future support I would need or questions I may have would be with an approachable/supportive tutor/team/company.

headline: Good service
reviewBody: Good service, clear, fast and friendly

headline: I have found them very flexible with course options, and payment plans
reviewBody:
I have found them very flexible with student needs regarding variety of options of courses, and also specially the payment plan options. 
It easily spreads the cost for me to manage my expenses during my studies and work.

headline: AAT Level 2…
reviewBody: I first looked at doing the Level 2 AAT course about 6 weeks.   Unfortunately I wasn't in a position to start then.   Anne Marie was extremely helpful and understanding and said to come back when I was ready.   No pushing me to enrol there and then.   I had looked at the same course with other companies but they became pushy for me to enrol.   Therefore when I was in a position to enrol I came directly back to ICS.   Your company are also very compatible price wise, infact I would also say that you offer the same course, but far better price wise,especially for someone on a budget.   I am now looking forward to starting my course.   Thank You.

headline: Easy and pleasant transaction
reviewBody: Easy and pleasant transaction

headline: Margaret
reviewBody: Efficient, knowledgeable, friendly . What a great way to register with this Lady

headline: Alternative experience...
reviewBody:
Alternative experience...

Whilst my experience may be different from others, my advice would be to only contact ICS if you can immediately enrol on to a course and have capacity to respond to emails/messages with 24 hours. 

I am yet to complete a course with ICS so I cannot comment on this, however, I do not appreciate their approach in gaining new clientele, the constant messages were too much especially juggling a busy work/life balance, I felt as though I was being chased for a committment I was yet to make. 

I have heard good things about the actual courses, but for me buuilding good rapport with a client is a must.

headline: I have just enrolled onto the on-line AAT Certificate 2
reviewBody:
I have just enrolled onto the on-line AAT Certificate 2 with ICS Learn. 
I had looked this course up at various other providers, but when I contacted ICS Learn I initially spoke to Anne Marie McGarry who was so helpful and really put me at ease. 
She took the time to answer all of my questions and made the choice to go with ICS Learn really easy. Having someone to speak to made it really easy to enrol and Anne Marie made the experience personal to me, not like she was just dealing with another client. 
I would be happy to recommend ICS Learn to anyone else who was thinking of enrolling. 
I will hopefully be starting the course shortly. 
Many thanks again to Anne Marie for all her help. 
Kim Keen.

headline: Maths GCSE Customer Feedback
reviewBody:
Hi
Very positive experience today.  I have enrolled on a maths course, something I have been meaning to do for many years.  Margaret was very friendly and helpful.  The service was fast and professional.

headline: Outstanding tutor Miss Lieberman
reviewBody:
Melissa Lieberman has been an outstanding tutor through supporting me with the new Maths GCSE. I specifically found the examples she works through during the live sessions beneficial because they progress from introducing a skill to applying a skill against a GCSE question/ context. I was concerned that I may have struggled learning the Grade 7-9 topics through a webinar, however the breakdown and explanation of skills by Melisa perfect. Patience and understanding is shown where you do not feel like you are in the deep end. 

I have emailed for support on 5 -6 occasions and Melissa has always responded quickly to help explain a topic or check a calculation or point me in the direction of further examples/ resources. The support provided felt like I was just visiting a tutor down the road. I would certainly recommend taking a qualification with ICSLearn and further praise Melisa and the team for their support and delivery.

I will return again,

Best Regards

Sam

headline: Excellent Customer Service
reviewBody:
My Grandaughter signed up and paid for a course with ICS Learn but because of Mental Health Issues was unable to carry on.  I spoke to them and they were more than happy to consider looking at reimbursing some of the payments.

There was a bit of a delay, so I phoned them yesterday and spoke to Douglas Brown, Finance Advisor, who told me that all that was required were Bank details so the reimbursement could be processed.  Apparently an e-mail had been sent to my Grandaughter, but I wasn't aware.

I just want to say that it is such a change to be dealt with so efficiently, and to speak with someone who actually 'listens' before trying to pass you on to someone else!! Very rare these days!!

Thank you Douglas and ICS Learn

headline: Excellect service from Samantha
reviewBody:
I've been in contact with Samantha since August 2016, she's been nothing but a delight to deal with, letting me know all costs from the get no and letting me know of any hidden fees if any. 

Despite wanting to go with ICS learn purely for their prices and them offering the course I wanted to do, their reviews really do shine above other online learning providers; outstanding. 

It was a pleasure dealing with Samantha throughout the many months of preparations to enrol onto the course.

A thoroughly excellent service provided.

headline: IGCSE English Language
reviewBody:
I signed up to complete the IGCSE for English Language. I studied hard and worked through the materials and completed the Tutor Marked Assignments are required.

The tutor seemed nice enough although spelt my name incorrectly on every feedback sent back to me even though I have clearly entered it on my submitted work and spelt it correctly myself. In the first assignment, ironically a spelling assignment there was a spelling mistake in the feedback.

The feedback on individual assignments was very poor, it was very minimal and not very descriptive on how to improve, just a few lines on what I did wrong, nothing about what I did right. I had to go back to the tutor more than once asking for clarification on what was required.

Being a distance learning provider I feel they do not really grasp the pitfalls of distance learning and the level of support that is required.

I got through the course and I am happy with my results, unfortunately it turns out that what you achieved means nothing at all to ICS as you have to arrange your exam separately anyway and they is no recognition at all of your work completed with them, no certificate to confirm that you have completed their course work or anything, I find this a bit sad and it makes the statements that they are really not that bothered at all.

It served a purpose completing the course with them but it was more me than them and I paid for the privilege of it when I could probably prepared myself by looking online rather than giving them the money.

headline: Very impressed with the speed in which …
reviewBody: Very impressed with the speed in which the enrolment was handled.

headline: Thank you for making this process very …
reviewBody: Thank you for making this process very straight forward and easy to understand. Mr Cameron was exceptionally polite and professional, explaining the process very clearly making sure that I understood everything before enrolment.

headline: I am doing a personal trainer gym …
reviewBody: I am doing a personal trainer gym instructor course at the moment. I have had nothing but technixal problems when it comes to exams and confusing instructions when it comes to practical filmed sessions in the gym. The ength of time it takes for anyobe to get back to you when you have to ask something is ridiculous. Very poor support. It is very difficult to get through and I wouldnt recommend doing a course this way.  it looks like my deadline will run out before I have time to finish and I guess they will make me pay more to continue. Although it seemed cheaper in the long run it is going to cost more and I wish I had just done the course through other means not online. Incredibly frustrating!

headline: Great customer service
reviewBody: Great customer service. Friendly and approachable

headline: Swift marking but poor support and communication
reviewBody:
The salespeople are very good at signing you up but the support is extremely minimal with no proactivity in checking progression or reasons why you have not submitted final assignments.  Without telling you, your access is disabled after 9 months, again with no communication.  When I contacted them about this I was advised that I had to pay to access the site and therefore submit my final assignment.  I completed and passed my assignment and heard nothing for nearly 7 weeks so contacted them after logging on to see an incorrect grade and no access to any other information.  I have been advised that my assessment will go to the EV within the next 8 weeks and then it will be a further 8-12 weeks for certification. Had I not contacted them, I doubt that this would have been picked up.

A terrible user experience from my perspective, although the response from the assessor was always very swift.  It's a shame about the back office processes and the support on this distance learning course.  It's not cheap and was wholly disappointing; it wasn't worth the effort of re-doing this level of qualification.  I would not recommend ICS Learn.

headline: No help for Mental Health
reviewBody:
I enrolled on a HR course 18 months ago and after enrolling I was diagnosed with depression and anxiety.  I advised ICS on numerous occasions that I wasn't able to do the course and I wanted to cancel, they did put the course on hold for 3 months but I am still not better and do not have the mental ability to do the course, I have asked for a refund or for the funds to be transferred to another course but I have been told No.  I have paid nearly £1800 for this course, I have reviewed the course material once and instantly knew I wouldn't be able to do it.  They don't appear to have any support for people suffering with mental health issues.  I could have cancelled my direct debit which I did but they also threatened me with debt collectors which is not what I needed so I continued to pay.  Not Helpful at all.

i have tried contacting student services on a number of occasions and they havent helped.

headline: Great service!

headline: Made on line enquiry and was contacted …
reviewBody: Made on line enquiry and was contacted by Michelle within 24 hours. Talked me through the options and helped organise the splitting of the payment with my company without any hassles - highly recommend

headline: I feel embarrassed for choosing ICS
reviewBody:
I would just like to advise you to consider other distance learning providers. My experience with this learning provider has been an unsuccessful waste of time. They continue to take money from me, knowing that I have no intention of using or continuing the course. I am reaching out to other potential students to give them a heads up before they end up in a similar situation to mine.
 ICS are pretty high on my list of unethical organisations at this point. Their customer service and complaints department were dismissive and I felt ridiculed so I don't contact ICS anymore, instead I have been reaching out privately to individuals to reconsider before signing a contract. After speaking with other potential students, I can confirm that ICS are very keen to get signatures and money before fully understanding the customers situation and suitability for a course. 

When I first complained, there was no mention of the cancellation procedure and cancellation fee and by the time I dug up my cancellation rights, I had already paid for everything.






[Edit] in response to ICS reply:

when you read the public reply from ICS, keep in mind that I gave feedback on several different issues which lead to my dissatisfaction. See how the organisation latch onto one issue which they are insistent on dismissing and going as far as to blame me.

Feel free to contact me if you have any further questions about the company, I have spoken to other customers who have also been let down by ICS and it is important for me to make sure that people know what they are getting into.

headline: So far, so good

headline: Second course with ICS

Andrew, the course advisor, has been so helpful with the sign up process for both courses I've taken. My tutor has also been thoroughly brilliant, knowledgable and quick to respond to queries. Studying from home is not for the faint-hearted, but if you're motivated and willing to put the time in, then the ICS team a more than willing to help you succeed.

Word counts were hard to achieve because the assignments are so vague, it's hard to know what to include and what to leave out.

headline: GCSE Maths - Melissa Lieberman Lessons -
reviewBody:
I am currently studying GCSE Maths as a mature student.  Melissa Lieberman's maths lessons are extremely useful and have enhanced my learning immensely.  She is very personable and explains things clearly with plenty of examples, offers advice on further learning and I enjoy taking part. It feels as though you are part of a group without leaving your house as the live lessons are interactive through the chat box.  If you miss any lessons or wish to revisit, they are online or can be found through Youtube, so you can study anytime convenient to you. 

This is the second course that I have taken with ICS Learn (last year I studied IGCSE English Language and gained a Grade A). I shall not hesitate to study another course through ICS Learn next year.  I have found it fulfilling and extremely enjoyable.

headline: Worst company ever
reviewBody:
Awful experience studying cim marketing course with ice learn. They were late giving feedback on my draft which meant I had three days to make a lot of changes which isn't easy when doing a full time job. The tutor was awful and very unhelpful. Studying this course has been very stressful because they are useless. 

They messed up my assignment enrolment and I had to play piggy in the middle to ICS learn and CIM because ICS refused to take calls from CIM. 

They might be cheap but if you actually want to pass go with a more expensive provider as you will probably get more support.

headline: Fantastic Service!
reviewBody:
I had various different things that had happened both at work and personally that meant not being able to concentrate on my studies. I was worried that I wouldn't be able to complete the higher level course in time and I would waste all the money spent. 

I phoned up asking about the possibility of a transfer to a lower level course and i had no trouble at all, all the cost differences and repayments plans were sorted out there and then and I received a confirmation email the same day.

Darren was very understanding and had no problems with sorting everything out quickly, cheerfully and efficiently. I couldn't fault him.

My course advisor (Ciaran)was very knowledgeable and was very patient in explaining everything to me.
He did not rush me to make a decision to enroll but gave me time to think about the course and get back to him in my own time.
He gave me enough materials for me to make an informed decision.

headline: Thank you, ICS Learn!

headline: Amazing service

headline: Very satisfied

headline: Smooth sign up, great course

headline: The staff were extremely knowledgeable and helpful.
reviewBody: I found the staff knew the answers to my questions and were able to provide me with honest advice.

headline: Fantastic Customer Service!
reviewBody: I was treated so well kept up to date via email every step of the way. Would highly recommend to anyone.

headline: Basic with little support
reviewBody: This service truly is a sole learning experience! It took far too long for responses on questions and even then it seemed either vague or passed on to somewhere else. Ithe isn't for as long as they say either after 12 months you lose all access which seemed ridiculous when I was told I would have 3years. It was all a bit of an expensive mistake. Honest recommendation would be find an evening course in a college it's cheaper and you have better interraction

headline: Level 3 HR Diploma
reviewBody:
I have been doing the Level 3 HR Diploma through ICS for just over a year now and am around 80% of the way through.
Prior to this I hadn't studied for 10 years and was a bit dubious about distance learning.
All in all it's been a great experience. The personal tutors and student services have, on the whole, been extremely helpful and I have never felt as though I was unsupported, which was one of my initial fears.
I would recommend ICS to anyone, as you get good support, it fits in around other commitments and I'm well on the way to getting a qualification that will benefit my career.

headline: ICS Human Resources Diploma
reviewBody: Julie, Paula and David were the best tutors to work with. Really helpful and made you feel at ease. Workshops were enjoyable. Portal was a bit iffy sometimes and I had a module missed off which I only discovered after talking to another student. Never had any issues until the last month but I did hear that they were undergoing a lot of change.

headline: Great Experience
reviewBody: Very friendly, and helpful service, making my experience very easy and also enjoyable!

headline: GCSE Maths
reviewBody:
I have found the course content, videos and online sessions to be really great. They are informative without being condescending and lead you through so you can maximise your learning. The videos are led by Melissa Lieberman who does a great job co-ordinating all of the course content and delivers it very well. 

I'm enjoying the course and I feel like I'm making good progress, I'm finding being able to pause, practice what Melissa has said and then continue with the video's to be a great way to move forward.

Highly recommend!

headline: melissa lieberman - maths
reviewBody: doing my studies online, I thought it would be very difficult, but luckily with such brilliant teachers, i.e Melissa Lieberman in mathematics. Fabulous!!

headline: ics works

headline: Excellent!
reviewBody: I do really enjoy ICS Learn as it is extremely user friendly!

headline: Transactional
reviewBody:
Hi There,

The whole process is about getting numbers signed up. I am yet to receive any log-ins yet and I've set the whole weekend aside to start studying for this which I can't do without my log-ins... There is also zero support function for ICS over the weekend which is appalling since most people will take the weekend to study for this...

I didn't take up the course immediately, but got back in contact with Michelle after about 4 months to reconfirm my interest. I was really keen to get going quickly at this point, and Michelle picked the details back up straight away and got me registered as soon as possible. I'm really excited to get going, and am so pleased with the service I received through Michelle and ICS.

headline: Getting started

headline: helpful and easy

headline: Enrolment.
reviewBody:
Enrolment was nice and easy and the ICS advisors could answer any questions. 
Many thanks.

headline: Convenient if you can't commit to a day in college and value the flexibility
reviewBody:
I chose to complete my CIPD qualification through distance learning as my circumstances meant I couldn't give up one evening a week to attend college. My initial, on-boarding experience was fine. I attended two workshops in London as part of the course - one worthwhile, the other a frustrating waste of my weekend :-(
Negative: My criticism of the course from my personal experience is inconsistency of advice. For example, for one module I watched an online classroom, attended a workshop which was held by a different tutor and a third tutor actually marked my assignment. I received three differing sets of guidance/feedback about the same assignment!
Positive: I liked the fact that I could complete the modules in the order I chose and set my own deadlines. The tutors and mentors respond to email queries promptly and my assignments were marked within a couple of days (if not hours) of submission.

headline: Excellent service.
reviewBody: I enquired about a HR course and quickly received an email and voicemail from Paul. He was very friendly, knowledgable and understanding. I enquired with a few companies about the same course but ICS Learn gave excellent customer service, have extensive knowledge and offered a fantastic payment plan.

headline: CIPD Intermediate Diploma L&D.
reviewBody: Ciaran was very helpful in assisting me to enroll.  He provided clarity to my question which was very helpful.

headline: Great
reviewBody: Maggie Duffy was very helpful and quick with replying back to my emails and asked all my questions.

headline: CIPD Level 3 Diploma in HR Practice
reviewBody: I spoke with Paul Martin as ICS Learn who gave an exceptional service from our first conversation to deciding to commence the course. He went through everything in great detail and also allowed me access to the portal to ensure I was comfortable with it and it was right for me. He took care of me every step of the way and has asked me to contact him if required throughout my learning journey. Totally different experience from speaking to other providers about the course who continue to hound me, this is not something you will get from ICS Learn. Easy to speak to, no harassment to join, really easy to set up and affordable payment plans. Highly Recommended!!! Thanks Paul

headline: Experience of ICS Learn

I had previous qualification that ICS were more than happy to accept and start me on level 3. Looking forward to getting started. Thanks

headline: Information was very clear and the process was straightforward.
reviewBody: I decided to use ICS because their website is clear and provides all the information needed. Email communications have also been prompt and helpful.

headline: Great service
reviewBody: I put an inquiry in and received a response from Margaret within the hour. The eMail asked for a suitable time to contact me. Margaret called just after 4:30 asked about my inquiry and it was dealt with promptly with and I enrolled on to my course. The following day Margaret followed up to make sure all was ok and it was.

headline: Initial course introduction
reviewBody: Great chat with Maggie, she was extremely helpful and explained everything to me clearly which made me feel comfortable to go ahead and enroll on this course. Pleasure speaking with her, thanks again

headline: Absolutely brilliant!
reviewBody: Ciaran McEachen my CIPD Advisor was absolutely brilliant and very helpful. His careful explanations of the process and enthusiasm has already got me off to a great start. I am very excited to begin learning! Thank you Ciaran!

headline: 5* customer service
reviewBody:
I had decided this was the career path I wanted to take. I received a very friendly email from Anne Marie McGarry introducing herself and giving me more information on both ICS and the course itself. I asked about how much the course was and any additional fees over email and had an instant response. Although I had every opportunity to speak on the phone it wasn't convenient for me at that time so we discussed a few things over email. 
Even through email, she was very approachable and lovely to speak to. 
My husband then phoned for me to arrange payment. Quick, easy and simple with a personal touch.
I very much look forward to my studies! Thank you

headline: Meh service and won't be using for my AAT Level 3.
reviewBody: The Osborne books that were provided as part of the course fee were really useful and the mini-tests were good however overall I'm not sure that I got good value for money. I paid £840+ for this course and received books relating to the first 2 of my 5 assessments (worth £15-17.99 each) but I later had to purchase the books relating to the rest of the course and revision guides direct from the osborne website priced at £5.99 each for 5 revision guides and £11.99 each (when bought online) for the remaining 3 books. Most of the online content either just referred to a page in the books or was just a hyperlink to the AAT website. The pros are that there are discussion forums where you can talk to other students online and you can send a message to a tutor if you have a question but I only used this service twice. The customer service at the start when I first enquired was very friendly but I once I'd started making payments I felt I was just left to it; no follow up call to check on how I was doing/If I was happy with the service (which ICS say they will do). I got no information about who my "tutor" was etc so i'm not entirely sure what my £800+ fee paid for since I had to purchase most of the guide books myself, most of the "learning" sections on the ICS website simply referred to the book and the most helpful content and mock tests were on the AAT website anyway. I've nearly completed my qualification but don't really feel that I was aided much by ICS and today I have tried to log in to my account to update it with my exam results so far and found that they have disabled my account and cut-off all access a few days earlier than the stated end date. I intend to take my AAT Level 3 this year but will just purchase the books from Osborne directly and use the fantastic study support, e-learning modules and mock assessments provided by the AAT website for only £90 a year, saving me approx £650+.

headline: Great service
reviewBody:
I would highly recommend ICS Learn, I had a difficult personal situation to deal with and I was fully catered to. 
I feel they really cared about my situation and on-going learning.

headline: Simple excellent service
reviewBody: Just set up my student account. The process could not have been more simple and easy. Margaret was very friendly, and there was no way she could have made things simpler for me. Such a good start and makes me feel very optimistic about studying!

headline: Ciaran McEachen
reviewBody: I googled online HR courses and ICS Learn came within the first few results. I looked at the courses offered and the reviews and got in touch. The person I dealt with was Ciaran McEachen and he was really helpful throughout. Having explained a  bad experience with a previous online course provider to Ciaran, he gave me access to the course content and answered, promptly, all my questions. This together with the positive reviews and the fact that the course is CIPD was what led me to enrol

headline: Fraser Cameron
reviewBody: Fraser was very patient and understanding in the way he guided me through the processes of studying online.  He was a big help and I would recommend him to peers who might want to go down the same path as me.  Thank you very much Fraser!!!

headline: Great advice received
reviewBody:
I went online to find out more on the CIPD level 3 foundation course. I first spoke to Paul Martin on the live chat service available. Paul was very clear and quick to answer my questions, and followed this up by sending me an email confirming what was discussed, and providing me with the CIPD pack about the course.

I found the information provided and the level of service given by Paul was excellent, I didn't feel pressurised or harassed into making any on the spot decisions.  I would definitely recommend this service and Paul as an advisor to a friend.

headline: Very Friendly and helpful.
reviewBody: Was extremely helpful in helping me decide on the right level to go in at. I felt like nothing was too much trouble as me and my dad took a few days to discuss and decide the best course to take. Defiantly recommend ICS support team if you are unsure and need advise on finding the right course for you.

headline: ICS Maths online Lessons
reviewBody: Melissa Lieberman is a fantastic Maths teacher who really breaks down the lessons and explains things clearly to help all levels to understand. I have found that watching Melissa's lessons and then following it up by doing work from the books and online links given by Melissa I am able to understand and work through even the hardest of subjects. The support given in invaluable and they really want you to do well . I would highly recommend ICS for Home learning especially the Maths team.

headline: online lessons for GCSE maths
reviewBody:
Today I was able to take part in a live lesson and I found it really easy to follow and understand. Usually I watch the recordings, that are easy to follow too, which can be watched as often as needed.

Thank you so much for these lessons, I just wish there were ones like this for the science GCSE too

headline: A Great Path To Choose
reviewBody:
ICS Learn gave me the opportunity to improve my Maths and English skills, where I successfully completed my courses. All thanks to ICS Learn's excellent teaching, as well as the access to several resources and materials, I passed my English to further progress on my career. The good thing about this online facility was I could learn in my own pace and time.

I would recommend ICS Learn to all students because it is a great way to learn and achieve your GCSE's.

headline: Review on phone call
reviewBody: Yes, very clear information I received by ICS, was very good at answering my questions and she knew what she was talking about, and got the impression that she was a patient person. Recommended.

headline: Generally quick and efficient
reviewBody:
No major problem during the course. Some contradictory guidance between different tutors though, would be good to make sure that everyone agrees on the ways to complete assignments.
Overall good support from ICS, easy to reach thanks to the chat available.
Good experience, good organisation to work with.

headline: Excellent communication
reviewBody: Excellent communication and support provided by my course advisor. She has a professional manner and is very helpful.

headline: Level 5 Diploma in HR Management
reviewBody: As a new student I found the enrolment process very easy and straightforward. The CIPD Advisor for ICS was really helpful and she answered my queries clearly both on the telephone and by e-mail.  I contacted ICS a few months ago when I first started thinking seriously of changing my career and I wasn't hassled or pressurised by repeated follow-up calls which I have experienced historically with some providers when you enquire about courses.

headline: Mrs Lieberman is the best maths teacher
reviewBody: after having hard time with maths, I didn't understand where the numbers came algebra was my enemy, I signed up for ICS learn for maths, Mrs Melissa Lieberman is an excellent teacher who teaches with hard work and effort and most of all a nice big smile that makes my day. Now, when my parents ask me how did you get this number in an equation I don't say ha? I know and understand; I explain as it is my profession. Thank you so much Mrs Lieberman, I will surely sign up again next year :¬)

headline: So helpful!
reviewBody:
I dealt the Ciaran from start to finish. Could not have been looked after any better. Ciaran was able to answer all my questions clearly and consciously. 

I feel extremely satisfied with the whole transaction and if I had to do it all again, I'd know who to go to

headline: Helpful and friendly staff member.
reviewBody: Fraser looked up local exam sites for me as I am 75 and would not want to travel too far. Great too hear there were two within a short distance.

headline: Good Service on an intresting subject
reviewBody:
So far I have had quite a good experience with with ICS learning. 

Colin, my tutor seems like a friendly and approachable guy, and is pretty quick to respond to my email. 

All my documents were sent through quickly and everything seems in order. 

I feel I have enough time to do my studies, without been too stressed. 

However, one small issue, was the payment plan. When I bought it online, it automatically took the full fee, and did not offer the payment plan, which I wanted to take. For me this is not a massive problem, but it could be for other learners.

headline: AAT level 2
reviewBody: Unfortunately I had a rather bad experience on my course as my tutor did not help with any questions that I had in a timely fashion, she often took more than the advised 48 hours to respond and at one point responded after my exam. I hope this was a one off bad experience that I had with ICS distance learning but I did go with another course provider for the next level as I was pretty unhappy with the level of help I got from my tutor.

headline: CIPD Level 5 Query and assistance
reviewBody: Excellent assistance and course review provided by Michelle Kerr. Thank you for making my enrolment journey so simple and quick.

headline: Excellent service.
reviewBody: Michelle has been excellent from start to finish with my enrolment. Thank you so much for your help!

headline: Helpful
reviewBody: I feel assured that my decision to go with ICS Learn was correct as they were extremely helpful and patient

headline: Prompt, attentive response
reviewBody:
I was promptly contacted by Michelle from ICS Learn to go over my interest in an online CIPD course at their centre.
She was very helpful in providing all the information needed, as well as addressing any concerns and queries I still had.
Michelle also managed to help me have enough time to think their option through before coming back with a decision. 
Overall I was happy with their caring and professional approach and look forward to interact with the community, and support staff as I start my online course.

headline: Excellent communication and information
reviewBody: By far the most helpful and informative communication provided on the course content, how the course would be delivered, the support available to me, costing and payment options and all the information on testing centres I have access to, even the parking considerations at the centres.  No hard selling tactics just straight forward information provided and answers to the questions I had to ask.  A pleasurable experience!

headline: ICS induction webinar
reviewBody: Melissa was very friendly and helpful in the webinar. Made us feel very welcome! Also makes ICS look like a company that cares about their students and the website is very professional too.

headline: Friendly and thourough Indroduction with Melissa Lieberman
reviewBody: Melissa led a very laid back and thourough webinar. She answered every single question in great detail and made everyone in the room feel very comfortable to express any concerns or anything they were unsure of. I now have a good knowledge of the ICS Learn community and I feel confident that all areas of the website and process were covered sufficiently. Thank you, Melissa!

headline: Competent in self study then ICS is for you
reviewBody:
From the start of the course your promised a personal mentor who can't actually assist on the specific assignment questions and are suppose to keep in contact with you regularly. 

With ICS you pay your fee and it's totally down to you to stay connected. With no deadlines on assignments or real interaction it's very easy to feel neglected. 
The tutors are fine however the impact from a telephone conversation to how a tutor in a classroom would explain things is very different. 
The feedback on the assignment is very poor and doesn't actually help you to improve academically if your not that strong in the area. It's more like a text box exercise for the tutor. 

You don't get a personal touch from ICS or the tutors. 
This is a different way of studying and not for someone who hasn't studied in a long time as well as never done home learning before. 

If your confident in your studying abilities then go for it 

CIPD Level 5

headline: Service
reviewBody: Great service throughout my whole experience with them and would highly recommend to anyone.

headline: Very easy and clear

reviewBody: Melissa is a fantastic tutor and explains everything in a simple and straightforward manner as well as spending as much time as everyone requires to understand each lesson. A credit to your team.

headline: Enrolling on a course
reviewBody: It was my first experience to enroll on the course. It went very well and i signed on there and then. Can't wait to start on my course.

headline: easy registration
